loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnes operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market, where she sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María es una mujer viuda de 68 años de edad, mujer solitaria, no tiene hijos, vive sola, depende de su negocio de venta de alimentos y venta de mercancía para sobrevivir, a pesar de las dificultades es una persona que nunca pierde la fe, siempre lleva dibujada una sonrisa en su rostro, es la fiel representación de una mujer guerrera que no cae ante las dificultades.
María hoy quiere solicitar el apoyo de la comunidad Kiva para comprar surtido de productos para abastecerse, buscando una sostenibilidad de su negocio, dicho préstamo será para la compra de productos de uso persona, y surtido de alimentos para elaborar productos fritos, harina, carne, papa, vegetales, entre otros.
texts.en:
María is a widow, 68 years old, a solitary woman, who doesn't have children, lives alone and depends on her business selling food and selling merchandise to survive. Despite the difficulties, she is a person who never loses faith, she always has a smile on her face, and she is the faithful representation of a warrior woman who doesn't fall in the face of difficulties.

Today, María wants to ask for the support of the Kiva community to purchase an assortment of products to stock up, seeking sustainability in her business. This loan will be to purchase products for personal use, and an assortment of food to make her fried products: flour, meat, potatoes, vegetables, and more.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of foods to make fried products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Rev. John, age 47 years, is married and has four children, aged 24, 22, 19 and 15. He lives in Nyakabirizi, Igara Bushenyi district in Uganda.

This is his second loan cycle with UGAFODE. He is an agriculturalist who deals mostly in plantains and pineapples. He works eight hours a day, six days a week, since he has to spend Sunday at church preaching to people. Most of his clients are people from around his area and traders from the capital city, especially hotels and fruit centers.

Rev's John's previous loan was UGX 2,000,000 which helped him to mulch his banana plantation. This increased his sales and profit.

He started this agribusiness to have an income as his family was growing. Apart from the agriculture he does six days a week, he also earns a salary from the church where he leads service every Sunday. That helps to supplement the earnings from the agriculture that also feed his family.

He is requesting another loan of UGX 4,000,000 to hire labour to expand his plantation and also buy mulch for his banana plantation and pineapple plantation.

His dream is to educate all his children. His main challenge is weather changes, especially the dry season, when the matooke ripens and has a low market.

loans.use: to hire labour and also buy organic manure.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia has been running a general store, earning good income for providing her family's daily needs. For this business, she had a previous loan from GDMPC and used it for buying goods for her retail store.

Aside from this, she is engaged in raising pigs for sale. She took a new loan recently to purchase feeds and additional piglets for expansion of her swine production business.

Nothing means more to her than to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional piglets for expansion of her swine production business.

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya is caring mother of two children, and she is also a caring wife of her ailing husband. She is a very patient and ambitious ‎woman.

Hedaya started her business two years ago at her home, where she sells accessories and cosmetics to help her ‎husband with the expenses of their household.

Being so popular among her family members, neighbors, and friends who ‎like what she sells, Hedaya decided to expand her business and buy more products such as body lotion, makeup and ‎accessories. Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs to expand her business.‎

loans.use: to expand her business and buy more products such as body lotion, makeup and ‎accessories.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer from Tajiri village. As a Babban Gona member, Sule is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Sule can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sule no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sule hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in an upholstery business for six years. Recently, he established his own business which specializes in car upholstery.

He is very skilled in his domain, since he had to quit school during his intermediate stages and was trained in this business through his brother, who works in this domain too.

Zaher is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary cloth and leather to increase his business production and develop his business.

He is working hard to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary cloth and leather to increase his business production and develop his business.

loans.name: Olga Jacqueline

texts.es:
Olga vive en la ciudad de santo Domingo, habita en casa propia muchos años junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo. 
Su esposo es jubilado, mientras ella trabaja preparando comida para vender en empresas, Olga ya es clienta de la Fundación, el primer crédito lo invirtió muy bien, ahora con este crédito podrá comprar un horno necesario para su labor y además comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite al por mayor.
Olga se siente muy agradecida con KIVA porque con los créditos ha podido fortalecer su negocio, la principal fuente de ingresos para su hogar, ella por eso es clienta fiel de la institución porque le han dado la mano cuando ella más lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Olga lives in the city of Santo Domingo. She has lived in her own house for many years together with her husband and their young son. Her husband is retired and she works preparing food to sell to companies. 

Olga is a previous client of the Fundación. She invested her first loan very well. With this new loan she will be able to buy an oven, which she needs for work, and wholesale products such as rice, sugar and oil. 

Olga is very grateful to KIVA because the loans have enabled her to strengthen her business, which is her household's primary source of income. For this reason, she is a loyal member of the institution, as they have helped her when she most needed it.

loans.use: to buy an oven, which she needs for work, and wholesale products such as rice, sugar and oil. This will strengthen her business as her primary source of income.

loans.name: Mahammadu

texts.en:
Mahammadu is a maize farmer from Turaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Mahammadu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mahammadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mahammadu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mahammadu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mahammadu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulwahab

texts.en:
Abdulwahab is a maize farmer from Layin Sarki Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulwahab is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulwahab would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulwahab can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdulwahab no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abdulwahab hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a hardworking mother of three children who lives in Masindi, Uganda.

After she divorced her husband, life became so hard because she was used to her husband providing for her. It was after this that she decided to start up a clothing business through borrowing from Hofokam.

She sells used clothes to get income. She also does farming to support her family.

She has a great dream of buying land despite challenges of inadequate capital and the price fluctuations of second-hand clothes.

She needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kyamusanju

texts.en:
Kyamusanju is a married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda, where he operates a retail shop and a pool table alongside farming to earn a living and serve his community.

His dreams are construction of a good residential house and paying school fees for his children.

Kyamusanju is challenged by insufficient capital to buy enough stock as time draws closer to Christmas season. He wants a loan to buy soap, salt, sodas and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sodas and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven de 22 años de edad, inicio un negocio de venta de mercancía para pagar los gastos universitarios, ella vende productos capilares, faciales de marcas extranjeras.
Se siente feliz y orgullosa de poder pagar sus estudios universitarios y todo lo ha logrado gracias a su negocio.
La joven quiere solicitar un préstamo, el monto del dinero será usado para la cancelación de un crédito anterior y el resto para la compra de surtido de cosmetología y productos para cuidar el cabello.
Su propósito es continuar creciendo como empresaria, ayudar a sus padres en todo lo que pueda (económicamente) y convertirse en un futuro en una profesional.
texts.en:
Daniela is 22 years old. She started a sales business in order to pay for college expenses: she sells hair care and facial products from foreign brands.

She is happy and proud to be able to pay for her college studies and it's all thanks to her business. The young woman is requesting a loan to be used for the repayment of a previous loan and for the purchase of beauty and hair care supplies.

Her goal is to continue growing as a business woman, to help her parents as much as possible (financially) and to become a professional in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies and hair care products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD  CASADO, SE ENCUENTRA PREOCUPADO POR SU ESPOSA YA QUE LE DIAGNOSTICARON CÁLCULOS BILIARES QUE LE PROVOCAN FUERTES DOLORES, ACTUALMENTE ESTA EN TRATAMIENTO SOLO PARA DISMINUIR EL DOLOR, SIN EMBARGO NECESITA URGENTEMENTE UNA OPERACIÓN, MISMA QUE NO PUEDE COSTEAR YA QUE SUS INGRESOS SON LIMITADOS Y ÉL ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO EN SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
He is 35 years old and married. He is worried about his wife because she was diagnosed with gallstones, which cause severe pains. She is currently receiving treatment only to ease the pain.

Nevertheless, she urgently needs an operation. He is not able to pay for this because his earnings are limited. He is the sole support of his family.

loans.use: to pay for a gallbladder operation.

loans.name: Jesus Olivo

texts.es:
Jesús es un agricultor residente del municipio de Mariquita, un hombre soltero de 41 años de edad que necesita un capital de trabajo para abonar sus terrenos y pagar la mano de obra para aplicar los productos, pero como su cultivo aún no ha dado cosecha no cuenta con dinero para comprar los insumos que tienen un precio alto.
Por ello el Señor Jesús quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar los artículos y pagar por el trabajo y así tener una cosecha abundante y de excelente calidad que venderá en la plaza de mercado más cercana.
texts.en:
Jesús is a farmer, and he lives in the Mariquita municipality. He is 41 years old and single. He needs working capital to fertilize his fields and to pay for the labor to apply the products. However, as his crop has not yet produced the harvest, he does not have money to buy the supplies that are expensive.

Therefore, Jesús wants to request a loan to buy the items and to pay for the labor. This way he will have an abundant, excellent quality harvest that he will sell at the closest market plaza.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un hombre de 60 años de edad es soltero con una linda familia ellos vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Martin es un agricultor con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, gracias a sus años de experiencia ha obtenido siempre buenas cosechas, pero también él tiene la fortuna de vivir en un lugar muy fértil. Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono químico y orgánico para el mantenimiento de su cultivo. Con esta inversión él espera obtener al  final de este año una buena cosecha y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin, age 60, is single. He has a lovely family, and he lives in a community in Sololá. Martin is a farmer with big life aspirations. He has been engaged in this business activity for 25 years. Thanks to his years of experience, he has always gotten good harvests. He also has the good fortune of living in a very fertile place.

He is requesting a loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizer for the maintenance of his crops. With this investment he hopes to get a good harvest at the end of this year. With this he will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Donaldo Jose

texts.es:
Donaldo es un trabajador empírico de 42 años de edad, dedicado al campo y a su familia, vive en unión libre con su pareja, no tiene hijos, su actividad principal es la cría de aves y cerdos, el fenómeno del niño ha sido un desencadenante de varios sucesos negativos en su negocio, muerte de animales, aumento en precios de alimento de engorde y vacunas, múltiples factores que golpean su economía.
Donaldo pensando en esta situación hoy quiere solicitar un préstamo, un monto de dinero para comprar pollos, cerdos, alimento, vacunas, tiene que reestablecerse y continuar con el negocio que le da de comer a él y a su familia.
texts.en:
Donaldo, age 42, is an experienced worker who is devoted to the field and to his family. He lives in a common-law marriage with his life partner. He does not have children. His main business activity is raising birds and pigs.

The El Niño phenomenon has been a triggering factor to various negative occurrences in his business. The death of animals and the increase in the price of feed and vaccinations are multiple factors that hit his finances.

Thinking about this situation, Donaldo now wants to request a loan. He will use the loan to buy chickens, pigs, feed, and vaccines. He needs to reestablish himself and to continue with the business that feeds him and his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, feed, and vaccinations.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is 50 years old, widowed, and has one child. She has been selling clothes from her house since 1995. She is a Palestinian refugee, who puts in much effort to provide her only child with the necessary standards of living. She has always been both the hardworking father and the caring mother after her husband passed away.

Hayat is working hard to develop her business, but unfortunately her income is not enough to handle both covering living needs and increasing her business's capital. She requested her eighth loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with newly released winter clothes collection. Her previous loans helped her in developing her business. She is looking forward to opening her own clothes shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase newly released winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a thirty-year-old married male living in Masindi, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of his two children.

He rides a motorcycle as his business for income generation alongside farming. He started the business due to lack of jobs and he wanted to sustain his family.

He dreams of constructing a house for his family. Due to poor roads, movements and transportation is rendered difficult. He wants a loan to buy cement for building his house.

loans.use: to buy cement for building.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is banana farming on a commercial basis for income generation, working at least six hours for six days in a week.

He aims at becoming a model farmer with the highest harvest in the area in order to fulfill his dreams of educating his children up to university. All these hopes came to a standstill with the small financial injections to the business and that is why Charles wants a loan to buy manure and mulch the banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and mulch the banana plantation.

loans.name: Alina Emperatriz

texts.es:
Alina es una joven de 25 años de edad que con mucho trabajo, largas jornadas laborales constituyo un salón de belleza, ella es madre de una pequeña de 3 años de edad.
Aprendió del negocio de peluquería gracias a que asistió a cursos certificándose para poder laborar.
A pesar de crecer en una zona de postconflicto, de no tener recursos, ella misma se fabricó las oportunidades y con ahorros y algunos préstamos ha comprado artículos y poco a poco ha formado su salón de belleza.
Alina quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar remodelaciones en su negocio, pintura, cambiar de sitio varias cosas para tener mayor espacio y comprar un sofá para que sus clientes que esperan atención estén cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
Alina, age 25, established her beauty salon with a lot of work and long workdays. She has a little three year old child. She learned the hairdressing business thanks to attending a course that certified her to be able to work. In spite of growing up in an area of post conflict and not having resources, she created opportunities herself. With savings and some loans she has purchased items, and little by little she has established her beauty salon.

Alina wants to request a loan to remodel her business, to paint, and to change around several things in order to have more space. She will also buy a sofa so that her waiting customers are comfortable and happy.

loans.use: to remodel her business, to paint, and to buy a sofa so that her waiting customers will be comfortable.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras De 9 De Octubre Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Vencedoras de 9 de Octubre” en esta nueva etapa está conformada por 5 mujeres muy responsables que decidieron seguir trabajando en equipo para cumplir con sus sueños y que ahora está representada por su presidenta la Sra. Elizabeth de 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Ella tiene como fuente de trabajo un pequeño taller de confecciones donde realiza diferentes polos para damas, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio para comprar los materiales como telas e hilos que necesita para realizar las prendas. Ella tiene planeado apoyar en los estudios a su hijo y terminar de construir su casa que con el apoyo de su pareja lo lograra. En la foto grupal Elizabeth se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
This new phase of the communal bank “Las Vencedoras de 9 de Octubre” is made up of five very responsible women, who decided to continue working as a team in order to fulfill their dreams. It is currently represented by its chairwoman Elizabeth, who is 34 years old and lives in common-law with one dependent child.

Her source of income is a small tailoring business where she makes different kinds of shirts for women. The loan will be invested in the business to buy supplies, such as the fabrics and thread needed to make the garments. 

She plans to support her son through his studies and to finish building her house, with the help of her live-in partner.

In the group photo, Elizabeth is the one standing between her fellow colleagues, who are seated.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer de 33 años de edad, que necesita un apoyo para realizar mejor sus labores en el trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimento como fritos (pasteles, palos de queso, arepas, papas rellenas, entre otros).
Su actividad la inicio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, cuenta con capital para invertir en su hogar y en sus 3 hijos, de 12, 9 y 3 años de edad, para ella lo más importante es que su negocio le permite estar cerca de sus hijos.
Como se mencionada en un principio la cliente necesita un apoyo para mejorar su operatividad y dicho apoyo quiere traducirlo en la compra de una mesa, capital de trabajo para elaborar los alimentos y comprar una vitrina-calentador para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Angélica, age 33, needs some support in order to better do her work. She sells food like snacks (pastries, cheese sticks, 'arepas' [corn pancakes], stuffed potatoes, and others). She started her business activity because of her enjoyment and her calling for independent work. She has money to invest in her home and her three children, ages 12, 9, and 3. To her the most important thing is that her business allows her to be close to her children.

As mentioned at the beginning, she needs some support in order to improve her functionality. She wants to use the support to buy a table, for working capital to make the food, and to buy a warming case to display her products.

loans.use: to make food and to buy a warming case to display her products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Rev. David is a repeat customer whose previous loan of UGX 1,000,000 that he used to buy organic fertilizers was financed by the Kiva funders. He is an old client to UGAFODE and is applying for another loan of UGX2,500,000.

The happily married reverend is aged 65 years and has six children. He hails from Rushaka, Nyabiteete, Buyanja subcounty, Rukungiri district. David works as an archdeacon of the Rubirizi, North Kigezi diocese.

In addition to his job as a pastor, he is also in agriculture, majoring in banana growing. Since he is approaching retirement, his dream has been the expansion and improvement of his banana plantation so that he will be able to get income to maintain his income. The challenge though has been limited capital, but with continuous support from UGAFODE to buy fertilizers, he will boost his yields and income.

He hopes this loan will enable him to make the necessary improvement in his agriculture and increase his income in those days of retirement.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a single, hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells produce such as maize, beans, and soybeans. He started the business so as to cater for the family's increasing demands. He bought a motorcycle for a transport business so as to generate more income.

He dreams of having a stable income, but inadequate capital is still a challenge when it comes to buying stock during the peak season.

He wants a loan to buy maize, beans and soybeans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and soybeans for selling.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Adjo est une jeune femme de 27 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Adjo se bat par la vente des cures dent pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de bois de cures dent qu’elle revendra dans les quartiers environnant en vue de gagner des bénéfices. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Adjo va pouvoir bien s’épanouir et relancer son activité.
texts.en:
Adjo, age 27, is a single woman without children who lives in Adidogomé. Adjo supports herself by selling toothpicks. She stocks up twice per month at the market.

Adjo is seeking this loan to purchase packs of wooden toothpicks to sell in surrounding neighborhoods. Her profits will allow her to thrive and to sustain her activity.

loans.use: to buy 9 packs of wooden toothpicks.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hardworking and committed married man with seven children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more cow salt to sell. He still buys and sells salt, which is a business he has done for over 30 years. He is active and started his business by utilizing the savings from his salary from livestock and farming output; this helps him earn more income and pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale one, though he faces challenges of price fluctuations and high transport costs.

He requests a loan to pay for labor to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to pay for labor to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes so as to get income to provide her family with the basic needs. She is charged with a responsibility of looking after her four children despite the fact that she earns little capital. High competition is a great challenge to her business, yet she dreams of educating her children up to university, having sworn to fight illiteracy since she never got the chance to do so.

She needs a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en:
Surajo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Surajo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Surajo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Surajo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Surajo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Surajo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a 23-year-old, single man living in Masindi, Uganda. He does cattle fattening, alongside selling milk. He started the business so as to support himself and the family at large. He dreams of owning a large farm. Diseases have affected his cattle, and this has been a great challenge.

He requests a loan to buy cows for fattening to mature quickly and sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to mature quickly and sell.

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en:
Muzafaru is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells sport bikes so as to get income to support his life. He has a music sound and public address system that is hired for big functions to get more income.

He dreams of growing his business into a wholesale one and extending the market to other operational areas. He faces a challenge in the high rates of booking and the length of time to clear his bicycles.

Muzafaru needs a loan to buy more bicycles to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles to sell.

loans.name: Twekambe Mixed Farmers Kayanja Group

texts.en:
Sepiriano is a married Ugandan male aged 54 living in Kagadi, Uganda with 6 children between the ages of 29 and 13. He operates a liquor business where he sells a local brew commonly known as waragi. He used the savings from the previous loan to start up a butcher shop that he operates on weekends. He plans to construct a residential house and educate his four children still in school.

Sepiriano wants a loan to buy local brew for resale. He is a member of Twekambe Mixed Farmers where members guarantee each other to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more local brew (waragi) for selling

loans.name: Kihuura Kwetegekera Group

texts.en:
Gorret is a married woman, 28, living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children who both attend school. She owns a spare parts shop selling bicycle and motorcycle parts and also does farming. Being in this business for four years, Gorret has been able to pay fees for her children and buy land for doing agriculture. She dreams of starting up another business to supplement her income and pay school fees for her children through the university level.

She wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell. She is a member of Kihuura Kwetegekera Group where members guarantee each other to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in Maralik town of Shirak region with his big and nice family of seven. He is a father of two daughters who attend a local school.

Vardan and his family's main source of income is a farming business. Their farm includes three piglets and 11 pigs, and also a beautiful fruit orchard with walnut, apple and pear trees.

Vardan is a musician by education, playing an ancient double-reed woodwind flute made of apricot wood.

The loan will help Vardan to purchase 10 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Alh. Shauibu

texts.en:
Alhaji Shauibu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Shauibu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Shauibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Shauibu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Shauibu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Shauibu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Usman is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Usman will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Usman now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles used the previous loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other household items to sell in his shop. He owns a pub and a retail shop, which he has been running for 13 years now. He started these businesses after realizing the need for more income for his family. He faces hardships of inadequate capital and fluctuating market prices. However, he is looking at expanding his business to new areas. Charles has asked for another loan to buy beers, sodas and wine to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and wine to sell this festive season.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Salisu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Salisu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Salisu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Salisu plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Adamu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Adamu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dédévi

texts.fr: Dédévi est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans qui vit avec trois enfants à charge. Dédévi est une revendeuse de condiments résidant à Adidogomé. Dédévi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Dédévi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs d’oignons en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à prendre en charge certaines dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Dédévi, age 41, is married with 3 dependent children and she lives in Adidogomé. She is a reseller of condiments. She stocks up twice a month at the market and she conducts her sales in a shed in front of her home.

Dédévi is seeking this loan to purchase sacks of onions to sell. She hopes to make a profit that will be helpful for her husband to properly plan for their children's education and to cover some of the household's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of onions.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es una laboriosa confeccionista la cual trabaja 12 horas diariamente, tiene su línea de ropa propia la cual trata de posicionarla en el municipio de Sincelejo.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos un nene de 11 y la muñeca de 4 años de edad.
Aprendió de su madre el negocio de confección, heredo la maquinaria pero a diferencia de su madre ella lucha pro posicionar su propio estilo, su propia marca.
La señora Rosalba quiere aprovechar la temporada de diciembre para impulsar sus diseños, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de insumos de confección para tejer camisas, camisetas, blusas entre otros, necesita hilos, telas, broches y artículos decorativos.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a hard-working dress-maker. She works 12 hours a day and has her own line of clothing which she is trying to establish in the municipality of Sincelejo.

She lives in a civil union with her partner and has two children: a darling 11 year-old boy and a sweet little 4 year-old girl.

She learned the sewing business from her mother, and inherited all of the equipment, but unlike her mother, she is struggling to establish her own style and brand.

Señora Rosalba wants to take advantage of the December season to promote her designs. To this end she is requesting a loan to stock sewing supplies to tailor shirts, t-shirts, and blouses, among other things. She needs thread, cloth, clasps and decorative items.

loans.use: to buy the thread, cloth, clasps and decorative items she needs.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 30 years old, married, and has four children. He is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. He requested a loan, which he will use to buy maize and beans for his store. In the future, James hopes to start a wholesale shop and educate his children to university level. He also plans to put to use two acres of land that he owns for poultry farming and piggery. He is challenged by limited capital, which he feels will be solved by this loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for his store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nyakashema Kwekamba Group

texts.en:
Ketty is a Ugandan female aged 53 years. She is married with seven children, and she operates a liquor store in Kagadi, Uganda, selling a local brew, commonly known as Waragi, to earn a living. She also does farming as her side source of income, serving the people of Kagadi.

She hopes to buy land for agriculture in the future and educate her children. Salome describes herself as a hardworking lady, and she wants a loan to buy local brew to resell.

Ketty is a member of Nyakashema Kwekamba Group where members guarantee each other's loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy local brew to resell.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es:
Felix se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para aumentar la venta de pollos en su negocio, es un hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero que no cuenta con un empleo, monto su negocio pro necesidad económica y ahora lucha diariamente por sacar su empresa hacia adelante.
Su propósito es convertirse en el proveedor de pollos más importante del municipio de Sampues.
texts.en:
Felix is seeking a loan to increase chicken sales in his business. He is a 28 year old single man who is unemployed. He started his business out of financial necessity and is now struggling daily to make his business thrive.

He intends to become the biggest chicken provider in the municipality of Sampues.

loans.use: to increase chicken sales in his business.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, es un hombre que tiene un taller de mecánica industrial, actualmente está acompañado y por el momento no tienen hijos. El inicio en esta actividad hace 15 años y lo hizo con capital propio, su jornada laboral la comienza a partir de las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. de lunes a sábado.
Él solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas tales como llaves, micas, grasa, entre otras; todo esto le será de mucha ayuda para poder continuar trabjando con su taller, además pretende poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes y de esa manera les brinda un mejor servicio de calidad a todos sus cliente.
El sueño de Héctor es poder ser un cliente potencial en la zona y atraer más clientes para generar más ingresos y así lograr brindarles una mejor vida a su compañera de vida y en un futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hector has an industrial mechanical workshop and is currently in a relationship but has no children at the current time. He began his career 15 years ago with his own capital and he works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Monday to Saturday.

He is applying for loan to buy tools such as spanners, welding masks, lubricant and other things which will be very helpful in enabling him to continue with his workshop. He also aims to meet the needs of his customers and give a better quality service to all his clients.

Hector's dream is to be a strong competitor in the area and attract more customers in order to generate more revenue. That way he will be able provide a better life for his partner and their future children.

loans.use: to buy tools such as spanners, welding masks, lubricant and other things which will be very helpful in enabling him to continue with his workshop.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking man whose business is selling chickens, and roasted goat and chicken meat in the busy town of Fort Portal, Uganda.

With his previous loan, Julius managed to buy buy cement, sand, bricks and pay for labour. He has asked for another loan to buy iron sheets and pay workers who are constructing his house.

Julius is faced with challenges of inadequate capital, that limit him from achieving his dream of expanding his business and educating his children at high-performing schools.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and pay workers who are constructing his house.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a Ugandan male living in Kagadi, Uganda, who is married with 4 children between 15 and 7 years old.  He is selling produce and farming to serve the rural people.  Benson is aiming to develop himself and his family at large. Having been in this business for ten years, Benson has been able to build a house for his family and pay his children’s school fees. He hopes to expand his business, but he has little capital. He wants a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Cristhian Jefferson

texts.es:
Cristhian es un joven de 24 años, vive en unión libre. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres n la ciudad de santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas un sector muy conocido por ser muy comercial.
Aquí hace dos años Cristhian conoció a su esposa, una señora también trabajadora, con quien comparte todo el tiempo y  se apoyan mutuamente. Juntos visitan las ferias de la ciudad; mientras Cristhian vende sandalias su esposa vende ropa, surtiendo ambos negocios para no solo depender de un solo ingreso.
Juntos han salido adelante, se apoyan y crecen de a poco en el negocio. Ahora con este crédito podrán adquirir más mercadería como sandalias de niños, pijamas y demás ya que estamos en fiestas de la provincia y necesitan más stock para dar más variedad a su clientela.
Su deseo es en un futuro contar con un local fijo en una de las ferias para ya ir legalizando su negocio. Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por dar el apoyo a jóvenes trabajadores que esperan superarse.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 24 year old young man living in a civil union. Together they live in his parents home in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, an area known for being very business oriented.

It was here that Cristhian met his wife, also a hard-working person, two years ago. He spends all his time with her, and they offer each other support. Together they go to the city markets. While Cristhian sells sandals his wife sells clothing, and they stock both businesses in order not to depend on only one income. Together they have managed to get ahead, supporting one another and growing their business bit by bit.

Now, with this loan, they will be able to buy more merchandise such as children's sandals, pajamas and other things, now that we are in the regional holiday season and they need more varied stock for their customers.

Their hope is to have a fixed location at one of the markets in the future, to begin to make their business official. They are grateful to the institution and to Kiva for their support of young hard- working people who hope to get ahead.

loans.use: to stock the business he and his wife own with merchandise. Between the two of them they can get ahead and offer more variety to their customers.

loans.name: Julio Francisco

texts.es:
Julio es una persona responsable, carismática, emprendedora el cual tiene un negocio de miscelánea donde vende cosméticos, artículos de papelería y accesorios.
Es separado de su esposa, pero tiene 3 hijos menores de edad por los cuales responder.
Julio actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar artículos escolares, armar kits y vender a las personas de las zonas.
Esta es una estrategia que hace cada año, la cual le ha venido dando buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Julio is a responsible person. He is charismatic and enterprising, and has a business selling cosmetics, paper goods and accessories.

He is separated from his wife, but he has 3 young children to care for.

Julio is currently seeking a loan to buy school supplies and put together kits to sell to people in the area.

This is something he has done each year, and he has had good results.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and put together kits to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, es amable y solidaria tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 5 y 7 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá,
Maria para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con esta actividad lleva 2 años de realizarlo, su negocio se ubica en la comodidad de su hogar. Maria gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, mucha gente la busca con frecuencia, por esa razón ella solicita un préstamo porque se ha dado cuenta que su producto ya no es suficiente, ella con el crédito comprara hilos de diferentes colores y estilos. Su mayor anhelo es mejora las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard-working woman. She is pleasant and loyal. She is 33 years old, single, with a lovely family of two children between the ages of 5 and 7. They live in a community of Sololá.

To earn income, Maria buys and sells typical clothing. She has been doing this for 2 years. Her business is located in the comfort of her home. Thanks to the effort that she puts into her business, many people seek her out often. She is seeking the loan because she realizes that she no longer has enough product, and she plans to buy thread of different colors and styles. Her greatest desire is to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy different colors and styles of thread.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is a 33-year-old hardworking entrepreneur with three children. He runs a welding store in Kamwenge, Uganda and requested a Kiva loan through Hofokam Limited to purchase additional stocks of welding materials to sell. He productively makes supplementary income through other business ventures, like farming, so that he can occupy his small piece of land and also give his children quality education. Allan dreams of developing his land into a modern farm and also providing quality education to his children, but he faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand, low customer turn up, and employing bad workers who make losses in his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of welding materials to sell.

loans.name: Yency Camila

texts.es:
Yency es una joven de 19 años de edad, tiene un pequeño de 2 años de edad y un matrimonio feliz, ella es un ama de casa, que aprendió de las actividades agropecuarias gracias a su esposo y sus padres.
Yency a pesar de contar con un esposo que trabaja muy duro para darle todo a ella y a su bebe, pero no quiere convertirse en una carga para su marido, quiere trabajar y aportar para que juntos realicen sus sueños como lo son tener su propio casa, con su terrenos, cultivos, animales, dinero para educar a su hijo en buenas instituciones y jamás pasar necesidades.
La joven quiere solicitar un préstamo para incentivar su negocio agrícola, el monto del dinero será destinado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su producción diaria de leche.
texts.en:
Yency is 19 years old and has a 2 year old son and is happily married.  She is a housewife who learned of agricultural activities thanks to her husband and parents.

Yency, despite having a husband who works hard to give everything to her and her baby, does not want to become a burden to her husband.  She would like to work and be able to contribute so that together they can achieve their dreams such as having their own home, with their land, crops, animals, and money to educate her child in good institutions and that they never lack with their basic needs.

She is requesting a loan to boost her agricultural business, most of the amount of the money will go to purchasing a cow to increase daily milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase daily milk production.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has three children, who attend school. She operates a vegetables stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Janet requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saidu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Saidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as having money to purchase food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Saidu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price (a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price).

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Saidu can now realize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adelfina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Buscando aumentar su producción, generar empleo, aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar son los deseos de la señora Adelfina, el cual está constituido por ella y su esposo y aunque tiene 3 hijos todos ellos son mayores de edad y tienen su familia.
Es por este motivo que esta confeccionista a terceros solicita un apoyo para la compra de una máquina de coser, quiere duplicar su capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Señora Adelfina's wish is to increase production and make more income to improve her living conditions. Her home is comprised of herself and her husband, and although she has 3 children, they are all grown and have their own families.

This is why this dress-maker for wholesalers is seeking support to buy a sewing machine so she can double her production.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, because she wants to double her production.

loans.name: Las Responsables Del Sauce Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Las Responsables del Sauce” formada por 6 mujeres responsables que decidieron progresar en la vida mediante el apoyo mutuo y que viene siendo representada por su presidenta la Sra. Fernanda de 65 años de edad, esta soltera y tiene 5 hijos que ya son independientes. Ella tiene como fuente de trabajo por las mañanas la venta de desayuno y por las tardes la venta de comida que ella misma prepara y vende en su casa. De esta forma Ella genera sus propios ingresos para cubrir con sus gastos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo lo invertirá en comprar víveres (alimentos) para su negocio como soya, quinua, arroz, papa, leche, etc que necesita para poder preparar sus desayunos y comidas para sus clientes. Ella tiene pensado implementar un taller de costura en casa ya que tiene algunas máquinas de coser y así generar trabajo para sus vecinas que tanto lo necesitan. En la foto grupal la Sra. Fernanda se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank "Las Responsables del Sauce", and it consists of 6 responsible women who decided to get ahead in life through mutual support.  

This group is represented by its president:  Fernanda, who is 65 years old, single and has 5 children who are now independent. 

As a source of work in the mornings she sells breakfast and in the afternoon she sells prepared food that she makes and sells from her home. 

She thus generates her own income to cover her expenses and have a better quality of life. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing groceries (food) for her business such as soy, quinoa, rice, potatoes, milk, etc which she needs to prepare the breakfasts and lunches for her customers. 

She plans to implement a sewing workshop at home because she has a few sewing machines and thus be able generate jobs for her neighbors who need it so much. 

In the group photo Fernanda is standing among her other companions who are sitting.

loans.use: to purchase soy, quinoa, rice and potatoes.

loans.name: Uma Tui Ndulilye Self Help Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in this photo is Ann. She is 32 years old, married, and is a mother of two children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training, especially its enterprise development. She acquired business management skills and has been able to commercialize her farming activities.

She practices mixed farming (i.e., maize, beans, and poultry farming). She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides. These inputs will greatly boost her business and increase her income, which will enable her to provide better food and clothing for her children.

Ann is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and boost farming activities, increasing her income and allowing her to provide better food and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn is a 44-year-old mother of two children. She helps her husband earn income by raising pigs. She has been doing this for more than three years.

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2013 and has been borrowing loans for a purpose. She recently took a loan to build pig pens and to buy feeds to boost her pigs.

She is hopeful that she will be able to improve her farm, expand it, and gain more income from it. She will also be able to provide her family a better living in the future.

loans.use: to build pig pens and to buy feeds to boost her pigs.

loans.name: Jessan Marie

texts.en: Jessan Marie successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy fishing nets.  In addition to fishing, she earns additional income by using her boat for rental services.  To improve her business, she recently took a new loan to buy additional fishing nets.  Jessan Marie works and runs her business with more determination, hoping to improve her general living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets to be used for fishing.

loans.name: Ramona Isabel

texts.es:
Ramona es una dulce mujer de 61 años de edad que se gana la vida vendiendo cerdos, vive en unión libre con su pareja y aunque no tiene un hermoso palacio como hogar, tiene un terreno que con mucho esfuerzo y sudor construyo y nunca le falta un alimento en su mesa.
Ella es madre de 3 hijos ya mayores de edad, su principal preocupación se trata de que su negocio se sostenga en el tiempo, pues es lo único que tiene para generar los ingresos.
Actualmente la señora Ramona se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento, vacunas, vitaminas y materiales para la construcción de cocheras, principalmente cemento y zinc.
texts.en:
Ramona is a sweet, 61 year old lady who earns a living selling pigs. She is in a common law marriage and even though she doesn’t live in a palace, she has land on which she built a home with much sweat and effort and there is always food on the table.

She has three adult children. Her main goal is for her business to sustain itself over time because it’s her only means of generating an income.

Ramona is asking for a loan to buy pigs, feed, vaccines, vitamins, and supplies for building pens (mainly cement and zinc metal).

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, vaccines, vitamins, and supplies to build pens.

loans.name: Astone

texts.en:
Astone is a hardworking married man with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

He is a typical farmer, specializing in growing bananas to make the local brew (waragi). This is his basic economic activity which has enabled him to survive. It involves a lot of stages to get a final product to be consumed. The stage in the picture is the fermenting; then it becomes brew and finally local alcohol.

In this business one cannot go wrong. If the season is okay, a jerrycan sells for 200,000 UGX to 250,000 UGX for concentrated stuff and 100,000 UGX to 120,000 UGX for less concentrated. One can have a total of 5-10 jerrycans after a month.

He also trades in local alcohol and that is why Astone is requesting the loan to buy jerrycans of local alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of local alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Sofia

texts.es:
Adriana es una joven de 21 años de edad la cual constituyo un negocio de cibercafé en el municipio de Córdoba, tiene como principal dificultad la mala señal que hay en la zona, pero su negocio es muy importante en la zona, puesto que los habitantes de este sector son de bajos recursos y desde sus casas no tienen accesos a internet.
A pesar de esta dificultad la cliente sigue con su negocio, pues es lo que genera el sustento para su hogar, ella tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, tiene marido, tiene obligaciones que cumplir y confía mucho en su proyecto.
Adriana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de computadores más potentes, artículos de papelería y cerdos para tener una profesión alterna al cibercafé.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 21 year old youth who set up an internet cafe business in the municipality of Córdoba. Her main problem is the poor connection in the area but her business is the biggest in the area. The local inhabitants are of modest resources and don't have internet access in their homes.

Despite the difficulty the client continues to run her business as it generates sustenance for her home. She has an eight year old daughter, a husband and has obligations to meet and she has confidence in her project.

Adriana wants to request a loan to buy more powerful computers, stationary items and pigs to have an alternative business to her internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy computers, stationary items and pigs.

loans.name: Jovanisi

texts.en:
Jovanisi is a fifty-one-year old hardworking and active widow with four children, one of whom attends school in Kamwenge, Uganda. Apart from her biological children, she also looks after seven extra dependents because she has the passion for such young people and at the same time, they are her relatives.

Her business is a retail shop which she supplements with coffee buying and selling. She works every day for twelve hours and from her hard work, she is able to cater for her family.

She has hope that her business will soon grow into a wholesale shop and that her school-going child will finish studies, but she is limited by inadequate capital to stock her shop.

She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Samira Esther

texts.es:
Samira es una joven de 18 años de edad que tiene un negoció de cría de animales hace dos años, negocio que inicio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, es una mujer que quiere salir adelante y luchar por sus ideales.
La  cliente quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento, vacunas, vitaminas, con los que aumentara la producción en su negocio, hay que dejar claro que esta joven logró la independencia económica y ahora vela por su sostenimiento y ayuda a sus padres.
texts.en:
Samira is an 18 year old youth who has had a business raising animals for two years. She started the business as she liked it and out of a vocation to work independently. She is a woman who wants to get ahead and fight for her ideals.

The client wants to request a loan to buy chickens, feed, vaccines and vitamins to increase the production of her business. It should be noted that this

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Odalis Adriana

texts.es: Odalis de 37 años es una ejemplar mujer que vela por el bienestar de su hijo de 10 años de edad, es viuda y su negocio es su único medio de sustento.  Ella es propietaria de una miscelánea que le cedió su suegra en vista de su situación después del fallecimiento de su cónyuge, en ella lleva 5 años de estarla administrando con buenos resultados. En su almacén ofrece servicio de fotocopiado, impresiones, papelería y detalles para toda ocasión, sus ventas siempre han sido muy buenas, pero últimamente necesita renovar el surtido para dinamizarlas y obtener los resultados esperados para poder cumplir con sus obligaciones en el hogar. Como su capital no abastece este proyecto, aplicó una solicitud de credikiva, oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y poder comprar una nueva fotocopiadora y mercancías varias: accesorios, esmaltes, removedores, productos capilares, artículos para el hogar entre otros. El sueño de Odalis es tener su propio apartamento y cree que a largo plazo lo hará realidad.
texts.en: Odalis is an exemplary 37 year old woman who looks after the well being of her 10 year old son. She is a widow and her business is her only means of support. In view of her circumstances following her husbands death, she was given a general store to run by her mother in law. She has been managing the shop for five years with good results. The shop provides a photocopying service, printing, stationary and party favours. Sales have always been very good, but recently Odalis  has realized she needs to renew her stock to reinvigorate sales. This will get the results required to meet her household needs.  She does not have enough capital for this project and so applied for a Kiva loan which provides the link to the financial community via the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo". The loan will allow her to buy a new photocopier and a variety of merchandise: accessories, nail varnish,  varnish remover, hair care products and household items among other things. Odalis dreams of having her own apartment and believes that in the long run she will make this a reality.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopier and other merchandise:  accessories, nail varnish, varnish remover, hair care products, household goods among other things.

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noris es una mujer de 48 años de edad, la mayor parte de su vida estuvo dedicada a su esposo e hijos, pero hace unos años inicio un negocio de venta de mercancía de uso personal.
Gracias a esta empresa la señora Noris no solo genera ingresos, tiene la posibilidad de interactuar con sus clientes, vivir su vida, tener capital para darse gusto, comprarse un vestido, unos aretes y le encanta esa sensación.
La cliente solicita un préstamo para abastecerse de mercancía, principalmente artesanías, manillas, pulseras, aretes, collares entre otros.
texts.en:
Noris is a 48 year old woman who has dedicated the majority of her life to her husband and children. A few years ago she started a business selling personal use merchandise.

Thanks to this undertaking Noris is not only generating income but has the possibility to interact with her clients, live her life, have money to spend as she wants, buy a dress or some earrings. And she loves this sensation.

The client is requesting a loan to stock up on merchandise mainly handicrafts, bracelets, earrings and necklaces amongst others.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, bracelets, earrings and necklaces amongst others.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, a 49-year-old mother of two. She helps her farmer husband by running a general store to make a living. She has been a member of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative for more than three years.

Recently, Josephine took out a loan to purchase additional grocery goods, such as canned goods, noodles and grains, to sell. She is confident in improving their business, for they both work with determination to make a better living and ensure a good source of income for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods, such as canned goods, noodles and grains, to sell

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdul has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdul would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as money to purchase food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abdul can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for a price that is up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdul will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Abdul is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrashid

texts.en:
Abdulrashid is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrashid is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulrashid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrashid can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdulrashid no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abdulrashid hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has successfully repaid her previous loan used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She earns well from her business and was able to provide for her family. Aside from harvesting crops like cassava, she enjoys selling vegetables as she used to do.

Recently, Julieta took out a new loan to be used as additional capital for expanding her vegetable garden by buying a variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer. In the future, Julieta wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to expand her vegetable garden by buying a variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, a hardworking and married man with children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a workshop where he makes and sells furniture, mainly chairs, beds, tables and desks. He started this business with an aim of generating income for the family, but to supplement this he also farms crops.

His challenges are his small capital base and the high prices of lumber, yet he dreams of building a permanent home for his family and educating his children from the proceeds of the business. John is requesting a loan to buy more lumber for making furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy more lumber for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used his previous loan to buy more inputs for his farm, like fertilizers and mulch. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, where he owns a coffee plantation. He supplements his income by rearing cattle and goats and brewing a local brew to earn extra income and look after his family. He has further diversified his businesses, starting to buy and sell coffee.

He hopes to improve and expand on the level of output from his plantation. However, his main challenges are competition and bad weather. He needs a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio, a young enterprising man, is 29 years old and lives with the family in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle spare parts retail shop and at the same time is a mechanic who offers services to his customers,.Donozio also has five years of farming experience which helps him to meet his family's needs.

He is faced with the challenge of a small capital base yet he has dreams of expanding his business into a wholesale shop. Donozio intends to use the loan to buy more motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Kaka Yohanna

texts.en:
Kaka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kaka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kaka would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when maize market prices are at their lowest, in order to meet her immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Kaka can now store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Kaka will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Ma. Idyl

texts.en:
Ma. Idyl, a 38-year-old married mother of one child, works in her own retail store. She also raises pigs to supplement her husband's income from carpentry.

Ma Idyl took a new loan recently to use as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store to purchase more goods to sell. Improving her business is her main goal to achieve her dreams of having a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SALOME es una persona trabajadora de 50 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local a la vez cuenta con el servicio básico energía eléctrica y agua, el domicilio está ubicado en la calle Pereira de la Provincia de Tiraque y sus terrenos agrícolas está ubicado en la comunidad de Parra Rancho, su actividad económica es la agrícola en tal sentido produce papa, haba en vaina verde, cebada, maíz en grano, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados en una superficie de 3.8759 has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por inundación. El dinero que tenía anteriormente fue destinado para la compra de herramientas agrícolas, en ese sentido el cliente se ve con una necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y la compra de semilla de papa, con la producción en el futuro y así a la vez mejorar  sus ingresos y mejorar económicamente para una mejor vivencia familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Salome is a hard-working person. She is 50 years old, single, and managed to study up to elementary school. She has 3 economic dependents in her care and lives in her own home, which is of rustic construction made with local materials. At the same time, she has basic energy, electric, and water service. The home is located in Pereira street, Tiraque province, and her agricultural plots are located in the community of Parra Rancho.
