Her business is agriculture in the sense that she produces potatoes, green pod beans, barley, and grain corn. All the aforementioned crops are cultivated in a 3.8759 hectare area. There is irrigation, applied by flooding. The money which she had previously was destined for purchasing agricultural implements. Having said that, the client now finds it necessary to request a loan to enable the purchase of organic fertilizer (chicken manure,) and seed potatoes, with future production and so she can improve her income and improve economically for a better family living experience.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure).

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 50-year-old widow with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She owns a bar and restaurant and also sells clothes on market days.

She was encouraged to start up this business to be independent after the death of her husband. This has improved the family’s general well-being. She hopes to build a house in the future and educate her children.

Judith describes herself as a hard-working lady and wants a loan to buy saucepans, plates and other items to use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, plates and other items to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina is a married mother of two children who both attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Joanina operates a stall selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret has two children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a bar that sells soft drinks and sodas, which she has been doing for one year. She faces the challenge of inadequate capital for her business.

Margaret requested a loan, which she will use to buy beers and sodas. She is charged with a responsibility of paying school fees for her children. Margret dreams of buying land.

loans.use: to purchase beers and sodas.

loans.name: Sintiki

texts.en:
Sintiki is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sintiki is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sintiki would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sintiki will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sintiki now can achieve her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hassan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hassan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hassan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hassan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 31-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda where he operates a store selling maize and beans. He also earns income from farming and motorcycle transport.

The store is the most lucrative business in this area and many people in the community get employment during the peak season.

His dreams are to complete construction of a permanent house and educate his children. Alex is challenged by the poor road network and low capital. He intends to use the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 39-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a business buying and selling cows, and he has been doing this for over 6 years. He was inspired to buy land and start construction by his workmates who have developed and built houses for their families.

Through this encouragement, Paul has gone ahead and paid the school fees for his children. He has faced the hardship of inadequate capital that limits him from achieving his dream of expanding and building rentals.

Paul has requested a loan to help him plaster his house and complete its construction.

loans.use: to plaster his house and complete its construction.

loans.name: Amina A

texts.en:
Amina is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who is, requesting a loan to buy clothing to sell, She is currently living with her child in the Bagamoyo district.

Amina is volunteering as a learner guide in a secondary school in her village. Amina is now requesting a Kiva loan to start a women's clothing business. She plans to use the profit she will earn to help her family and to support her child. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Amina's earnings from two and a half hours of volunteering every week.

loans.use: to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ishaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ishaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret has children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer, growing onions, tomatoes, and Irish potatoes. She also does dairy farming, producing milk to sell at a nearby dairy.

Margret requested a loan, which she will use to buy herbicides and pay workers who are weeding the garden. She is charged with the responsibility of educating all her children and looking after her family.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and pay workers who are weeding the garden.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhassan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Makwala village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer from Ali Gari village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

joining Babban Gona, Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Sule can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sule no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Sule hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a women trying to earn a living and support her family. She works as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya selling green products such as clean-burning cookstoves and solar lamps in Nairobi's slums.

Stella has a positive attitude and connects well with customers. Her best selling product is the clean-burning cookstove which uses half the charcoal of a traditional cookstove. This saves customers money and they are eager to buy.

Please help fund this Kiva loan for Stella to purchase more products so that she can continue to earn and save more money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase clean cookstoves to resell.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Tasiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest for low prices in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Tasiu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Laura Yaquelin

texts.es: Laura, de 29 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Ella cuenta con su propio negocio de pulpería donde ofrece productos como ser churros, refrescos, dulces, galletas y jugos. Este negocio lo tiene en un local que alquila desde hace 1 año. Antes se dedicaba a sus estudios y en busca de obtener sus propios ingresos decidió poner el negocio. Ella solicita 21,000 Lempiras para la Compra de Productos como granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, y productos de limpieza para surtir y aumentar sus ventas. Su sueño es tener su propio local, surtir el negocio y ayudar a su familia a progresar y alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lautra is 29 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. She has her own grocery store where she sells products such as churros, soft drinks, candy, cookies and juice. Her business has been located in premises that she rents for one year. Before this she was a student, and in search of an income of her own she decided to open this business.  She is requesting 21,000 lempiras to buy products such as basic grains, dairy products, meat, sugar, lard, eggs, bread, and cleaning products, to supply her business and increase her sales. Her dream is to have her own business premises, supply her store, and help her family to progress and to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, dairy products, meat, sugar, lard, eggs, bread, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Elizabeth would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can now store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Elizabeth is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Billings

texts.en:
Billings is 33 years old and is married with one child. He currently runs three Zoona mobile money transfer outlets and is looking to expand his business by increasing the funds that he currently has to serve his customers.

Billings has already managed to expand from one to three outlets and he is looking to keep this momentum going as this will improve his standard of living as well as that of his wife and child. Billings' main objective is to make easy, quick and mostly safe money transfer facilities accessible to everyone in the rural communities of Zambia, and to increase the footprint of his Zoona business in the Eastern region of Zambia.

Currently, Billings uses the revenue generated by his Zoona outlets to take care of his family and generate capital in order to expand his business and be a source of employment in his community. He already employs seven people. He is also looking to purchase a home for himself and his family, as well as further his education, thus empowering himself so that he will be able to plough all his future skills and knowledge back into his business.

Being able to run his own business has allowed Billings to keep his family afloat; however, he is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have his outlets become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind for himself and those who depend on him, including his family as well as a large part of his community.

A huge challenge for Billlings is the constant float shortages he currently experiences, especially when assisting a client who needs to send a large sum of money. This results in him losing clients to other mobile money transfer competitors and also results in his clients losing faith in his services.

On a broader spectrum, Billings would like to be able to give back to his community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind. One of his objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community so clients no longer have to spend on travel. It would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience.

At the present time, Billings does not have the necessary capital needed to execute his vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump start his endeavor while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate capital to expand his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will now be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Samaila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 1 y 7 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá
Sabina se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva 10 años de realizar este negocio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la plaza de su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una variedad de verduras con esto mejora sus ingresos.
Sabina se ve a necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción esto para construir su casa que a su familia le hace mucha falta, pues con el paso de los años las necesidades han incrementado. Los materiales que ella comprara son: cemento, cal y arena.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sabina is 27 years old. She is married, with a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 1 and 7 years. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. Sabina works buying and selling traditional clothing, and has had this business for 10 years. Her business is located in the town square in her community. She also works in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables to increase her income. Sabina needs a loan to buy construction materials for her family's house, which is in great need of repair because over the years its needs have increased. The materials that she will buy are cement, lime and sand. Her greatest desire is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, lime, and sand.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en:
Efia, 24 years old, is a farmer dealing in her tomato business. She is requesting a loan in order to continue investing in her farm.

Efia's work involves preparing and cultivating her farm and planting tomatoes and garlic. She also volunteers as a Camfed learner guide; she gives time each week to mentor young students and members of her community through a range of personal issues.

Efia plans to use the profits she will earn to buy a larger farm for her tomato business. Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Efia's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to expand her tomato plantation.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine a 47 ans, elle vit en concubinage dont il est un intermédiaire dans la vente de bois. Le nombre d’enfants est de six dont quatre encore à leur charge, les deux autres étant déjà mariés. Trois enfants sont scolarisés (11-10-8 ans) dans un établissement primaire publique, un autre enfant ne va plus à l’école faute de moyens.  
Elle vend des papiers emballages.L’objectif est de percer les marchés (besoin croissant de fonds de roulement)  au niveau des autres régions car c’est une activité encore porteur. Elle dispose de 12 années d’expérience dans la vente de ces produits qui sont surtout utilisés comme toitures des maisons. C’est une activité innovante, la concurrence est encore faible. Les produits peuvent être stockés. Martine a déjà ses propres clients à qui elle livre les produits. Martine était tireur de pousse- pousse avant.
Le concubin (père de ses enfants) est également à la recherche d’un emploi décent, leur rêve étant de pouvoir éduquer les enfants.
texts.en:
Martine is 47 years old and cohabitates with someone who is an intermediary who sells wood. The number of children amounts to six, of whom four are still in their care. Two others are already married. Three children (aged 11, 10, and 8) are in a public primary school. Another no longer goes to school due to a lack of means.

Martine sells wrapping paper. The goal is to penetrate the markets (a growing need for working capital) in other regions, since this business is still expanding. Martine has twelve years of experience selling these products, which are especially used in roofing for houses. This is an innovative business, and competition is still low. The products can be stocked. She already has her own customers to whom she makes delivery of the products. She used to pull a rickshaw.

Her partner (the children’s father) is also looking for decent employment, their dream being to be able to educate the children.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of wrapping paper of different kinds

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador tiene 31 años de edad, está en unión libre y vive con su mujer y un hijo actualmente, la inversión que quiere realizar es la compra de semilla e insumos para el cultivo de chile dulce, el cual por el clima que presenta la región es óptimo para tener una buena cosecha, con esta siembra el espera vender el chile a un buen precio para mantener a su familia en buenas condiciones socioeconómicas. Este es el  primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Dany, an enterprising, responsible, and hard-working man, is 31 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and one son currently. He wants to buy seeds and supplies to grow chile dulce [similar to a bell pepper]. The region's climate is optimal for a good harvest of it. With this planting, he hopes to sell the chile at a good price in order to keep his family in a good socioeconomic situation. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan on easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.es: Cristobalina, una mujer trabajadora, tiene 69 años de edad,  ella es soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive sola actualmente, ella  quiere comprar mercadería para un negocio de abarrotes que tiene hace ya varios años, con esta compra tendría un mejor inventario para poder ofrecer a los clientes y de esta manera vender más productos y podrá  obtener mejores ganancias económicas,  es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cristobalina is a hardworking 69 year old woman. She is single, has two children, and currently lives by herself. She wants to buy merchandise for a grocery store she's had for various years. With this purchase she will have better inventory to offer to her clients, so she will sell more products and be able to obtain greater economic income.

This is the first loan she has received from Fudecosur. She has no other loans in state banks. Fudecosur has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: Bolívar, un hombre trabajador, tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa e hijos actualmente, él quiere comprarse una vaca para cría con el fin de vender los terneros y de esta manera obtener ganancias económicas y si fuera el caso él también se dejaría las crías hembras para después producir más ganado, y de esta manera aumentar el número de ganado a su poder por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, y es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Bolívar, a hardworking man, is 62 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children at present. He wants to buy a cow for breeding in order to sell the calves and thus obtain economic profits. If necessary, he would also stay with the female offspring to later produce more cattle and therefore increase the number of cattle to his power, which is why he is requesting a loan. It's the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He doesn't record other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with the greatest facilities and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: A sus 41 años de edad Ana siempre muestra sus deseos de superación, con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y bisutería fina, actividad que lleva realizando desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Ana habita en vivienda muy humilde la cual está hecha de lámina, y en ella vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, a los que ha sacado adelante como madre soltera. Ana desea continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, ya que cada día son mayores los pedidos que recibe, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, cremas de mano y cuerpo, desodorantes, bisutería fina entre otros productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, Ana always shows her desires of getting ahead with her business selling beauty products and fine costume jewelry. She has been doing this job for several years, so she has a good number of clients. Ana lives with her two children, ages 17 and 14, in a very humble home made of corrugated sheet metal. She has raised her children as a single mother.

Ana wants to continue investing in her business, as every day she gets more orders, so she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in lotions, body and hand creams, deodorants, fine costume jewelry and other products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, body and hand creams, deodorants, fine costume jewelry and other products for her business.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.fr:
Hanna a 32 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a deux enfants (13-9 ans) en classe de troisième et neuvième.  Le conjoint travaille comme chauffeur.
Elle vend du lait et du pain soja devant son domicile depuis 2012. C’est la première activité génératrice de revenus qu’elle crée. L’objectif de l’investissement est de respecter les normes d’hygiène dans l’activité (vitrine). C’est une activité qui se distingue des autres dans le secteur car, rares sont ceux qui vendent du lait et du pain soja, la majorité vendent du café. Les clients cibles sont les passants.  Elle a exercé cette activité pour augmenter  les revenus familiaux. La réalisation de cette activité ne perturbe pas sa vie familiale, elle dispose de beaucoup de temps pour les travaux de ménage car le lieu de vente se situe devant son domicile. Par ailleurs, c’est seulement le matin et l’après midi qu’elle vend. L’objectif est  l’extension de l’activité.
texts.en:
Hanna is 32 years old and married. The couple have two children aged 13 and 9 years old, in ninth grade and fourth grade. Hanna's husband works as a driver.

Hanna has been selling milk and soy bread in front of her house since 2012. This is the first money-earning activity she has created. The goal of the loan is to respect the rules of hygiene in her business by having a display case. This is an activity that distinguishes itself from others in her area since they mostly sell coffee, not milk and soy bread.

Hanna's target customers are passers-by. She works at this business so as to increase the family's income. Running the business does not interfere with her family life; she still has plenty of time for her housekeeping duties because the stall is located right in front of her house. Also, she only makes sales in the morning and afternoon. Her goal is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, an umbrella, a big cooking pot, soy, sugar, flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es casado con una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 18 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Mario es un padre de familia con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, el lleva 20 años de trabajar como mecánico, gracias a esta labor a su familia ha logrado mantener. Mario desde hace varios años ha tenido el anhelo de construir su casa pero lamentablemente no le ha sido posible por esa razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: block, hierro, cemento.
Su esperanza de vida es mejorar las condiciones la calidad de vida de su familia, pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mario is 41 years old. He is married, with a family of three children between the ages of 5 and 18. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. Mario is a father with great aspirations in life. He has worked for 20 years as a mechanic, and thanks to this work has been able to support his family. For years Mario has had a desire to build his own house, but unfortunately this has not been possible for him. For this reason he requesting a loan that he will use to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, iron, and cement. His hope in life is to improve the quality of his family's living conditions, and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, iron, and cement.

loans.name: Ma. Josefa

texts.en: Ma. Josefa is a 48-year-old married woman from Tubigon, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer while Ma. Josefa buys and sells “tuba” a Filipino word which means coconut wine. She has been doing this for 30 years to get extra income. Thus, Ma. Josefa wants to improve and expand her business. She also wants to have other business opportunities like raising pigs and selling “ukay-ukay” (imported used clothes). With this, she is asking for a loan to buy “tuba” (coconut wine) to sell. In addition to this Ma. Josefa will also buy “ukay-ukay” (as mentioned) that will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy "tuba" (coconut wine) and ukay-ukay" (imported used clothes)

loans.name: Eden

texts.es: Edén, un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador, tiene 32 años de edad, está en unión libre y vive con su mujer e hijos actualmente,  por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, para la compra de terneros con el fin de criarlos y engordarlos para la venta, con las ganancias podrá comprar más animales y ayudar en gastos de la familia, es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edén is an enterprising and very hardworking man. He is 32 years old and has a common law marriage. He currently lives with his mother and his children. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy calves with the goal of raising them and fattening them for sale. With the profits, he will be able to buy more animals and help with the household expenses. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Edier Jose

texts.es: Edier, un joven trabajador, responsable y emprendedor, tiene 22  años de edad, vive con su familia actualmente, él quiere comprarse unos novillos para doble propósito, este joven ya cuenta con una buena experiencia para esta actividad ya que su familia siempre ha trabajado con ganado, la idea es engordar y también reproducir crías que se puedan vender para maximizar las ganancias de la actividad y de esta  manera aumentar el número de ganado a su poder por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, este es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edier is 22 years old. He is a young, responsible, entrepreneurial worker. He lives with his family. He wants to buy some young cows for two purposes. This young man already has good experience doing this since his family has always worked with cattle. The idea is to fatten them up and also to breed young ones that can be sold in order to maximize the earnings from this occupation. In this way he will increase the number of cattle that he has. That is why he is requesting a loan.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy young female cows

loans.name: Emmanuell

texts.es: Emmanuel, un joven emprendedor, responsable y esforzado  tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre actualmente, él quiere comprarse unas novillas para cría con el fin de vender los terneros y de esta manera obtener ganancias económicas, él también tiene pensado en dejarse unas crías para engordarlas y posteriormente venderlas para tener más y mejores ganancias,  por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, este es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Emmanuell is a young, responsible, and brave entrepreneur. He is 19 years old, single, and he currently lives with his mother. He wants to buy some heifers to raise in order to then sell their calves, and thus obtain financial gains. He has also thought of keeping some calves to fatten up and then sell them in order to have more and better earnings, and for this reason he is requesting a loan.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not recorded other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy some heifers.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.es: Olivier, un hombre emprendedor, trabajador y responsable, tiene 38 años de edad, es divorciado y vive con sus hijos actualmente, él quiere comprar ganado que le sirva para doble propósito y poder vender crías, novillos de engorde y novillas listas para la cría, así de esta manera obtener ganancias económicas y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos que para el son lo más importante, por lo que él hace una solicitud de crédito, este es el  primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Olivier, an enterprising, hard-working, and responsible man, is 38 years old. He is divorced and currently lives with his children. He wants to buy cattle that will be dual-purpose, and to be able to sell calves, beef cows, and heifers ready to breed, and in this way obtain income and improve the quality of life for his children, who are the most important thing for him. He is therefore requesting a loan. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan on easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is 63 years old, married and has five adult children. She sells food like lumpia (spring roll), hotdogs and sweetened meat in the community just to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years to sustain herself every day. Thus, Leonora is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as vegetables, spices, lumpia wrapper (spring roll wrapper), cooking oil, hotdogs and sweetened meat. In the future, she wishes to have a food stall that will help her catch the attention of her consumers so as to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, lumpia wrapper (spring roll wrapper), cooking oil, hotdogs and sweetened meat

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 37 ans, Akouvi est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Avec un seul enfant à charge, Akouvi est une revendeuse des objets en plastique. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines en plastiques en vue de bien revendre et de satisfaire parfaitement aux attentes de ses clients puis réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Single and 37 years of age, Akouvi is a woman living in Adidogomé. With one dependent child, Akouvi is a retailer of plastic products. Akouvi buys her products twice a month from the market and resells them in the surrounding neighborhoods. Akouvi is requesting this loan in order to purchase several dozen plastic buckets, so that she can successfully resell them all, meet the needs of her customers, and make a profit to be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy six dozen plastic buckets.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his mid 30s, is married with one small child. He has been a tailor since 2008. He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a sewing machine, sewing equipment for use in tailoring and to sell in his tailoring equipment shop. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with his loan. He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay the loan, bought a TV set, a radio, a sofa set, cupboards for utensils and for clothes and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy sewing products for sewing and to increase stock in his tailoring shop to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of building his own house.

Mohamed will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products for sewing and to increase stock in his tailoring shop to meet his customers'  requirements.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian es un campesino de 18 años de edad, trabajador y pujante que, desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo mientras le ayudaba a su padre. 

Desde hace unos meses tiene sus propios cultivos de maíz, cuya cosecha recolecta y vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside. 

Pero con el ánimo de poder desplazarse más fácilmente sus cultivos y poder transportar sus insumos se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará una motocicleta.

Sebastian manifiesta que seguirá luchando para lograr sus objetivos y metas, especialmente quiere adquirir una finca propia con grandes terrenos para cultivar gran variedad de productos y así poder garantizar una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Sebastian is an 18 year old farmer, hardworking and powerful at that. As a child he learned to perform all the labors of the farm as he helped his father.

For some months now he has had his own crops of corn, which are harvested and sold in the market of the town where he lives.

But with the aim of being able to move more easily to transport his crops and supplies, he felt motivated to apply for a loan to use to buy a motorcycle.

Sebastian evinces that he will continue to fight to achieve his objectives and goals. He especially wants to acquire own farm, with a lot of land to grow a large variety of products and thereby ensure a better quality of life for his extended family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport supplies and crops.

loans.name: Delcy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delcy, a sus 46 años de edad es una mujer con visión, emprendedora y muy activa; por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil conseguir oportunidades de trabajo, por lo cual ha decidido iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, para lo cual requiere el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor como ropa, zapatos, accesorios, entre otros con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que inicialmente serían familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector.

Con esto podrá obtener ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar y podrá invertir más en su negocio así, podrá ir avanzando para convertirse en una líder del negocio, ser altamente productiva y muy competitiva a nivel comercial, así podrá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delcy, 46, is a visionary, enterprising, and very active woman. Due to her lack of experience, it has been difficult for her to find a job, which is why she decided to start her own business selling different products. This is why she needs a loan.

She will buy products in bulk, such as clothes, shoes, and accessories, and take advantage of the discounts they are offering her. She will have a wide variety to offer to her customers, which would be relatives, neighbors and friends in the beginning.

This will help her to receive an income and help sustain her home. She will be able to invest more in her business, get ahead, become a leader in her sector, and be highly productive and competitive commercially. Her income will improve, as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk, such as clothes, shoes, and accessories, and take advantage of the discounts they are offering her.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ayuba can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ayuba has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Ayuba is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr: Assoupi est une femme âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Assoupi est une marchande de produits alimentaires et des chaussures qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Assoupi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des paniers de tomates fraîches et des douzaines de chaussures pour femmes en vue de mieux revendre puis tirer plus de profit afin de bien contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Assoupi is a 31 year old woman who lives in Adidogomé. Married and a mother of one child, she is a seller of food products and shoes. She stocks up once a month at the market and resells the goods under a shed structure in front of her home. Assoupi would like this loan to finance the purchase of fresh tomato baskets and dozens of women's shoes in order to resell at a profit and contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 10 dozen women's shoes

loans.name: Swaumu H

texts.en: Swaumu is a 20-year-old entrepreneur. She is a single mother living with her parent in Bagamoyo district. She is volunteering as a learner guide, facilitating a life skills program to youth in her community. Swaumu is requesting a Kiva loan to a start a poultry business. She plans to use the profit she will earn to help her family and children. Her social interest loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
MAMOUTOU, est le monsieur qui a la corde du bœuf sur la photo,un malien non scolarisé  âgé de 42 ans Il est marié père de 07 enfants, 01 garçon et 06 filles. Les enfants sont âgés de 3 à 22 ans dont trois (03) filles fréquente  l’école. 
Sa femme est une ménagère et fait le petit commerce.
 MAMOUTOU fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité d’élevage bovin. Il mène cette activité depuis longtemps. Cette activité lui plait beaucoup.
Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de la localité et revend dans le même marché.  
Le profit qu’il gagne lui aidera de diminuer les charges de sa famille. 
Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. 
Dans l’avenir, MAMOUTOU veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir  augmenter le volume de son activité afin de tirer beaucoup de profit.
texts.en:
Mamoutou is the man holding the steer's rope on the photo.  Mamoutou comes from Mali; he is 42 years old and never went to school.  He is married and the father of seven children (one boy and six girls).  His children's ages range from 3 to 22 years old.  Three of his daughters go to school.  Mamoutou's wife is a homemaker who is also involved in small retail business.

Mamoutou has turned to Kiva's partner, the RMCR, in order to boost his animal husbandry business.  He has been raising cattle for a long time and he really enjoys this activity.  He buys cattle at the local market and resells at the same market.  With his profits, he will be able to take care of some of his family's expenses.  He often faces a slump in sales at the market.

In the future, Mamoutou would like to receive a larger loan, which would allow him to increase his activity and his profits.

loans.use: to raise oxen.

loans.name: Adzaratou

texts.fr: Adzaratou est une femme mariée de 53 ans habitant à Tokoin. Sans enfant, Adzaratou est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Adzaratou demande ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et mieux vendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et soutenir sa famille dans certaines charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Adzaratou is a married woman, 53 years old, living in Tokoin. Without any children, she is a merchant of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), which she gets at the market five times a month and resells by going through nearby neighborhoods. To put in an order for lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Adzaratou is asking for this loan to acquire a large number for her inventory and to have better sales. Then she can have a good profit margin and cover certain daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase six lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Las Flores Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Generación Las Flores” está conformada por 5 personas que vienen trabajando responsablemente, representada por su presidenta la Sra. Luz de 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos independientes. Ella tiene como negocio desde hace algunos años una bodega en casa que gracias al apoyo que viene recibiendo de KIVA su negocio sigue creciendo, ofreciendo todo tipo de golosinas, alimentos y bebidas, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio como surtir de más productos su bodega. En la foto grupal la Sra. Luz se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en: The communal bank "New Generation Flowers" is made up of 5 people who have been working responsibly, and it is represented by its president Luz, who is 60 years old, and married with 3 independent children. Luz has had a small shop in her home for some years now, and thanks to the support from Kiva, her business continues to grow. She offers all kinds of goodies, food and drink, and she will invest the loan in her business by stocking it with more products. In the group photo Luz is standing in the middle of her seated companions.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, and food to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 47-year-old woman who owns a sari-sari (variety) store in Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while her youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a fisherman and works hard to provide for the needs of their family.

Sonia has been running her store business for six years. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and drinks. She wants to improve her business in the future to have enough money to send all of her children to school. She definitely wants them all to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and drinks

loans.name: El Campo Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense conocida por su tranquilidad, su tradición prehispánica y su población trabajadora y amable se integró el grupo llamado El Campo. Los integrantes de dicho grupo son personas muy alegres y emprendedoras, las madres de familia han tomado un nuevo reto al ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos y educación de sus hijos.
   Leticia es quizá la integrante más alegre, entusiasta y, ante todo, amable.  Doña Lety, como le llaman de cariño, se ha dedicado a la cría de ovejas por más de diez años; anteriormente sólo se dedicaba al hogar pero el aportar ingresos la motivó a no darse por vencida. “Inicié con la cría de los animales pues mis hijos eran muy pequeños para que yo los pudiera dejar solos y con esta actividad generaba ingresos y no descuidaba a mi familia” comentó contenta pues ahora tres de sus cuatro hijos continúan estudiando. 
   El cuidado que dedica a cada uno de sus animales es muy especial ya que sólo les ofrece la mejor calidad de alimento y los mantiene en un ambiente tranquilo y, sobre todo, muy limpio. Todos sus ejemplares son adquiridos dentro de su misma comunidad y una vez que están listos para su venta, busca a los mejores “barbacoyeros” (personas que elaboran un platillo tradicional) de la región quienes siempre le ofrecen un muy buen precio por cada oveja. 
  Con la oportunidad del préstamo podría comprar cinco borregos pequeños además de alimento y vitaminas para asegurar su producción de fin de año. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es, por un lado, que sus hijos puedan realizarse profesionalmente y por otro mejorar su vivienda. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Zenaida quien invertirá en productos de papelería; Celia y Adela, en una tienda de abarrotes; Irene y Esperanza, en cerdos y Alejandra y Lidia, en aves de corral.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, Lety es quien carga en su espalda a un bebé.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community known for its peace, its pre-Hispanic tradition,and its hard working and kind population, there is a group called El Campo ("The Field"). The members of this group are very happy and enterprising. The mothers of the family have taken on a new challenge of helping their husbands with the expenses and education of their children.

Leticia is perhaps the happiest, most enthusiastic, and, above all, kindest member. Mrs. Lety, as they call her lovingly, has been dedicated to raising sheep for more than 10 years. Previously, she only worked in the home, but contributing to the family's income motivated her to not be defeated. She said that she started raising animals because her children were young, so she could leave them along; with this activity, she was generating income and not neglecting her family. She is happy because now three of her four children continue studying.

The care that is offers each one of her animals is very special, since she only offers them the best quality food and keeps them in a peaceful and, above all, very clean environment. All of her pigs were bought from her own community, and once they are ready for sale, she finds the best "barbacoyeros" (people who make a traditional dish) in the area; these people always offer a very good price for each sheep.

With the opportunity of the loan, she would be able to buy five small sheep, as well as food and vitamins to ensure to ensure her production at the end of the year. One of her biggest dreams is, on the one hand, that her children become professionals and, on the other, to improve her home.

The other members of the group are Zenaida, who will invest in paper products; Celia and Adela, who will invest in a grocery store; Irene and Esperanza, who will invest in pigs; and Alejandra and Lidia, who will invest in poultry.

* The photograph was taken on the stairs of the city pavilion. Lets is the one who carries a baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

location.town: Monte Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 36 years old and lives in San Dionesio, Iloilo with her husband and five children, ages 15, 13, 12, 11 and 10. For the last three years, Cheryl has earned a living through a food and snack-selling business. Aside from this, she is also engaged in the hog raising business and owns a motorcycle which also gives them extra income.

Her goal for the future is to increase her income to have enough money to send her children to school to become professionals someday. To do this, she wants to borrow money to buy food ingredients such as fruit, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. She will also buy piglets to raise. In this way, she will possibly increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as fruit, sugar, flour and cooking oil, and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Don Joaquín vive en una comunidad pequeña del Estado de México; es muy tranquila y sus habitantes son personas trabajadoras quienes se dedican a la cría de animales además del cultivo de maíz, producto consumido desde tiempos prehispánicos.
  Estas características son compartidas por Joaquín y su familia integrada por su esposa Alicia y sus con cuatro hijos de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando. Para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, decidió continuar con la actividad que le enseñó su padre; brindar servicio de taxi. En un inicio sólo ocupaba la unidad propiedad de su padre pero tiempo después, con base en su esfuerzo y ahorros, consiguió una unidad propia y actualmente tiene otra más que emplea a una persona de su comunidad.
   Al día de hoy cuenta con clientes seguros los cuales personalmente solicitan de sus servicios ya que conocen su amabilidad, profesionalidad y precio justo. Una de sus metas futuras es seguir realizando su labor para adquirir más unidades que puedan ofrecer servicio a personas de otras comunidades. De igual modo, la idea de brindar trabajo a personas emprendedoras le causa una gran alegría pues le recuerda su propio camino que gradualmente ha llegado al éxito.
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecido con el préstamo adquirido con VFMéxico porque le ayuda comprar llantas nuevas, refacciones, pagos de tenencias, mantenimiento, etc. "Gracias a mi primer apoyo pude obtener un nuevo taxi y con las ganancias obtenidas instalé un centro de cómputo de forma sencilla" comentó contento. De esta manera, mientras él se dedica al servicio de taxi, su esposa se encarga de atender el centro de cómputo; además todos los fines de semana abren un puesto en donde venden comida típica. Cabe mencionar, igualmente, que en la próxima temporada la pareja vende flores y veladoras utilizadas en la celebración del día de muertos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada con su taxi el cual maneja dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Joaquin lives in a small community of the State of Mexico. It is a quiet town and its inhabitants are hardworking people who work raising animals and also cultivating corn, a product consumed since pre columbian times. These characteristics are shared by Joaquin and by his family, comprised by his wife Alicia and their four children, three of whom are studying. In order to support his household, he decided to continue with the activity taught by his father: to provide taxi services. At the beginning, he was only using the car belonging to his father, but later on, thanks to his effort and savings, he was able to acquire his own car; and he currently has one more car, used by another person he employs native of his community. Nowadays, he has regular customers who personally require his services because they already know him for his kindness, professionalism and fair price. One of his future goals is to continue working so he can purchase more units that can give service to people in other communities. Also, the idea of providing work for enterprising people make him very happy because it reminds him of his own path that gradually led to success. On the other hand, he is very grateful for the loan received from VFMéxico because it helps him to buy new tires, to pay for repairs, to pay for vehicle possession taxes, maintenance, etc. "Thanks to my first loan, I was able to buy a new taxi, and with the earnings, I installed a computer center easily", he commented happily. In this way, while he works providing taxi services, his wife works in the computer center. Also, every weekend they open a stall where they sell regional food. It is also worth mentioning that in the next season this couple sells flours and candles used in the celebration of the Day of the Dead.
*The photograph was taken with his taxi, which he drives within the community.

loans.use: to buy new tires, for repairs and to pay for vehicle possession taxes, etc.

loans.name: Domitilia

texts.es:
Domitila, de 49 años de edad, no estudio porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos para darle la oportunidad de estudiar, pero eso no le impidió aprender a leer, porque se inscribió en el programa que implemento el gobierno de alfabetización y a través de este nuevo programa puede leer, escribir y firmar; es madre soltera, hace aproximadamente 8 años su esposo la abandonó con sus 5 hijos, los cuales con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a podido solventar sus necesidades y su única fuente de ingreso es el trabajo agrícola, especificamente la corta de café.

Domitilia, junto a uno de sus hijos se dedica a confeccionar los uniformes de la escuela; ella se encarga de cortar la tela para la elaboración de los uniformes y este es un ingreso más para ella y sus hijos; otro de sus hijos está estudiando en la universidad, porque es muy inteligente y le otorgaron una beca para que estudiara en la universidad y su última hija está terminando su bachillerato.

Domitilia, necesita el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de graduación de su hija, porque está culminando sus estudios de bachillerato y necesita dinero para que ella se gradué.
 
Sus sueños son, poder ver a sus hijos como personas profesionales y con mejores oportunidades de desarrollo en el ámbito profesional; pero a parte de eso también le gustaría remodelar su vivienda porque actualmente su casa es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Domitilia, 49, could not study because her parents did not have enough money to pay for her studies. However, that did not stop her from learning to read, because she registered for a state-run literacy program. Thanks to this program, she learned how to read, write, and sign.

She is a single mother. Approximately eight years ago, her husband left her and her five children. She has managed to raise them with hard work and sacrifice. Her only source of income are her agricultural activities, mainly coffee picking.

Domitilia, makes school uniforms with one of her children. She cuts the fabrics to make them, which gives her an additional income for her and her children. One of her children goes to the university, because he is very intelligent and received a scholarship to go to the university. Her youngest daughter is finishing high school.

Domitilia needs the loan to cover her daughter's graduation costs, now that she is finishing her studies. She needs money so that her daughter can graduate.

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals, with better opportunities to develop professionally. In addition, she would like to remodel her house, which is made of wattle and daub.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's graduation costs.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, 36, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For the past year she has worked hard at buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Joan has applied for a 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional vegetables such as garlic, onions, cabbages, carrots and tomatoes to sell in her food stall. She is saving her money in order to provide a stable and secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables such as garlic, onions, cabbages, carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es: Heriberta, de 55 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y vive junto a su esposo en el municipio de San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara. Ella vende productos de primera necesidad en su pulpería tales como arroz, lácteos, manteca, harina, azúcar, productos de limpieza, pan, huevos etc. El negocio lleva 4 años de funcionar y lo tiene establecido en su casa. Ella solicita la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de productos para surtir la pulperia como ser arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceites, manteca, jabón, harina y refrescos. Anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo y producción de café, el cual ahora es atendido por su esposo.  Su meta es aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades y tener una buena calidad de vida  en familia.
texts.en:
Heriberta is 55 years old and is the mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in the town of San Nicolás in Santa Bárbara. She sells basic needs products in her grocery store like rice, dairy, lard, flour, sugar, cleaning products, bread, eggs, etc. The business has been open for four years and she has it set up in her home.

Heriberta is requesting 10,000 Lempiras which she plans on investing in the purchase of products to stock her store like rice, beans, corn, oil, lard, soap, flour, and beverages. She previously made a living in the cultivation and production of coffee, which is now looked after by her husband. Heriberta's goal is to increase her sales and obtain better profits in order to cover her necessities and have a good quality of life within her family.

loans.use: to purchase products like rice, beans, corn, oil, lard, soap, flour, and beverages to stock.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix es un hombre con grandes propósitos en la vida, él cuenta que le fue muy bien con su préstamo, pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus insumos para su cultivo y una buena cosecha obtuvo, pues con esta avance él está muy satisfecho porque su cultivo ha incrementado, pero nuevamente se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo por esa razón solicita otro crédito de seis mil quetzales para la compra de abonos químicos y semillas de papas. Félix tiene las esperanzas de sacar una buena cosecha y así pagar su préstamo. Su gran sueño es seguir ampliando su cultivo.
texts.en:
Félix is a man with big intentions in life. He relates that things went well with his prior loan. Thanks to it he was able to buy supplies for his crops, and obtained a good harvest. He's very satisfied with this development, because his crop has increased.

However, the need for a new loan has presented itself again. For that reason he seeks another loan of six thousand quetzales to buy chemical fertilizers and potato seeds. Félix has hopes of obtaining a good harvest in order to repay the loan. His big dream is to continue expanding his crops.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Sam On is a village cheif in O Tasek Village living with wife. Spending 20 years raising 7 children, he wants to have a comfortable life. All his children now are grown up and have their families. Currently Sam On lives with his wife and still keep working on farming and Village Chief work.

He has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Sam On decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. He believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: O Tasek Village, Kouk Banteay Commune, Rolea Pe Ea

loans.name: Hindatu

texts.en:
Hindatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hindatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Hindatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hindatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Hindatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hindatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a 20-year-old entrepreneur, She is single, living with her parents in Bagamoyo district. She is volunteering as a learner guide, facilitating a life skills program to youth in secondary school in her village. Debora is requesting a Kiva loan to start a women's clothing business. She plans to use the profit she will earn to help her family and to pursue further education. Her “social interest” loan will be repaid through Debora's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to start a women's clothing business.

loans.name: Patrisha

texts.en:
Patrisha is 21 years old. She lives with her mother and eight siblings in Kilosa district. She is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide; she gives time each week to mentor young students and community members in life skills and personal growth.

Patrisha is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy maize in bulk from farmers and sell in town markets. Her maize business enables her to help her siblings by paying school contributions and to support her family with daily basic needs. She plans to use the profit to expand her business by opening a shop. Her “social-interest” on the loan will be paid through Patrisha's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Stellamarris

texts.en: Stellamarris is a young woman living in Nairobi's slums in search of an opportunity to improve her life. She started working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya, where she earns an income selling green energy products like clean cookstoves and solar lamps in her community. She is learning valuable job skills in sales, customer service and professionalism that will help her throughout her lifetime. Please help Stellamarris in her quest for financial independence by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Maysam

texts.en:
Maysam, a 50 year old Lebanese woman, is the owner of a grocery store located in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the same neighborhood as her shop.

Ten years ago, after her children grew up, Maysam decided to open her store in which she sells all kinds of homemade food as well as fruits and vegetables. The store is located on the main street of a well-known area which gives her an advantage over her competitors, in addition to her clients' loyalty to the store.

She is asking for a 2,827,840 LBP (Lebanese pounds) loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She will be mainly using the loan to buy quantities of ingredients needed for the preparation of her homemade food. She will also be buying fruits and vegetable to sell in her store.

Maysam's husband works as a bus driver and gets financial support from his eldest son to cover the family expenses.

The loan will help Maysam sustain her business, especially since she is expecting an increase in demand as the winter season approaches. A higher income and stable business will allow her to help her son in return as he plans his own future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of home-made food that she sells

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Assata est une vendeuse-détaillante  malienne, de produits culinaire (oignons ; sel  gombo, cube Maggi ; huile etc.)   , âgée de 57 ans, veuve avec 2 enfants  .Depuis 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité d’achat en gros et  la revente en détail des produits culinaire, son partenaire financier est le RMCR, qui lui consenti les prêts, lui permettant d’acheter en quantité (oignons ; sel ; gombo ; huile ; cube Maggi etc…..)  .
Assata s’approvisionne à la fois chez les jardiniers du village (oignons ; gombo) et chez  les commerçants grossistes du village (huile ; cube Maggi et sel).
A l’heure de la revente elle s’achemine par le biais d’une charrette à cheval avec ses produits dans les différents marchés hebdomadaire des villages de proximité, où elle étale ses produits aux différents  acheteurs.   
Assata par son chiffre d’affaire, réalise un bénéfice mensuel prévisionnel de 25 000 à 30 000 CFA, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins  et d’acheter souvent de petits cadeaux pour ses petits-fils.
Elle pense que cette activité, lui rapporte beaucoup et ce qui définit son attachement .mais souvent, elle rencontre des difficultés dans l’acheminement de ses produits vers les  différents marchés   .pour pallier à ses difficultés, elle envisage  d’acheter une charrette dans le but d’assurer le transport de ses produits.
texts.en:
Assata is a 57-year-old Malian saleswoman involved in the retail of culinary products (onions, salt, okra, Maggi bouillon cubes, oil, etc.). She is a widow and has two children. For ten years, she has been buying these culinary products in bulk and selling them on. Her financial partner is the RMCR which grants her the loans that allow her to buy in bulk (onions, salt, okra, oil, Maggi bouillon cubes, etc.).

Assata gets her supplies from both the village’s gardeners (onions and okra) and from the village’s biggest retail traders (oil, Maggi bouillon cubes and salt). When it is time to resell, she transports her products by horse and cart to the different weekly markets of nearby villages where she displays her products for the different buyers. 

Assata’s turnover amounts to an estimated monthly income of 25,000 to 30,000 CFA which allows her to to provide for her needs and, often, to buy little gifts for her grandson. She feels that this business brings her a lot and this explains her dedication. However, she often encounters difficulties in transporting her products to the different markets. To overcome these difficulties, she intends to buy a new cart to ensure the transportation of her products.

loans.use: to buy and sell culinary products.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a 55-year-old farmer from Macaresti village, Ungheni region. She works part time as a nurse at a village hospital. Her husband Ion and Nina manage a small farm. She grows different agriculture crops as cereals, vegetables, grapes. 
Also, Nina has been growing strawberries for more than ten years, but due to lack irrigation the harvest was not great. So Nina decided to dig a well and construct an irrigation system for her lands. 
This loan will help Nina to construct irrigation system. In this way the productivity of crops and level of life of his family will increase.

loans.use: to construct a well for irrigation.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a new sales agent for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. She has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is beginning to work as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities.

iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstove, which has an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment. Please help Dorcas earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Victoria has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Victoria will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Victoria is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to build a house for her family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Subira H

texts.en: Subira is 20 years old. She is a single mother living in Bagamoyo district. She is volunteering as a learner guide. Subira is requesting a Kiva loan to a start a retail shop. She plans to use the profit she will earn to help her family and to support her child. Her “social-interest” on the loan will be paid through Subira's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to a start a retail shop

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He is dedicated to farming in his small town far away from the city.
