Luis and his wife would be proud to see their daughters become professionals. The oldest daughter’s university is private thus the education is expensive and Luis is depleting his savings.

Luis and his wife work his cane’s sugar field, but they currently do not have the capital to invest in fertilizers and pay the labor for the crop. Luis is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and pay the labor for his crop.

A couple months ago Luis found work in the town's school where he is cleaning the classrooms. With this income he hopes to improve his home’s economy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Claveles Este dúo está integrado por Hilda y Rosaria. Rosaria es casada y madre de familia ella se dedica al negocio que es el de bordar y tejer blusas típicas, Doña Rosaria es costurera desde que tiene 20 años,  y con el pasar de los años ha agarrado más práctica para poder tejer por lo que ahora necesita comprar cajas de hilos ya que gracias a Dios los pedidos han aumentado por lo que necesita de un nuevo crédito para poder invertir en su negocio,en la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos ya que ella y su esposos están invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos por lo que no cuenta con capital propio para poder invertir en su negocio, es el segundo crédito que está solicitando y promete ser responsable en los pagos ya que piensa que la ayuda que kiva les ofrece es de gran ayuda para poder sobresalir en  la vida.
texts.en:
Dúo Los Claveles (The Carnations Duo) is made up of Rosaria and Hilda.  Rosaria is married and a mother.  She works in the business where she embroiders and weaves typical blouses.  Doña Rosaria has been a seamstress for 20 years, and with the passage of the year, she has gathered more practice to be able to weave.

What she needs now to be buy boxes of thread, since thanks to God, the requests have grown.  That is why she needs a new loan to be able to invest in her business and to buy raw material to make and sell typical weaving.  She and her husband are investing in the education of their children which is why they do not have their own capital to be able to invest in her business.  It is her second loan that she is requesting and she promises to be responsible in the payments.  She thinks that the help that Kiva offers them is a great help to be able to excel in life.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make and sell typical weaving.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Suyapa, de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive junto a ellos en un sector de Naco, Cortes cerca de Cofradía, Cortes. Ella trabajó un tiempo en la empresa privada, pero hace dos años decidió mejor tener su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de productos lácteos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa ofreciendo la venta de leche, mantequilla, queso y quesillo. Además vende hielo en bolsa. Con el fin de continuar con el negocio ha decidido solicitar la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras para comprar leche, cuajo, sal y otros para elaborar los productos para vender, eso hará que ella tenga mayores ganancias que le ayuden a fortalecer su negocio. Su meta es mejorar su local y ayudar a su familia a alcanzar un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Suyapa is 40 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives with them in a sector of Naco, Cortes near Cofradía, Cortes. She worked for a time in private business, but two years ago decided she'd rather have her own business making and selling milk products. She does this job from her house, offering milk, butter, cheese and fresh cheese for sale. In addition she sells bags of ice.

For the purpose of continuing with her business, she has decided to seek the quantity of 10,000 Lempiras to buy milk, rennet, salt and other things to make the products she sells. This will allow her to have greater earnings that will help her to strengthen her business. Her goal is to improve her locale and help her family achieve a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, rennet, salt and other things to make products to sell.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre de 45 años de edad, es casado con una familia de 8 hijos de las edades entre 10 y 30 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Agua Escondida.
Sebastián para obtener sus ingresos es comerciante desde hace 15 años, su negocio se ubica en la plaza de su comunidad, también es ayudante de albañil y jornalero con estos ingresos a su familia le da mejores condiciones.
Sebastián con el paso de los años tiene la necesidad de adquirir una cuerda terreno para tener donde cultivar o construir algún día una casa más grande con la que ahora cuenta, pero lamentablemente no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder comprar su terreno por esa razón solicita un préstamo para ajustar y así adquirir el terreno. Su gran anhelo es comprar suficiente terreno para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 45 years old and married with a family of 8 children from the ages of 10 to 30 years old. They live in a community of the village Agua Escondida. 

For income, Sebastián has been a merchant for the past 15 years. His business is located in the central square of the community and he is also a mason's assistant and a dayworker. With this income he gives his family the best living conditions. 

Over time, Sebastián needs to purchase a plot of land to have a place to cultivate or to build a larger house than what they have, but unfortunately he doesn't have enough money to be able to buy his land. This is why he is requesting a loan to be able to acquire the land. 

His biggest desire is to buy enough land so that his children have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria se dedica a trabajar en un estudio contable, sus aportes a su familia son los necesarios pero ahora ella necesita fondos para comprar una computadora para sus dos hijos hijos y así sacarlos adelantes.
la clienta tiene 37 años , Con su salario ella no puede hacer desembolsos fuertes ya que con ello debe pagar otras necesidades primarias de su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gloria works at an accounting firm.  Her contributions to the family are needed, but she now needs funds to buy a computer for her two children.  This way she will get them ahead.  She is 37 years old.  She is not able to make big purchases with her salary because she needs to use it to pay for the basic needs of her family.

The client is a responsible and diligent person. She feels grateful for the offered loan and promises to comply with the established loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 17 years old. She is not married. She lives with her child and her parents, who are staying in Kilolo district. They both work on a farm to sustain their daily life. Apart from that, she volunteers to advise students who are out of school to return back to school.

She requests a loan from Kiva to start a vegetable shop at her home. She also hopes to fulfill her dreams of educating her child and her siblings and opening a bank account from the profit she will earn from the business.

loans.use: to start a vegetable shop at her home

loans.name: Malam Nasarawa

texts.en:
Malam Nasarawa is a maize farmer from Tashar Kanawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Malam Nasarawa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Malam Nasarawa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Malam Nasarawa can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Malam Nasarawa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Malam Nasarawa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda is 46 and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Lahore. Saeeda's husband runs a boutique. He also involved his son in the business to teach him the tricks of the trade. They make and sell the latest designed clothes at their small boutique. Their boutique is running well, and Saeeda's husband feels it is the right time to invest more into the business, but they do not have sufficient funds and savings to do so. Saeeda wants her husband's business to grow and has therefore requested a loan of PKR 100,000 from BRAC Pakistan that will help them sell more varieties of the latest designed ready-to-wear clothes to their customers. Saeeda is happy and wants to see her son become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To help her husband and son in their boutique business by buying more trendy clothes

loans.name: Playa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Playa Bonita¨, está constituido por tres  mujeres y un varón,dueños de sus propios negocios y con ganas de seguir adelante y seguir emprendiendo en sus vidas.
Urania,  de 32 años es el coordinadora, ella está solicitando un crédito para seguir diversificando sus productos, y realizar creaciones en las confecciones que realiza en textiles. Ella tiene su taller de costura donde elabora pantalones colegiales y los ofrece de manera ambulante. Este negocio lo empezó hace 5 años y con el crédito comprara materia prima como elásticos, mantas, zypers y botones. 
Los otros miembros, son Blas de 20 años,vende calzado cerrados y sandalias. Julia de 20 años,  vende frutas y verduras como naranjas, banano cebollas y papas.  Meyling de 31  años, quien requiere del crédito para su negocio en costura donde elabora trajecitos para niños, vestidos finos.
texts.en:
The "Playa Bonita" group [Beautiful Beach] is made of three women and one man, owners of their own businesses who want to continue working and starting new projects throughout their lives.

Urania, at 32 years old, is a coordinator and is asking for this loan to continue diversifying her products and create new pieces of clothing with textiles. She has her sewing workshop where she makes uniform pants for schoolchildren which she then sells on the street. She started this business five years ago and with this loan she will buy materials such as elastic, cloth, zippers and buttons.

The other members include Blas at 20 years old, who sells shoes and sandals, Julia, also 20 years old, who sells fruit and vegetables, such as oranges, bananas, onions and potatoes and Meyling at 31 years old, who needs this loan for her sewing business where she makes small suits for children and fine clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials such as elastic, cloth, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La señora Octavia vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de casados, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 24 años aproximadamente donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de Tiraque y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, haba, arveja  y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Octavia se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), para la siembra de papa y de esta manera poder ampliar su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Octavia lives in a rural area with her common-law husband. She was able to attend school up to the primary level. Her home is a rustic adobe dwelling with a clay-tile roof that lacks some of the basic utilities.

She is a hardworking person with a lot of optimism. She and her husband work together day after day to earn enough to sustain themselves. She works primarily in agriculture, which she has done for approximately 24 years, producing and then selling what she produces.

What they obtain [from the crops] she takes to sell at the provincial festivals in Tiraque and in neighboring towns. The main products she sows are potatoes (in large quantities), fava beans, peas and others in small quantities, generally for their own consumption.

Octavia finds herself in need of requesting a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) for her potato crop so that she can increase her agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer made of chicken manure.

loans.name: Mary Carmen

texts.es:
Mary es madre dos hijos; desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos en su almacén como ropa, papelería, entre otros.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar un carrito de comidas rápidas y poder iniciar con una nueva actividad que complemente sus ingresos.

Mary, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén mucho más grande con gran variedad de productos y servicios para la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mary has two children.  She started a retail business 5 years ago because she needed an income to support her family.  She has learned what she's needed to know over the years and now has a store where she sells clothing, school & office supplies and other merchandise.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a fast food cart, a new business that will provide her with an extra income.  

Mary wants to continue growing her business and hopes her hard work and perseverance will pay off with the much bigger store that she wants to open in the future.

loans.use: to start a new business.

loans.name: Edilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Edilson es un hombre de 25 años de edad que desde muy joven conoció las actividades del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia. 

Actualmente y desde hace 8 meses posee cultivos de flores cuya producción es vendida para obtener los ingresos que requiere para solventar los gastos y necesidades de su familia. 

Adicionalmente, labora como mayordomo de una finca, con el interés de complementar la entrada de dinero a su hogar. 

El cliente es un luchador que se esfuerza y trabaja largas jornadas, sobrepasando distintas adversidades, como por ejemplo, el clima cambiante que afecta sus cultivos, pero siempre avanza con la motivación de cumplir el sueño de ampliar y diversificar sus cultivos, para que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otros campesinos del sector. 

Esto lo lleva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, riegos y semillas), con lo que le dará continuidad a su  labor y podrá cosechar productos de mejor calidad, que tendrá como resultado el incremento en sus ganancias. 

De esta manera, Edilson desea tener la capacidad de brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edilson is a young man of 25 years, who knew the trade of a farmer from a very young age, due to the teachings of his family.

Currently and since 8 months ago he has had fields of flowers, the produce of which is sold to to make the income needed to cover the expenses and needs of his family.

Additionally, he is working as a steward on an estate, with the goal of complementing the inflow of money into his home.

This customer is a hard-working man, who is making an effort, working long hours, overcoming different adversities, like, for example, climate change, which is affecting his produce. But he always keeps on going with the motivation to reach his goals of broadening and diversifying his crops so he will be able to offer job opportunities to other farmers in the area.

This is why he is requesting a loan to invest in buying agricultural supplies at wholesale (fertilizer, liquid fertilizer, and seeds), with which he can continue his work and will be able to harvest products of better quality. This would result in an increase of his income.

This way, Edilson wishes to have the means to offer his family a better well-being and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (fertilizer, liquid fertilizers, and seeds)

loans.name: Belquis

texts.es: Belquis, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive junto a ellos en una de las aldeas del Municipio de San José de colinas, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 10 años de tener su propia finca de café, el cual vende en la misma zona y es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. Solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizante y limpieza para darle mantenimiento a su finca. Esto le permitirá mejorar su finca y que su negocio aumente hasta generar más ingresos para su familia. Su meta es aumentar su cultivo de café para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Belquis is 44 years old and a single mom. She has 2 children and lives with them in one of the villages of the Municipality of San Jose de Colinas, Santa Barbara. 

She has always made her living in agriculture and has had her own coffee farm for 10 years. She sells her coffee in the same area and is the source of income for the family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 Lempiras with which she will purchase agricultural supplies, compost, fertilizers, and pay for clearing of crops to maintain her farm. This will allow her to improve her farm and that her business will grow to generate more income for her family.

Her goal is to grow her coffee crop to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, compost, fertilizers and pay for clearing of crops to maintain her coffee farm.

loans.name: Yoider De Jesus

texts.es:
Yoider es un hombre empresario agrícola de 24 años de edad, una persona luchador ay trabajadora que con su negocio trata de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, reparar su vivienda, ser el pilar económico de la casa.
Aprendió la profesión de su padre, desde entonces siempre se ha preocupado por los cultivos, ahora presenta una dificultad y es que el fenómeno del niño ha golpeado fuertemente sus terrenos.
Pensando en la producción que tiene en etapa de maduración, el joven Yoider solicita un préstamo para agilizar el proceso de sus cultivos y salvar lo que más pueda de sus cultivos. 
Comprará principalmente abonos y riegos y pesticidas para alejar los mosquitos.
texts.en:
Yolder is an entrepreneurial man, a farmer of 24 years of age. He is a striving and hard-working person who with his business tries to improve the living conditions of his household, repair his home, and be the economic pillar of the house.

He learned the work from his father. Since then he has always been concerned about the crops. Now a difficulty has presented itself, and it is that the phenomenon of El Niño has hit his lands hard.

Thinking about the production that he has in a stage of maturity, the young Yolder is applying for a loan to speed up the cultivation process and save the most he can from his crops.

He will principally buy compost, irrigation, and pesticides to get rid of the mosquitos.

loans.use: to buy principally compost, irrigation, and pesticides to get rid of the mosquitos.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 23 years old. She is a single mother with one child. She is living with her mother and she works on a farm, cultivating maize for a living. Also, she uses her extra time to educate students and to facilitate life skills education, helping them to know how they can face their challenges on their own.

She requests a Kiva loan to establish a retail shop business for selling different items like beans, cooking oil, and soap. She hopes to get a profit, which will help her to expand her business and support her family as well as to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to establish a retail shop for selling different items like beans, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Yehowa Mli Group

texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the Yehowa Mli Group, which is located in the district of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana.
One of them is Mercy, She is a loyal and hardworking woman from a humble beginning, who has four years of diligence in her business. She deals in buying and selling general goods.

Due to the high level of demand expressed by her customers, she and her counterparts, who are dealers in underwear, liquid soaps and detergents, wish to receive a loan sum of 1,800 GHS. She will use her portion to buy more underwear on wholesale bases to meet the demand of her customers.

She is an enterprising woman, and her dream is to one day have a store where she could sell her clothing. She is grateful to everyone who is a part of making these resources available, and she promises to repay her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more underwear on wholesale bases to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 33 year old mother of three. She runs a shop selling groceries, toothpaste, and other essentials. Stella used the money from her first Kiva loan to build her shop, and now business is thriving. She is venturing into market gardening, selling tomatoes and green maize. Through her success, Stella supports her family, as well as providing for her brother-in-law’s education. Stella’s husband now works for her and is an active part of her business. Stella seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more groceries to keep up with customer demand. The interest of Stella’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to keep up with customer demand. .

loans.name: Jhemilen Olimpia

texts.es: Jhemilen tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y está estudiando la carrera profesional de Enfermería en una universidad privada en donde ya va por el VI ciclo de la carrera, ya que gracias al apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA ella está logrando una de sus metas que es culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente. Es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar los materiales y herramienta como una Laptop que necesita para realizar sus actividades diarias y trabajos de la universidad. Jhemilen está muy agradecida con el apoyo y confianza que está recibiendo por parte de personas que tienen buen corazón.
texts.en:
Jhemilen is 19 years old. She is single and studying nursing in a professional degree program in a private university. She is now in the sixth cycle of her program. Thanks to the support she has received from Kiva investors, she is achieving one of her goals, which is to finish her studies satisfactorily.

To that end, she will invest this loan in the purchase of materials and tools like a laptop that she needs for her daily activities and university work. Jhemilen is very thankful for the support and confidence she's receiving from people with good hearts.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
La socia Nazaria continua dedicándose a la agricultura, y a la venta de sus productos cosechados, ella es muy dedicada y sigue luchando por sus sueños que es tener un local propio donde expender sus productos.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono que le permita producir más y brindar mejores productos a sus clientes.
La socia está muy agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
la fotografía a Nazaria no fue tomada en su lugar de trabajo, sino en una de las reuniones de su banco comunal aprovechando la presencia de socia.
texts.en:
Nazaria continues to work in agriculture, selling the produce she harvests.  She is very dedicated and keeps fighting for her dream, which is to have her own store where she can sell her crops.

She has asked for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer which will allow her to grow more and provide her customers with better products.

She is very thankful for KIVA investors and promises to make her payments punctually. 

This photograph was not taken in Nazaria's place of work, but in a meeting at a local branch of her community bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Phượng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng is 35 years old and she is married. Phượng lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village where the market need is low.

She has had a service business shipping goods for five years.

The main hardship that Phượng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to get sand from the river for sale.

In 2014, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes that her children to do well in school, that her family will be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tools to get sand from the river for sale

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer from Sadau village. As a Babban Gona member, Sani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sani can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sani no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Sani hopes to realize better yields

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ingris Nohemy

texts.es:
Ingris, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está soltera y vive con su madre que se dedica a oficios domestico, su padrastro que es albañil y su hermano que aún no va a la escuela.

Ingris, hace un año que abandonó sus estudios y decidió trabajar en una tienda de artículos para el hogar y ropa de todo estilo, fue contratada para ser encargada de ventas y supervisora; ella desde que era pequeña le llamaron la atención los trabajos de compra y venta.- Para ir a su trabajo viaja de lunes a sábado y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00  de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.

Ingris, junto a sus padres han tomado la decisión de establecer su propia tienda y es para eso que han solicitado un crédito para comprar artículos para el hogar, ropa para niños y adultos, este negocio lo colocarán para obtener beneficios económicos y ayudar al desarrollo de la familia.

Ingris, sueña con terminar su bachillerato y continuar en la universidad, pero además quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener mejores condiciones de seguridad.
texts.en:
Ingris is 20 years old, and left education after the first year of her high school diploma. She is single and lives with her mother, who is a housewife, her stepfather, who is a builder, and her brother, who doesn't go to school yet.

One year ago, Ingris abandoned her studies and decided to work in a store selling homeware and different kinds of clothing. She was hired as a sales manager and supervisor. She was interested in buying and selling from a young age. She goes to work from Mondays to Saturdays, and she works from 8am to 4pm.

Ingris and her parents have decided to set up their own shop, which is why they have requested the loan to buy homeware and clothing for children and adults. They will establish the business in order to obtain financial gains and help their family move forward.

Ingris dreams of completing her diploma and going on to university. She also wants to make home improvements and live more securely.

loans.use: to buy homeware and clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hadi is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hadi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hadi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Hadi now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mustapha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mustapha can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mustapha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mustapha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 28-year-old owner of a clothes shop located in Beirut, her hometown. She also lives there with her parents and two younger brothers.

One year ago, she decided to open her own clothes shop in order to support her brothers financially as well as start saving for her own future. The shop quickly became well known in the area and Imane has a good reputation among her clients who appreciate her taste in selecting clothes.

In order to buy a new kids' collection and other leather clothes for winter, Imane is asking for a 1,543,658 LBP (Lebanese pounds) loan for the first time from Kiva's partner, Ibdaa. She is expecting these items to increase her sales and profit margin.

Imane is very close to her younger brother. She is determined to work hard in order to contribute in his school tuition and daily expenses and is hoping the loan will help her achieve that.

loans.use: to buy a kids' clothes collection and other items for her shop.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge is a 74-year-old widow and farmer who has been blessed with six children. She grows kales and tomatoes.

Ndunge joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. She is taking out her first loan, one for 10,000 KES, to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds that will enhance her farm’s production. She anticipates an increase in income that will enable her to meet her family’s needs more easily.

Ndunge is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs that will enhance her farm’s production.

loans.name: Huaykhaomin Group

texts.en:
Soda’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Soda and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Soda and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users, like Soda’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. NOTE: One couple in the back are husband and wife but are only represented by a single loan for the purchase of one water filter; therefore, we see 13 people but only initiated 12 micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo es un hombre que está muy agradecido por su préstamo pues con el apoyo de ello logro comprar los materiales para la construcción de su casa afortunadamente este proyecto de Lorenzo ha finalizado con gran éxito pues ya cuenta con otro ambiente. Pero nuevamente tiene otra necesidad que es la compra de semillas de papa  y abono orgánico para  poder cultivar pues por ahora no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder cultivar. Lorenzo tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para poder cultivar.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a man who is very thankful for his loan. With that help he was able to purchase materials to construct his house. Fortunately Lorenzo has successfully completed this project and now has a new environment. 

Now he has another need which is to purchase potato seeds and organic compost to be able to cultivate. Right now he does not have enough capital to be able to cultivate. Lorenzo has high hopes for this loan to be able to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and organic compost.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
A resident of Teshie province, Regina is 34 years old and is a married mother of two children who rely on her. To make a living, she supports her husband by selling charcoal at her residence as a main source of income. Selling charcoal for three years now has helped her to earn more income and is improving their standard of living.

Lack of capital is the main challenge to the business. Regina leads a two-member group to apply for a loan from ID Ghana to save her business. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for faster delivery. She hopes to earn more income to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for faster delivery.

loans.name: Alh. Abas

texts.en:
Alhaji Abas is a maize farmer from Rimi village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Abas is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Abas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Abas can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Abas no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Abas hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is 23 years old and is currently living with her husband and her daughter in Kilosa district. She volunteers as a Camfed learner guide and goes to school each week to mentor younger students and members in her community in life skills and personal growth. Prisca is requesting a loan to buy products from farmers and sell in the market, where she has a stall. She plans to use the profit she will earn to expand her business, to send her child to school, to buy a plot of land and to support her daily basic needs. Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Prisca's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of vegetables and fruits to sell in the market.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie has owned her business for almost a year now. She loves to create magical things for children, and has a passion for event planning. Her business is dedicated to creating dress-up accessory sets for girls that are princess-themed and packaged with intention. Julie is a mother of two and runs her business with her husband. She is originally from the United States.

The greatest success so far for Julie's business is the recognition her products have received. Her biggest challenge thus far has been being able to make more sales. Julie is currently seeking a loan to purchase more materials that will allow her to expand her product line. She would also like to purchase more office supplies and a larger production table.

Her vision for the future is to grow her business and offer an entire line of gift set products for both girls and boys.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her product line and also purchase office supplies.

loans.name: Yuleidys María

texts.es: Yuleidys es una ama de casa con una actitud muy positiva y emprendedora, tiene cuatro hijos y vive con su cónyuge en el municipio de San Jacinto. Ella desde su casa vende mecatos, panes, bolis, gaseosas y elabora mochilas tejidas que comercializa entre habitantes del municipio y con los ingresos que adquiere subsana muchas necesidades de su familia. Indiscutiblemente desde que inició esta actividad la calidad de vida de su familia es mucho mejor y por ello Yuleidys desea seguir muy comprometida y dedicada, hasta cumplir su sueño de prosperidad: tener una tienda de víveres. Ella aplicó a un credikiva, oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con víveres su negocio; arroz, aceite, enlatados, pastas, frijoles y dar el primer paso a su meta de negocio. A futuro planea mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad de su vivienda para que sus hijos estén mucho más cómodos y orgullosos de sus padres.
texts.en:
Yuleidys is a stay-at-home mom with a very positive and entrepreneurial attitude. She has four children and lives with her spouse in the municipality of San Jacinto. From her house, she sells snacks, bread, ice cream treats and soda. She also makes cloth shoulder bags which she sells among the residents of the municipality. With the income she makes, she offsets the cost of many of her family's necessities.

Since she started this work, her family's quality of life is undeniably much better. This is why Yuleidys wants to continue to be committed and dedicated, until the achieves her dream of prosperity: to have a grocery store. She applied for a Kiva loan as a opportunity to become involved in financial life, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She applied for the loan to stock her business with supplies: rice, oil, canned goods, pasta, and beans, and take the first step towards her business goal.

In the future she plans to improve the living conditions of her home, so that her children are much more comfortable and proud of their parents.

loans.use: to stock her business with supplies like rice, oil, canned goods, pasta, and beans.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 6 Group

texts.en:
Then, who is 28 years old and goes by the name of Rose, is a trader living in Teshie province. She is married with one dependent child, who is in school, while she works so hard for the well-being of her household. Selling saucepans and ice chests is her main business.

Rose is now leading the 'Ekomefeemo 6' group of five members to apply for loans from Kiva through ID-Ghana. This is the second-cycle loan for her. Her past loan has helped her meet her family’s needs in a timely way. For this cycle, she will use her loan portion to buy a lot of ice chests and saucepans to boost her capital.

She hopes she will earn more income to uplift her lifestyle and keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of ice chests and saucepans to boost her capital.

loans.name: Los Panaderos De Choquesquibel Group

texts.es: Juan Andrés es uno más de las muchas personas que sean visto beneficiadas con los créditos a los que han tenido la oportunidad de acceder, pues el con su préstamo pudo comprar los materiales y unos deliciosos panes pudo vender durante la semana mayor, esto afortunadamente le dejo una buena ganancia, Juan Andrés está muy satisfecho con esta avance más no conforme pues ahora tiene la necesidad de comprar más materiales para la elaboración de panes xecas, pues es uno de sus productos que más demanda tiene por sus clientes. Juan Andrés junto a su grupo tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente este crédito para seguir cambiando sus vidas.
texts.en:
Juan Andrés is one more of the many people who has benefitted from the loans they have had the opportunity to access. With his loan he was able to purchase materials and was able to sell some delicious breads during the busiest week, fortunately this earned him a good income. Juan Andrés is very satisfied with this progress. 

Now he needs to purchase more materials to make Panes Xecas, a Guatemalan specialty bread. This is one of the products most in demand from his customers. Juan Andrés along with his group hopes to get this new loan to continue changing their lives.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make a Guatemalan specialty bread (Xecas).

loans.name: Diris

texts.en:
Diris is a 27-year-old entrepreneur. She is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of women's and children's clothes. She is currently living with her child and another relative in Kilosa district.

She works as a Core trainer; she leads life-skills sessions for Learner Guides to facilitate life-skills sessions for students in secondary schools. She focuses on effective communication and on building her Learner Guides' and students’ confidence.

Though she currently doesn't have a business of her own, Diris is requesting a Kiva loan to start a clothing business. She plans to use the profit she will earn to pay for her sibling’s children's school fees and other school contributions because they depend on her, and also to support her with daily basic needs.

The social interest on her loan will be repaid through Diris' daily activities of helping and facilitating Learner Guides' sessions and their other activities.

loans.use: to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rhoda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Rhoda would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Rhoda can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Rhoda will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Rhoda is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 40000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials like net, rope, gasoline, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like net, rope, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Femy

texts.en:
Femy works hard to support her family. Femy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like bamboo, net, wood, gasoline, etc.

Femy has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Femy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like bamboo, net, wood, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Maharazu

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita is a maize farmer from Makwala village. As a member of Babban Gona, Tabita is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tabita would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Tabita can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Tabita is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
Nasiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nasiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Mercy has been in this business for 3 years. Mercy earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paints, nails, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paints, nails, etc

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Nuris es una microempresaria que reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio de Cartagena de Indias y se dedica a la elaboración de productos congelados y comidas rápidas en compañía de una prima.  Ambas anhelaban ser trabajadoras independientes para aportar a la economía del hogar y decidieron conseguir un capital para empezar con su proyecto, desde la terraza de su casa expenden las comidas,  adecuaron el lugar con sillas y mesas, e informaron a todos sus vecinos y conocidos, contando con gran acogida, pues hoy en día llevan 10 años de funcionamiento  de viernes a domingo y sus clientes degustar de exquisiteces como salchipapas, perros calientes, hamburguesas, bebidas, cervezas y productos congelados para que preparen en sus hogares. Para apoyar a Nurys con su negocio la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo la postuló a un credikiva, financiamiento con el que comprará cervezas, carnes frías, salsas, papa, aceite, harina, queso, carne de res y pollo, para la preparación de sus comidas.  Nurys sueña con ampliar y remodelar la terraza donde funciona su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nuris is a micro-entrepreneur who lives with her family in the Cartagena de las Indias municipality. She makes a living preparing frozen products and fast meals with one of her cousins. Both wanted to work on their own to contribute with the household expenses. They decided to look for capital to start their project. They sell meals from the terrace of their house. They added chairs and tables and notified all their neighbors and acquaintances. It was well received and have been in business for 10 years now. They work from Friday to Sunday. Their clients savor exquisite plates such as, "salchipapas" (sausages and potatoes), hot dogs, hamburgers, beverages, beer and frozen products that the customers can take to prepare in their own homes.

To support Nuris with her business, the Fundación Santo Domingo nominated her for a Credikiva loan. With this loan she will purchase beer, cold cuts, sauces, potatoes, oil, flour, cheese, beef and chicken to prepare meals. Nuris dream is to remodel the terrace where she runs her business and of to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase, beer, cold cuts, sauces, potatoes, oil, flour, cheese, beef and chicken meat.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is married and has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 10 years now. She works hard to support her family.

Merly has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food production enterprise. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a restaurant in the Philippines for 25 years. She earns additional income buying and selling rice.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as spices, sugar, meat, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant.

Remedios dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, sugar, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 37 years old, a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) member from Taguig branch, and married to Joey. For 4 years, Melanie has managed her own variety store. This is known as “sari-sari” store in the Philippines where you can buy cheap items. Basically, sari-sari stores can be found in all barangays, municipalities, and even in cities. Products there are cheap.  For only P1.00 you can buy a piece of candy or other sweet, compared to supermarkets where most products are being sold at wholesale.  In a sari-sari store, on the other hand, you can buy a sachet of shampoo, powdered drink, and so much more.  

Managing this type of business is enjoyable for Melanie since her husband also helps her every time that he’s available. Melanie has children in school and wants to continually support them with their expenses.  She wants to take advantage of the support CCT offers not just monetarily, but also in seminars and lectures for new entrepreneurs. She decided to apply for a loan of PHP 20, 000 as she wants to have revolving funds to run the business and add grocery items.

Melanie has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God at all occasions.

loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Althea

texts.en:
Althea is 55 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years now.

Althea has received four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. She has requested a new loan for PHP 10000 to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Althea would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora de 45 años  de edad de estado civil casada, con tres hijos. Es operaria en una fabrica, hace 3 meses le  diagnosticaron  cataratas en ambos ojos, esto a consecuencia de una enfermedad crónica que padece. El trabajo que realiza  es con piezas pequeñas por lo que  su vista es esencial, por tal motivo en su trabajo  fue removida a un  puesto de intendencia obviamente con un sueldo mas bajo, lo que le impide realizar la operación que necesita con urgencia para poder recuperar su vista, además de que ella es el único sostén económico en su familia.
texts.en: This borrower is a 45 year old woman who is married and has 3 children.  She works in a factory, and 3 months ago she was diagnosed with cataracts in both eyes.  This condition is a result of a chronic illness that she suffers from.  She works with small pieces in her job, and so her vision is essential.  This is why she was removed from a managerial post.  She now has a much lower salary, which is preventing her from getting the operation that she needs so urgently to recover her vision.  Also, she is the sole economic support for her family.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is 35 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years she has been selling dry goods in the Philippines and earning additional income selling vegetables and dried fish.

Ria, who has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 29000 to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell such as sleepers, shoes, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell like sleepers, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with six children. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she is 49 years old and all of her children are in school.

For three years now, Susana has been operating a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente está muy contento por el logro que alcanzo gracias a su préstamo compro sus materiales de construcción y su cocina pudo construir ahora su familia tiene un mejor lugar donde preparar adecuadamente los alimentos, el con este  avance está contento más no conforme porque tiene otra necesidad que en esta ocasión es para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos para la elaboración de jaspe que es su mayor fuente de ingreso, esta demanda incrementa por la época de fin de año que se está acercando. Su esperanza de vida es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente is very content with what he has accomplished. And thanks to this loan, he will now be able to purchase the necessary construction materials to build a kitchen. Vicente's family will have a better place where they can prepare their food adequately.

But Vicente isn't satisfied yet; he has another necessity. He also wishes to purchase thread of different colors and styles for making "jaspe" materials -- his major source of income. Customer demand for "jaspe" will increase during the approaching end of the year holidays.

Vicente's life's hope is to continue fortifying his business and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction materials to build a kitchen, and threads of different colors and styles for making hand-woven "jaspe" materials to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Virginia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sugar, ginger, etc. to use for her food vending business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, ginger, etc. to use for her food vending.

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Marianne is a married woman with seven children. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marianne has been operating a fish-vending business in the Philippines for six years now. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Marianne would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Teresa has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de tres hijas y todas están estudiando, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santos para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, él tiene  5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. Santos por ser una persona con amabilidad, respeto y carisma ha logrado colocar a su tienda como una de las mejores de su comunidad y esto le ha dado la oportunidad de incrementar la demanda de los clientes, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos de abarrotes para abastecer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su esperanza de vida es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old. He is single with a beautiful family of three daughters, who are all in school. The family lives in the Sololá community.

Santos buys and sells groceries to earn income and help his family get ahead. He has worked in this line of business for five years. By virtue of being a friendly, respectful and charismatic person, Santos has managed to make his store one of the top stores in the community. As a result of the demand he needs a loan to buy more grocery products to better meet the needs of his clients. His goal in life is to continue fortifying his business in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy grocery products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, a 64-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a direct selling business in the Philippines for five years now, and also earns an income by selling frozen foods.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has requested a new loan for PHP 20000 to purchase additional stocks to sell such as lotion, cologne, toothpaste, etc.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as lotion, cologne, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luciana is 61 years old now.

Luciana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Winnefreda

texts.en:
Winnefreda is 45 years old with three children, all in school.

She operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store), selling retail snack foods, candies, noodles, and other items to help with their daily expenses, while her husband works as a construction worker.

Winnefreda opens her store from 9:00 a.m. through 10:00 p.m. and goes to the nearby market every day to buy items for her store. Her store has a lot of customers, but she cannot supply all their demands due to lack of capital.

Winnefreda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy one sack of rice, canned goods, biscuits, and noodles to sell in her store.

Winnefreda hopes to expand her store and add breakfast to be able to help support their family's expenses and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, canned goods, biscuits, and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Graciela Alicia

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de lucha. Tiene 53 años y vive actualmente en el Distrito Federal, en donde tiene su negocio.
Hace dos años, después de conocer un promotor de venta por catálogo, Graciela aprovechó la oportunidad y se inició en la venta de zapatos por catálogo con el fin de tener una mejor calidad de vida y más oportunidad de trabajo.
Graciela se dedica únicamente a este negocio y su sueño es incrementar sus ventas y crear una cartera de clientes más amplia. Para esto, Graciela solicitó un crédito que le ha permitido comprar más mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, cosa que ha resultado muy favorablemente.
Orgullosa de su lucha y ganas de salir adelante, Graciela tiene la motivación de continuar en la venta por catálogo y seguir brindar confianza y excelencia a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is a very hardworking woman with a great fighting spirit. She is 53 years old and currently lives in Distrito Federal ["Mexico City"] where she has a business.

Two years ago, after meeting a promoter of catalog-based sales, Graciela took the opportunity to begin selling shoes by catalog with the goal of having a better quality of life and more work opportunities.

Graciela makes a living solely in this business and her dream is to increase her sales and create a broader customer base. For this, Graciela requested a loan that allowed her to purchase more merchandise to increase her sales, which has resulted very favorably.

Proud of her fight and desiring success, Graciela has the motivation to continue in catalog-based sales and to continue offering her customers reliability and excellence.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia Yeny es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, ella se dedica a su negocio de vender artesanía a los turistas que viene a visitar el valle sagrado de los incas, esta actividad lo realiza muchos años.
La socia solicito el préstamo para poder comprar chompas, guantes y chullo. Con esta actividad la socia desea una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
La socia está muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por haber confiado en ella y ayudarla a conseguir sus metas. Yeny se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Yeny. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells handicrafts to tourists who come to visit the Sacred Valley of the Incas. She has done this for many years.

She requested a loan to buy sweaters, gloves and chullos [an Andean style of hat with earflaps]. With this activity, she wishes to improve her family's living conditions.

She feels very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for having trusted in her and having helped her to achieve her goals. Yeny promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, gloves and chullos [an Andean style of hat with earflaps].

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Avelina has been in this business for 4 years now.

Avelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, rope, etc.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, rope, etc.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Inusa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes ofm aize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Inusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Inusa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Inusa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Inusa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Abejas De Qquehuña Grande Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ABEJAS DE QQUEHUÑA GRANDE II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huancarani, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Josefina tiene 21 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de agricultura  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, la socia espera con su negocio obtener mas ganancia para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores , la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
Las socias que están pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ganadería.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “LAS ABEJAS DE QQUEHUÑA GRANDE II" communal bank. This bank is located in the Huancarani district in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco.

Member Josefina is 21 years old and unmarried with one child. She alternates her daily activities dedicating herself to the business of agriculture, which is going well thanks to her daily persistence. She is an enterprising woman and also raises small animals. She hopes to earn more with her business in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers among other things. The partners in the photo glued to the group photo took their photo after their meeting, requesting permission for work reasons.

The other members work in the business of selling animals, in agriculture, selling groceries and raising cattle.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and more.

loans.name: Claudia Ester

texts.es: Claudia de 41 años es madre de tres niñas de 18, 13 y 12 años, sus princesas como le encanta decirles y vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Cartagena. Hace 10 años decidió dedicarse al comercio de electromenores, productos para el cuidado personal y enseres del hogar, negocio que le ha permitido ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos familiares.  Ya que se aproxima la temporada de diciembre y sus ventas aumentaran mucho,y sus inventarios no dan abasto, por eso aplicó a un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar nuevo surtido de productos de peluquería, cafeteras, hornos tostadores, planchas para cabello y demás artículos de alta demanda. Esta inversión será de éxito puesto que Claudia es muy responsable y dedicada y logrará vender lo que se proponga. Su meta a futuro es ver a sus hijas graduadas profesionalmente en las carreras que deseen.
texts.en:
Claudia, 41, is the mother of three girls, ages 18, 13, and 12, who are, as she loves to tell them, her princesses. She lives with her spouse in the city of Cartagena. Ten years ago, she decided to sell small appliances, personal care products, and household items--a business that has allowed her to help her spouse with the family expenses.

As the December season is coming, her sales will increase a lot and her inventory will not cover demand. That is why she applied for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It is an opportunity for her to remain financially viable and to purchase a new selection of hair styling products, coffee makers, toaster ovens, hair irons, and other high-demand articles.

This will be a successful investment, as Claudia is very responsible, and will be able sell what she proposes. Her goal for the future is to see her daughters graduate with professional degrees in their desired fields.

loans.use: to purchase a new selection of hair styling products, coffee makers, toaster ovens, hair irons, and other high-demand articles.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana, tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus tres hijos en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos para vender. Cuenta con experiencia en esta actividad ya que le ayudaba a su madre, y hace 4 años decidió dedicarse a su propio negocio, donde ya cuenta con sus propios clientes. Ella solicita la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras que utilizara en la compra de más cerdos para crianza y vender. Con las ganancias de sus ventas espera reinvertir en más cerdos para hacer crecer el negocio. Su plan es obtener más ingresos para poder vivir mejor junto a sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and her three children in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has her own source of income. She raises and fattens pigs to sell. She has a vast experience in this activity because she used to help her mother.

Four years ago, she decided to start her own business, and has now many customers. She is requesting 5,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy more pigs to raise and sell. With the profits from her sales, she hopes to buy more pigs and expand her business. Her plan is to increase her income in order to live a better life with her children and offer them a better future.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela y todo lo que sabe hacer se lo han enseñado sus familiares; tiene tres hijos que trabajan  y ella vive en casa de una de sus hijas.

María, se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace cinco años, la necesidad de generar ingresos la llevó a iniciar este negocio; el lugar donde vende está a una distancia de 1 kilómetro caminando y en la elaboración de los tamales le ayuda la hija con la que vive y su horario de venta es de 3:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar elotes de maíz para la elaboración de tamales, porque este es el producto que vende en el mercado del pueblo.

Sueña con ver crecer su negocio y que sus hijas se dediquen a la misma actividad, para que puedan tener ingresos y cuidar de la familia.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She did not go to school, and she learned everything she knows from her relatives. She has three children who work. She lives with one of her daughters.


María has been selling tamales for five years. She needed to generate an income, so she started this business. She sells her tamales one km (0.6 miles) away from home. The daughter she lives with helps her to prepare the tamales. She sells them from 3:00 pm until 6:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn to prepare tamales, because this is the product she sells at the municipal marketplace.

She dreams of seeing her business grow, and seeing her daughters take over, so that they can have an income and take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tamales.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Orbelina, de 71 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es viuda desde hace 16 años y con su esposo tuvieron 4 hijos, pero todos tienen sus propios hogares y ella solo vive con una nieta quien está estudiando en la universidad.

Orbelina, tiene un puesto de venta de carne de res en el municipio donde vive, ella se dedica a esta actividad porque es una herencia de su mamá, quien comenzó con el negocio y ella lo continuó realizando y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar reces para destazo, esto le ayudara a mejorar las ventas porque es una persona conocida en el municipio por el buen producto que vende. 

Orbelina, sueña con seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y también desea ver graduada a su nieta de la universidad.
texts.en:
71-year-old Orbelina studied up to the third grade. She became a widow sixteen years ago. She and her husband had four children, but all of them have their own families. She lives with a granddaughter who goes to the university.

Orbelina owns a butcher's shop located in the municipality where she lives. She has this business because she inherited it from her mother, who started this business and she took over. She works six hours every day.

She will use the loan to buy cows to butcher. This will help her increase her sales, because locals know she sells a good product.

Orbelina dreams of continuing working in what she likes. She would also like to see her granddaughter receive her university degree.

loans.use: to buy cows to butcher.

loans.name: Los Exitosos De Laura Caller Group

texts.es: Judith es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar se dedica la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace siete años sus principales clientes son personas vecinas y amistades que la buscan por el buen asesoramiento y productos de buena calidad que les brinda,el préstamo que solicitó lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería como cremas, joyas perfumería y mas ya que le dan mas descuentos comprando por cantidad.su mayor sueño es crecer como vendedora estrella y tener un local propio donde pueda exhibir sus productos, se siente entusiasmada de saber que hay personas como los inversionistas Kiva que ayudan a gente que como ella desean salir adelante.MUCHAS GRACIAS KIVA.
texts.en:
Judith is the mother of three school-aged children. She works selling beauty products via catalog which she has been doing for seven years. Her main clients are neighbors and friends who seek her out for her good advice and the good quality products that she provides them with.

She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase merchandise such as creams, jewelry, perfume and others, as she receives better discounts when she buys in bulk. Her biggest dream is to grow as a star saleswoman and have her own storefront where she could display her products. She is very excited to know that there are many people like the Kiva lenders who help people like her who hope to get ahead. Thank you very much, Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic merchandise like creams, jewelry, perfumes, and more

loans.name: Francis Yolan

texts.es:
La señora  Francis de 37  años de edad, es casada   vive con su esposo tiene cuatro hijos que depende de ella, vive en San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de la elaboración de muebles y puertas de madera, junto a su esposo.
 
La señora Francis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de madera  que es la materia prima para este tipo de negocio, ya que viene la época de  buena y desea tener madera suficiente para atender los pedidos de  sus clientes. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que Prisma le puede brindar.
  
Su sueño es pode darle una buena educación a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - de Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband. She has four children that depend on her. She lives in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For 10 years she has worked making wood furniture and doors, together with her spouse.

Francis is seeking a loan to buy wood which is the prime material for this type of business, since the good season is approaching and she wants to have sufficient wood to meet the orders of her customers.
