She is very thankful for the the opportunity that Prisma is able to offer her. Her dream is to be able to provide a good education to her children.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy wood for his business

loans.name: Los Claveles De Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: Teresa de 35 años es casada y tiene dos menores hijos. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió poner su tienda en un pequeño espacio de su casa. El crédito lo invirtió para la compra de mercadería en general al por mayor. Pertenecer al banquito "Los Claveles de Buenos Aires" le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de kiva por confiar en ella. Gustavo no se encuentra en fotografía porque no asistió a la reunión por problemas de salud.Teresa el la que esta con un chaleco guido y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
35-year-old Teresa is married and has 2 younger children. Upon seeing that her money was not enough in the face of her household expenses, she decided to establish her store in a small space in her house.

She invested her loan to buy general merchandise at wholesale prices. Belonging to the communal bank "Los Claveles de Buenos Aires" has helped her improve her quality of life. She is very thankful that Kiva's partners trust her.

Gustavo is not shown in the photograph because he did not attend the meeting due to health problems. Teresa is the one in a vest and black pants.

loans.use: to buy general wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "SR DE TORRECHAYOC  II", este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento del Cusco.
El socio Edgar es muy trabajador y  responsable,  el trabaja arduamente día a día, el es mozo en una empresa privada, su deseo es tener un negocio donde pueda desarrollar otras habilidades. 
Edgar saca adelante a su familia y quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida, por esa razón el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar víveres para su hogar, , es decir para comprar papa, arroz, leche, y aceite.
El  socio que está tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal   “sr de Torrechayoc  II”
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
El socio está muy contento y agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA, por confiar en él y en el banco, se compromete a cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Sr de Torrechayoc II" which is in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. The member Edgar is hard-working and responsible.

He works hard every day as an employee in a private company. His hope is to run a business where he can develop other skills. Edgar provides for his family and wants to have a better quality of life which is why the member is applying for a loan. He will buy foodstuffs for his home such as potatoes, rice, milk and oil.

The member whose face is covered with a circle no longer belongs to the community bank "Sr de Torrechayoc II". The other members earn a living with businesses related to agriculture, selling handicrafts, a grocery store and selling animals. The member is very happy and grateful to KIVA investors for trusting him and the bank. He is committed to promptly making the agreed repayments.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for his home such as potatoes, rice, milk and oil

loans.name: Lizeth Natalia

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven soltera y emprendedora.
Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjugues, bisutería, ropa, calzado, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lizeth is an entrepreneurial, single young woman.

She discovered selling merchandise such as personal hygiene products, as a way to generate a good income.

Today she is launching with a very small amount of capital and is in the client collecting phase. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy assorted products such as: hand creams, deodorants, lotions, mouthwash, costume jewelry, clothing, footwear, among others, at wholesale and in this way is able to stock her small business with quality products.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to propel her business and will have a better variety of products to offer, thus managing to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy assorted items such as hand cream, deodorant, lotion, mouthwash, jewelry, clothes, shoes, etc

loans.name: Evelyn Maritza

texts.es:
Evelin, de 21 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, está casada, su esposo es albañil y tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos.

Evelin, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la ganadería, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, porque sus padres le enseñaron todo pero especialmente la crianza de ganado, que es una actividad muy fuerte en la zona donde vive y aprovechan los residuos agrícolas; con la producción de leche y queso cubren necesidades puntuales en la casa. 

Evelin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, porque actualmente solamente tiene 3 y desea mejorar su negocio de venta de leche y de queso.

Evelin, sueña con tener suficiente ganado para colocar un negocio formal de venta de leche y queso.
texts.en:
Evelin, 21, is an enterprising woman. She is married; her husband is a mason. They have two children who live with them.

Evelin works as a housewife, and raising cattle. She has done this for a long time, because her parents taught her everything. She specializes in raising cattle, a popular activity with locals. They make use of the agricultural residues. They use the milk and the cheese to cover their needs at home.

Evelin needs a loan to buy a milk cow, because she only has three now and wants to improve her milk and cheese business.

Evelin dreams of having enough cattle to start a formal dairy business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca muchos de sus municipios son primordialmente agrícolas ya que la tierra posee un alto grado de fertilidad. Los productos que se cultivan van desde la caña de azúcar, el maíz, el fríjol y el arroz hasta el mango, la papaya, el café y la vainilla. Asimismo la pesca representa una importante fuente de ingresos para los habitantes de la región. 
   En una de dichos municipios se ha formado un grupo llamado Comerciantes pues todos los integrantes realizan esta actividad. Ellos son: Elsa quien vende comida típica y ropa interior; Paula y Nazario, carne; Reynalda, cosméticos; Mauro, pollo y refresco y Juana, refresco.
   Don Mauro es padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales se siente muy orgulloso y por quienes está dispuesto a brindar lo mejor de sí por su bienestar. Don Mau, como le conocen sus amistades, dedicó gran parte de su vida a la pesca y su experiencia como comerciante lo llevó a dedicarse a la venta de pollo y refresco desde hace más de cuatro años. De esta forma pasa más tiempo en casa y dedica más atención a su familia.
   De lunes a domingo él y su esposa venden en un local ubicado en el centro de su comunidad. A partir de las siete de la mañana los clientes pueden adquirir el producto con una frescura y calidad inigualables; además el trato amable y los precios competitivos hacen de su negocio el mejor del lugar. No obstante, en un inicio vendía fuera de su casa sobre una pequeña mesa y bajo la sombra de una delgada lona; gradualmente su negocio rindió fruto y ahora goza de los beneficios. Comenta, “soy feliz por cada paso que Dios me ha permitido dar como comerciante, espero continuar ofreciendo lo mejor a mi esposa y a mis nietos”.
   La oportunidad del préstamo la invertirá en la compra de treinta pollos y refrescos de diferentes sabores lo cual el permitirá continuar con sus actividades. Su meta es iniciar con la venta de pollo asado para las personas que deseen consumir el producto con un sabor único.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el local de Don Mau quien viste playera café con rayas blancas.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca, most of the town economies are based on agriculture due to the fertile land that surrounds them. They grow a wide range of products, such as sugar cane, corn, beans and rice; as well as mangoes, papayas, coffee and vanilla. The fishing industry is also a useful source of income for many people in the area.

In one of these towns, there is a credit group known as "Comerciantes", which means "traders" in English. They chose this name because that is what all the members are.

Elsa sells typical food and underwear; Paula and Nazario sell meat; Reynalda sells cosmetics; Mauro sells chicken and soft drinks; and Juana sells soft drinks.

Mauro is a father of four children who he is very proud of and therefore, is willing to give his all to bring them up in the best conditions possible. 'Mau', as he is known to his friends, spent many years in the fishing industry and the commercial skills he learnt then led to him starting a business selling chickens and soft drinks over four years ago.

This work allows him to spend more time at home with his family. He and his wife sell their products from a place located in the center of town. The products are on offer from 7:00 am, as fresh as you can get and at the highest quality. Also, a friendly service and unbeatable prices make his business the best around.

He started from humble beginnings, selling his produce on a table under a thin sunshade outside his home. Once his business started to pick up, he was able to enjoy a better income.

"I'm grateful to God for giving me the skills to work in this business, and I hope to be able to continue to provide for my wife and grandchildren", he tells us.

He will use the loan to buy around thirty chickens and a variety of soft drinks, so he can carry on with his business.

In the future, he would like to set up a roast chicken stall, so his customers can buy deliciously cooked chicken.

The photo was taken in the place owned by Mau, and he is wearing a coffee-colored t-shirt with white stripes.

loans.use: to buy 30 chickens and refreshments of different flavors

loans.name: Angela Yurley

texts.es:
Angela es una persona simpática, responsable, una persona que gusta del trabajo independiente, pues dice que, “no hay nada mejor que ser su propio” jefe, trabaja en un almacén que a lo largo de los años ha ido posicionando en el sector, tratando de hacerlo lucir siempre atractivo para el público.
Actualmente estamos en temporada de Halloween y ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para exhibir una completa muestra de disfraces para todo tipo de gustos, hombre, mujer, niños, niña. Jóvenes y espera recibir tu apoyo, que para ella sería muy importante pues ese dinero que recauda le ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Angela is a kind, responsable person who likes to work independently. She says "there is nothing better than being your own boss." She works in a store which, over the years, has become well known in the area. She always tries to make it shine and be attractive to the public.

As we are currently in the Halloween season, she wants to ask for a loan to display a complete assortment of costumes for every taste; men, women, boys, girls, and young adults. She hopes to receive your support which, for her, would be very important as the money that she gathers will help her to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy a complete assortment of costumes.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María, de 30 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora, estudio hasta séptimo grado, por falta de dinero no siguió estudiando, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas que están estudiando y dependen de ella.

María, tiene una tienda que ha mantenido durante 6 años, este negocio lo inicio porque tenía que generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijas; la tienda está en su casa y ella sale dos veces por semana a comprar productos a la ciudad más cerca.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como azúcar, aceite, pan, arroz, frijoles, entre otros para mejorar el negocio y así tener más ingresos y más oportunidades de superación para sus hijas.

María, sueña con ver a sus hijas convertidas en profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 30, is a hardworking person. She studied up to the seventh grade, and could not continue due to the lack of money. She is a single mother, and has two daughter who study and depend on her.

María has had a store for six years. She started this business because she had to generate and income to cover her daughters' needs. The store is located at home, and she buys the products she needs twice a week at a nearby city.

María needs a loan to buy products such as sugar, vegetable oil, bread, rice, and beans to improve her business and her income, in order to offer her daughters more opportunities to get ahead.

María dreams of seeing her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, vegetable oil, bread, rice, and beans to improve her business.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Siempre con una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro, con gran optimismo, confiado de sí mismo, camina por las calles el joven Luis Fernando, una persona carismática y sencilla que tiene como sueño convertirse en un profesional, al ser de una familia humilde la educación universitaria es algo lejano, por ello quiere solicitar un ayuda de todos ustedes para hacer que esa brecha se acorte completamente, pues con el dinero iniciara un negocio de venta de mercancía de productos de uso personal, desodorantes, perdumes, cremas, productos capilares, que tiene como principal propósito generar el dinero para costearse todos los gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
With a smile always on his face, with great optimism, and confidence in himself, young Luis Fernando walks the streets. A charismatic and simple person, he dreams of becoming a professional.

Being from a humble family, a university education is something very distant. So Luis is requesting the help of all of you to close that gap completely. With this loan Luis will start a business selling personal products like deodorant, perfumes, creams, and hair products with the principal purpose of generating money to pay for all of his college expenses.

loans.use: to start a business selling personal products to pay for his college studies.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

Juan, es agricultor y también se dedica a la crianza de aganado de repasto, es una actividad que la aprendió de su papá, quien desde pequeño le enseño la actividad de siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo y a la crianza de ganado, el cual ordeña y hace queso para la venta y esos son ingresos que tiene.- En estas actividades también se involucra un hermano que le colabora a cuidar el ganado. 

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras para mejorar el negocio que tiene, esto le ayudará a tener más fuentes de trabajo.

Juan, sueña con seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y seguir ayudando a sus padres porque son personas de avanzada edad.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old. He studied up to the ninth grade. He is single and lives with his parents.

Juan grows vegetables and raises cattle, something he learned from his father, who taught him to grow corn, beans, green peas, and raise cattle when he was a child. He milks the cows and makes cheese to sell; that is his source of income. A brother helps him with the cattle.

Juan needs this loan to buy two dairy cows to improve his business. This will help him to have more sources of income.

Juan dreams of continuing working in what he likes, and helping his parents, who are old.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Mr Chung, 24 years old, is married. He lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Chung has worked in agriculture, farming food, for four years. His family is a low-income household; moreover, this job is unstable.

Chung's family has a latrine but it is not hygienic, which much concerns Chung. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Chung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With his business profit, Chung hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mariel

texts.es:
Mariel es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a su negocio de restaurante, ella trabaja todo el día en este su negocio y dedica mucho tiempo esta actividad. 
El sueño de la socia Mariel  es expandir y ampliar su restaurante, por eso ella lucha a diario, la socia solicito el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, quinua, papa. Con estos productos ella va poder cocinar más potajes de la zona.
La socia está muy contenta con el préstamo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mariel is an enterprising woman who has a restaurant. She works all day, and spends a lot of time in this activity.

Mariel dreams of expanding her business and enlarging her restaurant, so she fights every day. She requested a loan to buy rice, quinoa, and potatoes. With these products, she will be able to cook more traditional stews.

She is very happy for having received this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy rice, quinoa, and potatoes.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.es:
Bethel es el nombre de un grupo formado en el Estado de México por personas muy trabajadoras quienes viven en una comunidad con orígenes en la cultura mazahua. El ambiente es muy tranquilo y no es difícil sentirse relajado al escuchar el canto de las aves y el silbido del viento.  Gran parte de su población se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pero otros más acostumbran salir a vender fuera de su comunidad para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
   Delfina se destaca dentro del grupo por su gran espíritu emprendedor, vive desde hace 17 años con el señor Rogelio  quien trabaja como comerciante; juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos los cuales estudian en diversos grados escolares. 
   Una vez que contrajo matrimonio decidió comprometerse con la actividad de su esposo y ahora es toda una comerciante quien desde hace 13 años vende artículos del hogar, sobretodo productos electrodomésticos, trapos y cuchillos. Actualmente se siente muy satisfecha ya que todo el año representa ganancias favorables para el negocio; además tiene un local dentro de la plaza municipal sin olvidarse de la venta ambulante donde generalmente obtiene mayores ingresos.  Gran parte de la mercancía que ofrece es elaborada en su misma comunidad, salvo en algunas ocasiones cuando viajan a la capital para adquirir artículos especiales y de una calidad incomparable. 
   Por otro lado, se encuentra  muy agradecida con el préstamo de VFMéxico pues ha notado un gran aumento en su actividad. Cumplió su meta de adquirir un auto con el que transportar su mercancía y además sus realizó mejoras a su hogar. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Martha quien invertiría en abarrotes; Luisa, en vasos y antenas; Maribel, en productos para electrodomésticos; Angelina, en artículos plasticos y ropa; Juana, en vasos de licuadora y Eleterio, en materia prima para realizar tortillas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Delfina es quien viste el suéter color gris.
texts.en:
Bethel is the name of a group formed in Mexico by very hard-working people who live in a community whose origins are from the Mazahua culture.  The atmosphere is very calm and it is not hard to feel relaxed while listening to the birdsong and whistling winds.  A large share of their population makes a living growing corn, but others are more accustomed to selling outside the community to cover their household expenses. 

Delfina stands out in the group for her great entrepreneurial spirit.  For the past 17 years she has lived with Mr. Rogelio who works as a shopkeeper, and together they have formed a family with six children who study in different grade levels.     

Once she was married, she decided to work at her husband's business, and now she is a full businesswoman.  For the past 13 years she has been selling household items, especially electrical appliances, dishcloths, and knifes.  She currently feels very satisfied now that the business has seen favorable profits all year long.  In addition to street vending where she generally makes greater earnings, she also has a shop in the city square.  A large portion of the merchandise she offers is made in her community, except for occasionally when they travel to the capital to get special items of incomparable quality.      
   
She is very thankful for the loan from VFMéxico because she has noticed a large increase in her business's activity.  She accomplished her goal of getting a car that she uses to transport her merchandise and she also made improvements to her home. 

The other members of the group are Martha, who would invest in groceries; Luisa, in drinking glasses and antennas; Maribel, in products for electrical appliances; Angelina, in plastic items and clothes; Juana, in blender containers, and Eleterio, in raw materials for making tortillas. 

The photograph was taken on the stairs of the municipal kiosk.  Delfina is wearing the grey sweater.

loans.use: to buy home appliances, dish towels, knives, etc

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest. He operates a restaurant. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress is married with children. She has a responsibility of paying school fees for them.

She deals in the produce business and also does farming for selling plus food security. She desires to operate on a large scale, though she is faced with a difficulty of inadequate funds to purchase enough stock.

At the moment she is requesting money to stock more cassava flour to sell, because her current stock is not enough for her customers when demand is high, like the approaching christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling

loans.name: Ramon Erley

texts.es:
Largos, duros y arduos días de trabajo, paso el señor Erley para constituir su negocio de fábrica de producción de arepas, este negocio que representa su fortaleza moral, su lucha, su constancia, sus ganas de superación.
Arley a sus 25 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, siendo su propósito pagar la educación de sus muchachos y el otro comprar una vivienda.
Un día cualquiera soñó con montar un negocio y ahora lo tiene, nada lo detendrá para alcanzar sus metas y ofrecerle a su familia una excelente calidad de vida.
Para consolidar y seguir con su negocio, Erley solicita un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones a su negocio, pensando en optimizar los procesos de producción de arepas, por ello todo será para adecuar la cocina y quede todo más cerca.
texts.en:
Mr. Arley spent long, hard and arduous workdays establishing his factory business that produces arepas (flatbread made of ground maize dough). This business represents his moral strength, his struggle, his tenacity and his desire to excel.
At 25 years of age, Arley is the father of two children aged 3 and 1. Arley's goal is to pay for the education of his sons and to buy a home. Once upon a time he dreamed of starting a business and now he has it. Nothing will stop him from achieving his goals and offering his family an excellent quality of life.
To consolidate and continue his business, Arley is applying for a loan to make adjustments to his business. He is thinking of optimizing the production processes of arepas, so everything will be invested in improving the kitchen so that everything is closer together.

loans.use: to adjust the kitchen in order to improve the process of producing arepas.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura, who is 22, lives in Kibaha district. She is single and living with her parents. Zuhura is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers by working with youth in her village. She teaches youth entrepreneurship, health and life skills education to prepare them to become responsible adults and active citizens. Apart from volunteering to work with the youth in her village, Zuhura also runs a small restaurant. Currently she has not hired anyone to help her. She is working with her siblings. Zuhura is asking for a Kiva loan to improve her restaurant with decent utensils, chairs and tables and to increase the types of meals she offers. Zuhura plans to use the profit she will earn to help her mother and their family generally.

loans.use: to improve her restaurant with decent utensils, chairs and tables and to increase the types of meals she offers

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa

texts.en: Zaib-Un-Nisa is a 41-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years. Her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Zaib-Un-Nisa's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purposes. Therefore Zaib-Un-Nisa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that her husband can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance Zaib-Un-Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is 23 years old and she is volunteering as a health activist. She gives time each week to deliver programs in communities to provide information on sanitation, infant care, HIV/AIDS, and many other health-related topics. Though she currently doesn't have her own business, Tatu is requesting a Kiva loan to open a stall in a local market. She plans to use the profit she will earn to support her parents and herself with medical care, increase her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to start a stall in a local market.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 22 years old. She lives in the Balaka district in Malawi. Getrude has always wanted to run her own business. She just finished training with Zoona so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Balaka, Malawi.

Getrude completed her high school education in 2010. She says her life will change once she starts running her own business because she will be able to provide for her basic needs and help out her family by buying groceries and paying for utility bills.

Getrude needs a Kiva loan in order to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan will be used to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services. She will also use the loan to purchase a trading trolley and a mobile phone. These items are necessary for her to start her business. Getrude has big dreams for the future. Her dream is to run a successful business and help to support her mother who has suffered to pay for her education with the help of Getrude's aunt.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet-enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 59 years old and a widow with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 3,000 loan through GDMPC to buy groceries items to sell, including junk foods, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries items.

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. Juanita aspires to save enough money for her family in order to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has six children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Antonieta has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Criselda works hard to support her family. She has a vedioke rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Criselda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy a television and other supplies for her vedioke rental business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a television and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Haguiar

texts.en: Haguiar is 34 years old and the mother of four children who are 11, 10, 9 and 8 years old. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (or small grocery) store and uses her income to pay family expenses and her children's school fees because her husband's income is not large enough to pay all the bills. Before opening her store, Haguiar also sells breakfast in the morning to generate additional income. She works daily from very early in the morning to 8 p.m. when she heads home to have time with her children. To increase her income, she wants to buy more items to sell in her store. She is requesting a PhP 4,000 loan to buy coffee, sugar and rice to cook and sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to expand her store to meet her family's needs and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, soft drinks, and rice to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, es una madre soltera que vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, por lo que ambos dependen de ella económicamente, ella se dedica a atender su tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad; empezó su negocio hace 13 años, debido a la necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante, los horarios en los que Ana atiende su negocio es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo.
Ana solicita crédito para la compra de ropa, chancletas y granos básicos todo esto en grandes cantidades para surtir la tienda; considera que esto le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y por ende sus ganancias se verán incrementadas, los riesgos que representa son enfermedades o asechamiento de la delincuencia.
Ana sueña con poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y posicionarse como una microempresaria en la zona.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother who lives with her two children. They are 15 and 17 years old, so both depend upon her financially. She devotes herself to running her store, in which she sells basic goods. She started her business 13 years ago, owing to the necessity to provide for her children. Ana's business hours are from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., Monday through Sunday.

Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of large quantities of clothing, flip flops, and basic grains, in order to stock the store. She believes that this will help her to increase her inventory, and therefore, increase her earnings. The risks that she reports are diseases or criminal fraud.

Ana dreams of being able to give her children a better quality of life, and of establishing herself as a small businesswoman in the zone.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of clothing, flip flops, and basic grains, in order to stock the store.

loans.name: Mono's Group

texts.en: Mono is 36 years old and a farmer who lives in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She has two children, both of whom are in school, and helps support her family by growing cassava and rice. To address a lack of working capital, she leads a five-person group which is requesting a loan from VisionFund Cambodia. Mono plans to use her portion of this loan to buy insecticides to protect her cassava crop. She hopes her crops will grow well and earn more money than in past years.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her cassava crop from insects.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa is married, the mother of three children, and has successfully repaid a previous loan, which she used to improve her retail store. In addition to running this store, she helps her husband work on their farm to earn a living. Analisa is requesting this loan to improve her farm's output by buying organic fertilizer to use on her crops. Her goal is to increase her income, improve her business, and give her family a better life in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en: Jonabel is 24 years old, married, the mother of three children and a hardworking entrepreneur. She earns a living by growing rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Jonabel has successfully repaid a previous loan, and plans to use the new one to further expand her farm. She has been in her current line of work for two years, and her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Lea has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Annie has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old, married and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Hilda requested a PHP loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest of her rice. Hilda has been farming rice for 4 years, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest of her rice

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 40 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Liza has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase of fertilizers for her vegetable farm.

Liza has been farming vegetables for one year now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 28 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school, She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, soap, and shampoo. Mary Ann has been in her current line of work for about a year and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, soap, shampoo, and more.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Senia has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc.

Carina has been in this business for 15 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Carina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nidia De Jesus

texts.es:
Nidia es una mujer de 26 años de edad, mujer cabeza de familia, residente de una zona de postconflicto como lo es Sahagún, debido a la falta de oportunidades labores decidió pro convertirse en independiente montando un negocio muy común en el sector como lo es la cría y venta de animales, gracias a este dinero pude llevar el pan de cada día a su casa.
Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona tierna, sonriente, trabajadora, honesta.
Tiene como metas expandir su negocio, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo, mejorar sus ventas, diversificar su oferta al cliente pero para ello necesita capital para invertir y crecer como empresa.
Nidia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, pollos de engorde y alimento, esto le servirá para atender la demanda que se genera en fin de año.
texts.en:
Nidia is a 26 year old woman, the head of her household, and a resident of an area of previous conflict, Sahagún. Due to the lack of work opportunities she decided to become an entrepreneur, beginning a business that is common in this area: the breeding and sale of animals. Thanks to this income she can bring home the bread everyday.

She is characterized as a gentle, smiling, hardworking, and honest person.

She has goals to expand her business, to have sustainability over time, improve her sales, and to diversify her offerings for her customers, but she needs capital to invest and grow as a company.

Nidia wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of pigs, broiler chickens and food. This will serve to meet the demand generated at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy pigs, broiler chickens and food.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, and rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Charito dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is 30 years old and is married with one child. He runs his own Zoona money transfer business which simply put, is helping people send and receive money when they need to most so that communities can thrive. Steve currently currently operates his mobile money transfer business in Itezhi-tezhi, Zambia.

Steve is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can help more people in the town of Itezhi-Tezhi by expanding his business and contributing to the economy of the town. Currently, Steve uses the revenue generated from his Zoona business to take care of wife and child, but it is barely enough for him to expand and that is why he needs to take a Kiva loan.

With this loan, Steve will be able to have the working capital float required for him to open another mobile money transfer outlet. By opening a new outlet Steve would not only save his community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money, which in a town as small as Itezhi-Tezhi would have a massive impact. One of his objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities more communities so that people can have easier access to financial services.

At the present time, Steve does not have the necessary capital needed to execute his vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders will help him make his dream of growing his business a reality. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: with capital in order to expand his Zoona money transfer business and create employment in his community.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y le colabora en los trabajos de la agricultura, tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos son hogares a parte y uno vive con ellos y se dedica a la agricultura.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 38 años, la siembra de granos básicos la aprendió gracias a su padre y decidió dedicarse a eso porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia; pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, porque es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas, para aprovechar el rastrojo y los desperdicios  de la producción agrícola que tendrá en los próximos días; esto le permitirá tener más oportunidades para producir leche y queso.

José, sueña con tener muchas reces para dedicarse a vender lácteos y queso.
texts.en:
José, age 55, studied until the sixth grade. He lives with his common-law-spouse, who devotes herself to the household duties and helps him with the farm work. They have three children, two of whom have separate households, and one who lives at home and works in farming.

José has been working as a farmer for 38 years. He learned how to plant basic grains from his father, and he decided to do this work because he couldn't find another way to help his family. He also raises cattle because it's an activity that generates good income for him. José needs the loan to purchase two cows in order to make use of the crop stubble and leftover produce that he will have in the coming days. This will allow him to have more opportunities to produce milk and cheese.

José dreams of having a lot of cows, in order to sell dairy products and cheese.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her main source of income is by engaging in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed. She is a married woman and has three children ages 17, 15 and 12 year old respectively.

For the past 15 years, she has been engaged in seaweed farming. She would like to boost her source of income.

She decided to join CEVI, to buy seaweed farming paraphernalia like straw, soft-tie, pay for the laborer and seaweed seedlings. In that way, she could able to propagate more seaweed and continue to expand her business.

Rosalina is hopeful that someday she will be able to invest other sources of living to become productive.

loans.use: to buy seaweed farming paraphernalia like straw, soft-tie, pay for the laborer and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with five children.  With one children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, milk, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as . 

In the future Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to additional stocks like noodles, sardines, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gleceria dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.
.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Luna dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a widow parent of four children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear products. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan, de 43 años de edad, está acompañado, estudió hasta sexto grado, no continuo porque la escuela estaba a una distancia muy retirada y tiene 4 hijos.

Juan, tiene 29  años de tener un molino en su casa, decidió colocarlo porque él vive en una zona bastante poblada y no había molino, su pareja le ayuda a atender los clientes que llegan a moler y sus horarios para moler son dos, una la hace de las 8:00 a.m. a las 11:00 a.m. y por la tarde de 3:00 p.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprarle dos piezas al molino, porque esas se le han dañado y si no lo repara tendrá pocos ingresos y perderá a sus clientes.

Los sueños de Juan, son tener otro molino para cubrir por completo la demanda que existe y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old. He is in a relationship and has four children. He studied up to Grade 6 but could not continue as the school was far away.

Juan has had a mill in his house for 29 years. He decided to install it there as he lives in a fairly populated area and it had no mill. His partner helps him to care for the clients who come to have grains milled. They have two periods for milling, one from 8 am until 11 am and again in the afternoon from 3 pm until 5 pm.

Juan needs the loan to buy two pieces for the mill as it is damaged and if it is not repaired he will have little income and lose his clients.

Juan's dream is to have another mill to completely cover the demand that exists and have more income.

loans.use: to buy two pieces for his mill.

loans.name: Blessed Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Jane. She is married with five children. She is a member of Blessed SHG that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management.

She sells cattle and goats selling business. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more goats for selling. She looks forward to increased income which will enable her pay school fees for her children.
Jane appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more goats for selling.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y ha procreado 5 hijos, de ellos solo cuatro viven con él y uno estudia. 

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño su papá para que tuviera un trabajo estable, el lugar donde cultiva está a 15 minutos y viaja a pie, sus hijos le ayudan y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 del mediodía.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera, porque ya tiene una pero quiere comprar otra para aumentar la producción de leche.

Juan, sueña con tener más ganado, para que pueda tener una mayor producción de leche.
texts.en:
Juan, age 55, did not have the opportunity to attend school. He is married and he has five children, four of whom live with him, and one who attends school.

Juan has worked in agriculture since he was fourteen years old. His father taught him this work so that he could have steady work. The area he cultivates is fifteen minutes away, and he travels there on foot. His children help him. His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 12 noon.

Juan needs the loan in order to purchase a calf. He already has one, but wants to purchase another in order to increase milk production.

Juan dreams of having more cattle, so that he can have a greater production of milk.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es un hombre de 50 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia, él está muy satisfecho por su crédito pues afortunadamente con el apoyo de ello pudo comprar su terreno y ahora ya cuenta con más terreno para cultivar, por lo que está profundamente agradecido con los inversionistas quienes confiaron en él, Santos está necesitado de un nuevo crédito para poder aprovechar una oportunidad que se les está presentando con su familia que es adquirir otro terreno, pero él ahora carece de dinero por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar una cuerda de terreno para cultivo. Su gran sueño es seguir incrementando su cultivo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a 50 year old who is married, with a beautiful family. He was very satisfied with his loan as fortunately with the help of it he could buy his plot of land and he now has more land to cultivate. So he is profoundly grateful with the lenders who had confidence in him.

Santos needs a new loan to be able to take advantage of an opportunity that has been offered to his family to acquire another plot of land. But right now he doesn't have the money and for this reason he is requesting a new loan to buy a cuerda (a local land measurement) of land to cultivate. His great dream is to continue to increase his crops and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec ses trois enfants à charge. Agée de 23 ans, Abra est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Abra nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon en vue de mieux revendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens et charges éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: Abra is a married woman who lives in Baguida with her three dependent children.  She is 23 years old and resells charcoal.  She stocks up twice a month at the market and resells in front of her house.  Abra is taking this loan to buy some bags of charcoal, so that she can increase her sales and profits.  Her goal is to help her husband cover some of the family's daily needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 54 años de edad es casado con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Tomas desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultor cultivando una variedad de legumbres y verduras de su región, gracias a esta labor a su familia ha sacado adelante. Él con la visión de superación y con las ganas de darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y abono orgánico para el cultivo de esta temporada, pues él en estos días carece de dinero por lo que le es muy importante conseguir este crédito. Con este crédito Tomas espera fortalecer su cultivo y algún día terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Tomas is 54 years old, and married. He has a beautiful family with whom he lives in a community of Sololá.

Tomas has worked as a farmer for 20 years, cultivating a variety of regional legumes and vegetables, and thanks to this work, he has provided for his family. With a vision of success and the desire to give his family the best living conditions, he is requesting a loan. It is for the purchase of potato seed and organic compost for this season's crop, as currently, he lacks the money. That is why getting this loan is very important for him.

With this loan, Tomas hopes to fortify his crop, and someday, finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed and organic compost.

loans.name: Rosalia De La Paz

texts.es:
Rosalía, vive con sus cinco hijos y su compañero de vida, actualmente únicamente dos de sus hijos dependen económicamente de ella, Rosalía se dedica a la venta de pupusas y lo hace en horarios de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., todos los días, aprendió este oficio gracias a su madre y una tía desde hace 20 años, luego ella decidió poner su propio negocio para atenderlo junto a sus hijos y lo hizo con capital propio.
Rosalía solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las pupusas tales como: harina, repollos, tomates, aderezo, chocolate de tablilla, etc., la inversión le permitirá poder estar preparada con un inventario surtido, ya que están próximas las festividades de su localidad y esto le ayudara a aumentar más su clientela, sus ventas y generara más ingresos.
Ella tiene muchos sueños que le gustaría cumplir y uno de ellos es poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y considera que con la ayuda que la institución le brinda lo puede lograr a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Rosalía lives with her five children and her life's companion., Now only two of her children depend on her. Rosalía sells pupusas from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. every day. ,She learned this trade thanks to her mother and an aunt 20 years ago. Later, she decided to open her own business to run it with her children and she did it with her own capital.

Rosalía is asking for this loan to invest in buying materials to make pupusas, such as flour, cabbages, tomatoes, seasonings, tablillas of chocolate, etc. The investment will allow her to be ready with stocked inventory. Christmas festivities are soon in her community and this will help her to increase her clientele and her sales even more and generate more income.

She has a lot of dreams that she would like to make come true and one of them is to be able to give her family a better quality if life. She considers that with the help offered from the institution, she will be able to achieve this in the short term.

loans.use: to buy materials to make pupusas, such as flour, cabbage, tomatoes, seasoning, tablillas of chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Las Mujeres De Jucanya Group

texts.es: Juana es una gran mujer y una muy buena madre de familia, cuenta que le fue bastante bien con la inversión que realizo en su negocio de comida, pues con su préstamo compro materiales para su cocina como también alimentos para su respectiva preparación, a Dios gracias a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor y ahora la demanda a incrementada por lo que se obligada a solicitar otro préstamo para la compra de más materia prima para la elaboración de deliciosos platillos, ella comprara, maíz. Frijoles, pastas, azúcar. Su mayor sueño es ser reconocida a nivel nacional y seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juana is a great woman and a very good mother who says the investment she made in her food business went really. well. She bought materials for her kitchen and also food to prepare. Thank God, she was able to satisfy her customers better and demand has increased, and now she has to ask for another loan to buy more raw materials to make her delicious food. She will buy corn, beans, pasta, and sugar. Her biggest dream is is to be known nationally and to continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products such as corn, beans, pasta and sugar.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Septembre 2013 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.

Madame Ramatoulaye (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle âgée de 33 ans,  mariée, mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la dans la vente de produits saisonniers  et de couscous.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de différents fruits, 07 sacs de mil, 07 sacs de maïs et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de son couscous. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer au paiement de la scolarité, soins médicaux habillements… de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in September 2013 during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It consists of women who, for the most part, have acquired a great deal of experience in small retail business, which happens to be their main activity.

Ramatoulaye (standing at the far right in the photo, and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She sells seasonal products and couscous.

She intends to use her loan to buy five bags of various fruits, seven bags of millet, seven bags of maize, and other condiments for the preparation of couscous.

She will use her profits to pay for her children's education, healthcare needs, and to buy them clothes.

loans.use: to buy five bags of various fruits, seven bags of millet, seven bags of maize, and other condiments for the preparation of couscous.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, es un cliente que se ha visto beneficiado con el apoyo que se le ha brindado a través del otorgamiento del crédito anterior; manifiesta que logro fortalecer su negocio de ropa usada y mejoro el servicio de serigrafía, eso le está permitiendo generar más ingresos para su hogar y poderle dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
Ahora el solicita un  nuevo crédito ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de materiales para serigrafía y rotulaciones como: papelería, tintas, colores, etc, además de la compra de fardos de ropa usada, que le dará la oportunidad de continuar atrayendo mas cliente y a su vez obtener mejores ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco is a client who has benefited from the support that he received through the previous loan. He declares that he was able to strengthen his used clothing business, and that he improved his silk screen printing business. That is allowing him to generate more income for his home, and enables him to give his parents a better quality of life.

Now he is requesting a new loan, as he wants to invest it in the purchase of materials for silk screen printing and lettering, such as paper, ink, pigment, etc., in addition to the purchase of bundles of used clothing. This will give him the opportunity to continue attracting more customers, and in turn, earn more for his home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for silk screen printing and lettering, such as paper, ink, pigment, etc., in addition to bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  mis en place en Décembre 2009 est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à droite avec une main levée et en médaillon), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de la zone.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sac de 50 kg de suce pour le revendre en détails dans son village. Elle a une bonne  expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir effectué depuis plusieurs années.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son activité et  appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2009.  It is made up of women whose ideal is "to walk along the same path".  They have lived in the same village and been neighbors for a long time, so they share similar values of solidarity and mutual assistance.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Mariama, seated on the right hand side and raising her hand (she's also pictured in a small photo insert on the top right) is the group's featured borrower.  She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She sells sugar and stocks up at local markets.

Mariama intends to use her loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of sugar and then resell her merchandise on a retail basis in her village.  She has been involved in this activity for many years and therefore has a good deal of experience. 

Thanks to her profits, she will be able to boost her activity and to help her husband manage the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy four 50-kilo bags of sugar for resale on a retail basis in her village.

loans.name: Firuzakhon

texts.ru:
Фирузахон одна из уважаемых и значительных жителей маленького района Сарбанд. Ей 45 лет. Фирузахон имеет свою пекарню, где сама печет и продает лепешки. Фирузахон печет вкусные и традиционные лепешки, и она продает лепешки на рынке. У нее много клиентов. Ее лепешки хорошо известны и знамениты своими вкусами и запахами. 
  Скоро в доме Фирузахона пройдет большое событие - свадьба. Ее ребенок обзаведется собственной семьей. Для проведения свадьбы нужный средства, так как в Таджикистане это большое событие и придут гости больше 100 человек. Фирузахон хочет, чтобы вся свадьба пришла на высшем уровне и надеется, что Вы тоже внесете вклад для проведения этого праздника.
texts.en:
Firuzakhon is one of the respected and well-known residents of the small region of Sarband. She is 45 and has her own bakery where she baked and sells lepeshki (a local kind of bread). She bakes delicious traditional lepeshki and sells them at the market. She has many customers as her lepeshki are well known for their taste and smell.

There will soon be a big event in Firuzakhon's home - a wedding. Her child is starting his or her own family. She needs money to put on the wedding, since in Tajikistan this is a big event and more than 100 guests will come. She wants the wedding to be on the highest level and hopes that you too will contribute toward this celebration.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding

loans.name: Salicha

texts.ru: Салича, 53 года, замужем, у нее 4 детей, уже есть и внуки. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода Салича занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Саличи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, лошадь. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салича обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Салича планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также Салича мечтает съездить со своей семьей в Нарынскую область, показать детям и внукам где она родилась и выросла.
texts.en:
Salicha is 53 and married with four children, as well as grandchildren. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as a source of income. Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows and a horse on her farm as well as 1.2 hectares of land where she grows clover for sale and for her own use. Her monthly income is about 7,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Salicha has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a cow to increase her livestock head count. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock. She also dreams of travelling with her family to the Naryn region to show her children and grandchildren where she was born and raised.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock head count

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru: Жительнице района Хуросон 26 лет ее зовут Умринисо. Она замужем и имеет четверых  детей. Детям 6, 5, 3 и 1. Муж Умринисо занимается строительством. Она живет вместе семьей. Умринисо любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Умринисо занимается выращиванием мелко рогатого скота более 10 лет. Она покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Умринисо с детства занимается с этой деятельностью, и она освоила свою работу на отлично. Умринисо обратилась за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Она считает, что с увеличением скота увеличиться доход. Умринисо за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи.
texts.en:
Umriniso is 26 and a resident of the Khuroson region. She is married and has four children aged six, five, three and one. Her husband works in construction. She lives together with her family. She loves animals and therefore works in animal husbandry. She has been raising livestock for more than 10 years. She buys young calves and fattens them over a certain amount of time, then resells them at the cattle market. She has been working in this field since she was a child and has mastered her trade to the highest level.

Umriniso is looking for a loan to expand her business. She believes that by increasing her quantity of livestock, she will increase her income. She will use the loan amount to buy a few young calves. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her animal husbandry business and buy calves

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 15 овец. Супруг предоставляет услуги трактора и по укосу сена. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Chynara is 26 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 30,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows and 15 sheep on her farm. Her husband mows hay with the use of his tractor. Her monthly income is up to 14,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Chynara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase two heifers to increase her livestock head count. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy two heifers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Liticia

texts.en: Liticia and her family live in the town of Calape, Bohol. She is a 54-year-old woman who is married and has five children: three adult and two school aged. Her husband works hard as a construction worker while Liticia is engaged in the piggery (hog-raising) business. She has been doing this for ten years to help her husband augment their financial stability. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. The other portion of the loan will be used to build an extension on the pigpens. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and enhance her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and to build an extension on the pigpens.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – предприниматель из города Первомайск. Она уже более 10 лет торгует удобрениями, семенами, ядохимикатами, комнатными цветами, глиняными горшками для цветов, а также владеет еще второй точкой, где реализует канцелярские товары, чулочно-носочные изделия и шапки. Наталья имеет магазин товаров для огородников, а также 3 другие торговые точки, которые Наталья арендует у администрации местного рынка. Наталье – 44 года. Она замужем, у нее есть 17-летний сын. 
Наталье нужна сумма в 80 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, удобрения, ядохимикаты, а также пополнить ассортимент комнатных цветов. Из-за скачков курса в стране Наталье, как и многим предпринимателям в Украине, приходится сложно, но благодаря своей природной способности вовремя ориентироваться и принимать правильные решения, Наталья эффективно ведет свой успешный бизнес и получает от этого массу удовольствия.
texts.en:
Natalya is an entrepreneur from the city of Pervomaysk. For more than a decade she has been selling fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, cut flowers and clay flowerpots. She also runs a second shop where she sells office supplies, hosiery and hats. She has a gardening supplies store and three other retail outlets that she rents from the administration of the local market. She is 44 and married with a 17-year-old son.

Natalya needs 80,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to fill out her selection of cut flowers. Due to current events in her country she, like many Ukrainian entrepreneurs, is having a difficult time, but thanks to her natural capability to adapt and make the right decisions, she is running a successful business effectively and receives a great deal of pleasure from this.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer as well as a selection of cut flowers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
For the past four years Emma has earned a living through her fishing in the Philippines. She makes extra money by buying and selling frozen foods.

Emma has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy fishing supplies such as a net, gasoline and wood for her work.

Emma has been able to sustain her business through her own efforts and with the help of her prior loan from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies such as a net, gasoline and wood for her work.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nemesia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nemesia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing equipment and materials for her business.

Nemesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment and materials for her business.

loans.name: Ayllen

texts.en:
Ayllen a 33-year-old woman who sells snacks and sautéed vegetables to the people in her community. She has also been raising and selling pigs for the past two years. Her activities supplement the income that her partner earns as a carpenter.

Ayllen has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy more flour, peanuts and vegetables to prepare and sell. Additional ingredients will result in her being more productive and an increase in profits. She hopes to build up her business, manage it well and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more flour, peanuts and vegetables to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Alinuswe

texts.en:
At 25 years old, Alinuswe is the breadwinner in a family of four. He resides in a town called Blantyre in Malawi. Blantyre is the second largest city in Malawi after its capital city Lilongwe. This makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur. 

Alinuswe is looking to start running his own business in Blantyre. His business will deal in the sending and receiving of money. He is going to be a Zoona agent. This means that for every transaction that Alinuswe does, he will earn a profit. Alinuswe has always wanted to be an entrepreneur and the prospect of managing his own time and his own budget and resources has always excited him. 

His biggest dream is to run his own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. It is for this reason that Alinuswe has requested a Kiva loan. This loan will help Aliuswe to purchase the equipment needed for him to run his own business. This includes a mobile phone and a trading trolley. The funds will also be used to serve customers who need to send and receive money from Alinuswe.  

Alinuswe is grateful for the opportunity to get funding on Kiva and start running his own business. He sees this as a life changing opportunity for himself and his family. He intends to use the earnings from his business to provide basic needs for his family, which he currently struggles to do so.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley, an internet enabled phone and the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that he can start running his own business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 38 years old, married and has two children. 

She owns and manages a food stall inside the school campus in her village. She's been in this business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 6,000 for 6 days. Her income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of her children. 

Due to insufficient capital from her food stall, she would like to avail herself of a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase grocery items and food seasonings for her business. 

She's hoping that her stall will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and food seasonings.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa lives a simple life with her family in the town of Clarin, Bohol. For the past seven years she has earned a living by raising and selling hogs. It is her main source of income.

Raising hogs requires money up front, as the pigs need several months before they are large enough to be sold at a profit. Because of this Celsa has applied for a 4,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy feed for the pigs and purchase additional piglets as well. She works steadily to keep her business at a sustainable level.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and purchase additional piglets as well.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina was born in 1987. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Madina is married and has 3 children. 

She has been busy with her bakery business for more than 10 years. Madina bakes different kind of tarts and biscuits. She has “golden hands." Her tarts and biscuits are very tasty, and that’s why she has regular clients. 

Madina is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy flour, butter, and sugar for baking more tarts. She will use the profit from her business to pay for higher education for her children. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and sugar for baking tarts.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 28 years old, and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Janice has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Janice has been in this business for three years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
