Cheryl works hard to support her family. Cheryl is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shorts, slippers, shirts, etc. to sell.

Cheryl has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shorts, slippers, and shirts to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 33 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, sardines, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Helen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, sardines, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Melodia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, fabrics, needles, and other materials needed for her tailoring shop. She has been in this business for 39 years and she earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Melodia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like thread, fabrics, needles, and other items needed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria used her previous loan to buy a computer set and to upgrade and repair old computers. She’s thankful for the monetary support and kind consideration of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders. Her patrons are mostly young people, who rent the computers to play online games and work on projects and homework.

Gloria knows her business is growing because the number of customers is increasing. Gloria needs to add another printer and more computer peripherals to accommodate all of the customers that visit her shop. She aims to buy an additional computer, as well. Gloria has applied for a loan of 15,000 to buy these items. She’s hoping that this year's loan will once again be granted by CCT.

Gloria regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, discuss her business experiences, draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy computer unit and  peripherals for her internet café.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 57-year-old married woman with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Merlinda runs a wholesale business selling tupperware products in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like lotion, cologne, shirt, plasticware, etc. to sell.

Merlinda has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has run the wholesale tupperware business for 10 years and she also earns an income selling food.

Merlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like lotion, cologne, shirts, plasticware, an other items to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 61 years old and married with six children.

Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Salome has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Salome aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Teodolindo

texts.es:
José,  es un cliente que se encuentra muy agradecido con el otorgamiento del crédito anterior, ya que pudo mantenerse trabajando en la agricultura, ha tenido muy buenas ganancias que le ayudaron a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar y disminuir sus deudas.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: lo son abonos, insecticidas y herbicidas para sus cultivos de granos básicos; otro parte lo utilizara para comprar cerdos y pollos, de esta manera fortalecerá sus actividades económicas, ya que la comercialización se ha vuelto mejor últimamente, y también contara siempre con el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
José is a client who is very happy to have received his previous loan as it allowed him to keep working in agriculture. He has generated good earnings that have helped him give his family group a better quality of life and reduced his debt.

He is requesting a loan again to invest in farming supplies, such as fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides for his staple grain crops. He will use another part of the loan to buy pigs and chickens, which will strengthen his financial enterprises, as his marketing has improved lately. He will also still have his family's support.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides for his staple grain crops; he will use another part of the loan to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 40 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with four children aged 6 to 19. For the past three years, she has grown vegetables such as okra, spring onion and ginger in the community of Jagna in Bohol province.

Patricia applied for a loan to buy chili seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. She plans to use her profits to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy chili seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna was born in the year of 1991. She is married and has a son. Her son is little. Mavzuna lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She loves her family, and she tries for the well-being of her family.

Mavzuna is a sewer. She has been busy with offering sewing services for more than seven years. Mavzuna sews different kinds of national Tajik dresses.

Mavzuna needs a new sewing machine because her sewing machine is broken. Mavzuna is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for developing her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel found it challenging to run her business in the early years since she didn’t have enough capital to support the business. When she heard that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help new entrepreneurs, she didn’t hesitate to try the program. Isabel knows that these days, it’s not enough that you're determined and you persevere; your revolving fund is a big factor for your business. Isabel's previous loan started a vast change in her business. She bought additional products and attracted additional patrons.

Isabel wants to thank lenders for donating to support her business. She’ll include them in her prayers as God will return abundance to those who helped her. Now, she is requesting another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock of personal products for her buy and sell business.

Although it's not related to her current business, Isabel dreams of having her own restaurant. Cooking is her passion, so her next goal is to manage a food business.

Isabel believes that if you want success to come into your life, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She consistently attends weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners where members gain spiritual strength from life-changing testimony, share their own experiences of God’s love, pay micro finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them.

loans.use: to add stock of personal products for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es una persona con amabilidad, respeto y sinceridad, tiene 36 años de edad, está feliz mente casado y cuenta con una familia muy linda, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Mario para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a prestar servicios de trasporte de camión, el lleva 5 años de dedicarse a esta labor, pues gracias  a esta actividad a su familia ha sacado adelante.
Mario está muy preocupado porque su mayor fuente de ingreso lo obtiene a través de su camión pero ahora se encuentra con algunos desperfectos por esa razón busca un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de carros, y así pronto volver a su actividad normal. Su mayor anhelo es tener su camión en bunas condicione, y mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a friendly, respectful, and sincere person. He is 36 years old, happily married, and has a beautiful family. They live in a community of Sololá.

In order to make a living Mario offers truck transportation services. He has been doing this work for five years as it is thanks to this business that he has been able to provide for his family.

Mario is very worried because his truck is his main source of income, but it is currently having problems. For this reason he is looking for a loan to buy car parts so he can return to business as usual soon. His greatest wish is to have his truck in good condition and to improve his family's finances.

loans.use: to buy parts for his truck.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janeth is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Janeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as sugar, flour, etc.

Janeth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Janeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo has been a vegetable farmer for almost four years. He is a hardworking man residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his wife and a two-year-old child. He grows vegetables like ampalaya (bitter gourd), eggplant, and pechay (cabbage).

Rodulfo wants to continue improving his quality of life so he is requesting a loan with CEVI to purchase farm maintenance items like fertilizer, seedlings, and a sprayer. These items serve as tools to improve his farming livelihood. These tools will generate more harvest to slowly improve his earnings. In that way, Rodulfo is looking forward to invest other sources of income to become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase farm maintenance items like fertilizer, seedlings, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is thankful that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help entrepreneurs lacking capital to run their businesses. She’s grateful that CCT granted her a She used the loan to buy additional grocery products for her business and she's seen an increase in her daily sales. However, the profit is just enough for her family's day-to-day expenses.

Angelina has the qualities of dedication and perseverance and that’s why the business is growing. She aims to have a broader array of products to offer to clients so she has applied for another loan of 40,000 PHP. She wants to buy products for her variety store business such as bottled drinks and grocery items.

She believes that CCT will help her to achieve her goals, which include having her own house and lot someday. Also, she aims to buy her own lot for the business instead of paying for a monthly rental.

Angelina meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, discuss her business experiences, draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products to stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a 56-year-old married woman with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Minerva runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Minerva has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 5 years and she also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her Avon product sales. Cristina is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristina dreams that one day, she will be able to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
Chhay, 55, is a resident of Prey Veng province and the married mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, she and her husband have been running businesses growing rice and weaving a Khmer traditional textile called “Hol”. In addition, she sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Chhay earns about $9 USD every day and she can save about $4 USD for future needs. She is challenged by drops in rice prices and low harvest output from the rice field.

This will be her second cycle with VisionFund; her past loan enabled her to do home repairs and improve her living conditions. As the leader of a two-member group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and fuel for her pumping machine and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have abundant rice yields to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fuel for her pumping machine so she can harvest more rice crop yields to make a better living.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Muhbira

texts.en: Muhbira was born in 1983. She is divorced and she has a son, Khurshed, who is 4 years old. She is the only one responsible for feeding and bringing up her son. Muhbira is a sewer and she makes a variety of women's clothes. Muhbira has worked in this field for more than 10 years and she has great experience in this field. Little by little, she has developed her knowledge and abilities. Muhbira is going to buy fabrics for sewing more clothes such as dresses, suits, skirts, and other items. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fabrics. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Roeub's Group

texts.en:
Roeub is a 44-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in a rural area of Battambang province. In order to support her family, she has been growing watermelon for a long time. She also works in construction to earn additional income to support her family’s needs. Roeub is able to save about $5 USD each day after expenses.

Because she does not have enough working capital, Roeub is leading a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan through VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow her crops well. This will be her eighth loan cycle, while the other two group members are in their sixth and third loan cycles, respectively. Her previous loans helped her to improve her living conditions. Roeub is hopeful that this new loan will help her to successfully expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow her crops well to increase her income and expand her current business.

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Mercedes hace tres años tiene su negocio de pulpería es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por salir adelante y ofrecerles a sus hijas un mejor futuro. Doña Mercedes sabe que se aproxima la temporada navideña y la demanda de sus productos aumentara, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, jugos, confites, productos de aseo personal entre otros. Con el crédito podrá obtener mejores ingresos y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mercedes has had her grocery business for three years.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who is fighting to get ahead and offer her daughters a better future.  Mercedes knows that the Christmas season is coming and demand for her products will increase, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy staple grains, juices, candies, and personal care items, among others.  With this loan she will be able to generate better income and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, juices, candies, and personal care items, among others.

loans.name: Geonima

texts.en:
Geonima is a woman who raises pigs for a living. She has been doing this for five years and hopes to sustain and improve her business.

Geonima is a married woman and she has seven grown children. She is now 58 years old. She and her husband, a farmer, work hard for their living for daily sustenance and to save money for the future. Geonima is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for her pigs and buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc.

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es:
Mario es una persona con amabilidad, respeto y sinceridad, tiene 36 años de edad, está feliz mente casado y cuenta con una familia muy linda, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Mario para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a prestar servicios de trasporte de camión, el lleva 5 años de dedicarse a esta labor, pues gracias  a esta actividad a su familia ha sacado adelante.
Mario está muy preocupado porque su mayor fuente de ingreso lo obtiene a través de su camión pero ahora se encuentra con algunos desperfectos por esa razón busca un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de carros, y así pronto volver a su actividad normal. Su mayor anhelo es tener su camión en bunas condicione, y mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a kind, respectful, and sincere person. He is 36 years old, happily married, and he has a beautiful family. They live in a community of Sololá.

Mario earns a living offering trucking transportation services. He has been doing this work for five years, as it is thanks to this business that he has been able to support his family.

Mario is very worried because his truck is his main source of income, but it is having some problems. For this reason, he is looking for a loan to buy car parts so he can get back to business as usual soon. His greatest wish is to have his truck in good condition and to improve his family's finances.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses and to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Shahnaz's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Shahnaz's husband is unable to earn a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Shahnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. Shahnaz and her husband thank Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 46-year-old mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for three years to meet the family’s expenses.

Rukhsana's husband wants to repair the auto rickshaw to provide proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do so. Therefore, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Rukhsana’s husband can repair the auto rickshaw and provide proper transportation services to earn an income.

RUKHSANA and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 62 years old, widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Dolores runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell.

Dolores has previously borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF. She has been running her business buying and selling dry goods for 12 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and direct selling.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 56-year-old married woman with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eva has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell, such as bread, noodles, sardines, school supplies, and other groceries.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Madel is 29 years old and two of her children attend school.

Madel has a shells craft business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more shells for her business. Madel has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Madel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells for her business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 36 years old and married with six children. All six of Daisy's children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a business in the Philippines, buying and selling dry goods. She has requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell. Daisy has been in this business for 6 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: Victoriano es un gran padre de familia y un excelente agricultor, tiene varios años de experiencia y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado mucho gracias a los créditos que ha tenido acceso en ADICLA, su cultivo ha incrementado y modernizado con las inversiones que ha realizado,  su entusiasmo por la vida y ganas de seguir superándose lo lleva a solicita un nuevo crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de papa e insumos agrícolas para obtener al final una buena cosecha. El guarda las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito para seguir cambiando su vida. Su mayor anhelo es pagar los estudios de sus hijos, cubrir los gastos de la casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a great family man and an excellent farmer. He has a number of years of experience and his living conditions have greatly improved, thanks to the loans he has had access to through ADICLA. His yield has increased and become more modern with the investments he has made. Victoriano's enthusiasm for life and his desire to get ahead have brought him to request a new loan, which he will use to purchase potato seeds and other agricultural supplies in order to obtain a good harvest. 
He hopes to get this loan in order to continue changing his life. His greatest wish is to pay for his children's studies, cover the household expenses, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 43-year-old woman living with her four children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Bushra’s husband drives an auto rickshaw and he pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an very poor family and has been earning just enough to feed his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Bushra has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, she did not have enough money. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Bushra hopes that her husband will be able to generate more income because he won't have to pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Sebastían

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre de 39 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Sebastián para obtener sus ingresos trabaja como jornalero realizando todo tipo de actividad, el lleva 20 años de ejercer esta labor pero también se dedica a la compra y venta de frijoles por quintal. Sebastián está necesitado de un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de  venta de frijoles pues con la sequilla que a su país azoto en estos últimos meses el frijol a incrementando su precio y ya no está dentro de sus pasividades comprar más para venderlos por tal razón solicita un préstamo de dos mil quetzales. Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio, cubrir los gastos de la casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a 39-year-old man. He is single and lives with his family in a community in Sololá. In order to make a living, Sebastián works as a day laborer working on many types of activities. He has been doing this work for 20 years, and he also purchases and sells beans by the hundred-pound-weight.
He needs a loan to invest in his business selling beans. Because of the drought which has hit his country in recent months, beans have gone up in price and now it isn't within Sebastian's ability to purchase more beans to sell. For this reason he requests a loan of two thousand quetzales.
His greatest wish is to strengthen the business, cover his household expenses, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of beans.

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Naga Tegal Wangi group succeeded to make their payments on time. All the members attended the meeting to give the money to MUK’s staff. The group also made some savings. All of them showed their enthusiasm and shared their successful experiences with other members. They are very grateful for the beautiful cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the group. The loan helped them to support their families income.

Ni Made was successful with her plan for the sow. The sow gave birth to ten healthy piglets and she sold them all. She earned a satisfactory profit. Now, she can make her payment, fulfill her family's needs and saving.

To increase the income from the pig business, the group agreed to continue their loan. Ni Made is the leader. In addition to being a pig breeder, she also works as a worker who does all the work, depending on what is ordered by people. She used her portion of the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. With her own money, she buys vitamins to keep the sow healthy. 

The group promise to use the loan wisely and entirely use it to support the pig business, because the pig business has proven a help to increase the income of their family.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
Sedana Yoga group was able to repay the loan on time. Ni Nengah, head of the group, tells of her success in raising pigs. From the first loan she got from MUK, Ni Nengah has two pigs. But now she has five pigs and one sow. Ni Nengah sells piglets after raising them for two months. All profits she saves and will be used for working capital so that she can be independent in terms of capital.

Ni Nengah is very grateful for the help she had received so far. Ni Nengah still expects the assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital or training, so that she and all members of the group can be successful pig farmers.

To increase the population of pigs, the Sedana Yoga group decided to have another loan from MUK. This loan is used to buy superior or local piglets, feed and also renovate the cages.
Ni Nengah used her loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. She will keep the pigs for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1kg of pig is between 15.000IDR until 18.000IDR depends on the quality of the meat. Ni Nengah hopes that she will earn enough profit. This time she will save all the profit.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan, as the head of Taman Indah group, coordinates and leads her group to make the repayments on time to MUK.

During the loan period, they succeeded to maintain and keep the pigs well. The pigs grow healthy and free from desease. They always give the pigs nutrious feed and vitamins. They also keep the cages hygienic and clean. Most of them earned a satisfactory profit and they are very happy for that. The result from the pig business can support their daily needs, savings and make their dream come true (renovate house or kitchen, buy motorcycle, etc).

Now, to make sure they have more saving to later use as business capital, the Taman Indah group agree to apply for a new loan. Still with the pig business, the loan will be used to buy superior piglets for better results and to sell for higher prices.

Ni Wayan used her portion of the loan to purchase three superior piglets. She will buy feed with her own money. She plans to increase her saving this time. She will coordinate the sale of the pigs five months later to make sure they have a high price.

This time one member must resign because she had to move to another city and one member is not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is 40 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, and is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to cover her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and coaching classes in evening. It is a challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fees, so both are doing a lot of hard work to run the setup of their house.
 
Mafia owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband is doing small jobs in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to be gone, and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. Mafia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan; she will buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her services. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs for her salon.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and is married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, spices and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old, married and has seven children, two of whom are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years, and has borrowed thirteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Virginia has now requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 48-year-old married woman living with her husband and seven children in the area of Lahore. 

Many years ago, Farzana started a business selling milk with the support of her son. Due to her efforts and work, she has a good reputation in her family. She helps her son in all family matters as well as financial matters. She uses cows milk for her personal use and sells buffalo milk in the market with the help of her son. In this way, both are earning a healthy income to support their family.

Farzana shared her feeling of achievement, that now she begins to send her younger children to schools for better education. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase an additional cow for producing more milk to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for producing more milk to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 55-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Brenda has a house rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Brenda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy cement and other supplies for maintenance.

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and other supplies for maintenance.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a 53-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoriana has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Victoriana requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

In the future, Victoriana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mangla

texts.en:
Mangla is a 32-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s cloths. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers, this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.
 
Now with the increase in needs, he considers it necessary to grow the business. But the lack of availability of funds is the major problem for her husband. Therefore, Mangla took a loan for her husband's business. With the help of this loan he will purchase a variety of clothes to sell.
 
Mangla gives thanks to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to buy a variety of clothes to attract customers.

loans.name: Hersalina

texts.en:
Hersalina is a 57-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Hersalina has a general store business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. Hersalina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, sugar, school supplies and other personal care products to sell.

In the future, Hersalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, sugar, school supplies and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 59 years old and married with four children. Asuncion works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Asuncion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre de 47 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 7 y 12 años de edad, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santiago es agricultor desde hace 20 años, esto con el fin de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia. Santiago está necesitado de un préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa e insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de esta temporada pues él no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder adquirir sus insumos.
Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su cultivo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Santiago is a 47-year-old man and married with a beautiful family of six children between 7 and 12 years old. This beautiful family lives in a region of Sololá. Santiago has been a farmer for 20 years in order to earn an income and provide for his family. Santiago needs a loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for this season's crops, as he doesn't have the necessary funds to purchase his supplies. His biggest wish is to grow his crops and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn is a 55-year-old married woman with four children, living in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has had a grocery store since 2005. Her husband is 37 years old and is a construction worker. Two of her children are factory workers and another two children attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $22 a day. 

Now, Phoeurn would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work. This loan will help her children have better travelling and transportation conditions. In the future, she is going buy cows to breed for calves to resell, renovate her house and support her two children to earn higher education.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
After six months of maintenance of her local pigs, Ketut successfully sold them at 4,600,000 IDR. After deducting her expenses for feed and medicines, the net benefit was 1,000,000 IDR. This day, the price for pork is suddenly down from 34,000 IDR per kg to 22,000 IDR per kg.

With these results, Ketut was able to pay off the loan to MUK of 1.500.000 IDR and then she and the group of Marga Damai proposed a new loan to MUK. These loans are very necessary to increase the business capital for the pigs so they can supplement the family income.

Ketut's daily activities are only as a farmer with her husband. Ketut and some friends formed a group for raising pigs that has been running for 10 periods. With the help of venture capital loans from MUK of 1,500,000 IDR per member, Ketut established a pig-raising group named Marga Damai and she became the head of the group.

Furthermore, Ketut will use this loan to buy three local piglets for pig barbeque. Ketut buys feed with her own money. Ketut hopes that during the next six months, the pigs will have good growth, which will increase sales results.

Obviously the results obtained will be used to meet the cost of living as well as their children's school fees. Support from her husband also encourages Ketut to work hard with the pig livestock business. Two members couldn't attend the meeting because of illness.

loans.use: to buy three local piglets.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is a 42-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady. 

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine. Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. 

Therefore, Hafeezan has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine. Hafeezan hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: fix her husband's lathe machine so he can easily operate it and generate income for the family.

loans.name: Nhe's Group

texts.en:
A 48-year-old farmer, Nhe is married and blessed with four children, one of whom (a daughter) is dependent and in school. She lives in Prey Veng province where she has been running a rice growing business for 29 years. She also sells fermented rice (a kind of sweet) to add more income. Drought is the main challenge to her rice growing business. 

She has been with VisionFund for a cycle already, and it has enabled her to improve her living conditions. In a group of two, Nhe is the leader, and she will use her loan to buy rice to make fermented rice to sell, and to buy rice seeds to plant. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to upgrade her standard of living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to plant, and rice to make fermented rice to sell.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Polomolok, South Cotabato is situated in the Southern Mindanao region of the Philippines. It is a first class suburban municipality that has a very fertile soil and favorable climate. This is why agricultural crops and livestock production thrive in the area.

Marivic, her husband Bobby, a van driver, and their five children reside in this beautiful town of Polomolok. Three of their children are studying in high school and the other two are not yet of school age.

Marivic operates a barbecue stall near the town’s public market to supplement her husband’s income. She’s been doing this endeavor for 10 years already and she’s currently earning PHP 15,000 monthly. Throughout these years, she’s able to gain many customers who take out barbecue as snack, viand or packed meal.

Due to the growing expenses of her family, Marivic wishes to enhance her business by adding more barbecue ingredients such as pork and chicken meats, hotdogs, sausages, liver and other items. She needs PHP 20,000 supplementary capital for this purpose. It will surely boost her income and savings to better prepare for her children’s college education.

As an active member of the Southern Baptist Church, she constantly prays for a happy family where God is the center of their lives. She also meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more barbecue ingredients such as pork and chicken meats, hotdogs, sausages, liver and other items.

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde un año, para acceder a financiamiento con PANA PANA. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Loma Linda, porque las integrantes viven cerca de una loma y es bonita y fresca.

AIDALY: Es una joven amable de 25 años, con deseos de superación, casada con 1 hijo de 8 años que estudia su primer grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como buzo. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estableció una pequeña pulperia en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando préstamo para diversificar sus productos y comprar insumos para la elaboración de frito: filipitas, repollo, tomate, pollo aceite, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three Miskito women in the city of Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who work day to day determined to grow their small businesses. They have been organized as a group for one year in order to gain access to funding from PANA PANA. They decided to name their group Loma Linda because the members live close to a hill that is beautiful and refreshing. 

Aidaly, 25, is a kind young woman with the desire to succeed. She is married with one 8-year-old child who studies in the first grade of primary school. Her spouse works informally as a diver. In order to have her own source of income and to contribue to the bills, she established a small grocery store in her wooden stilt house. She is requesting a loan to diversify her products and purchase ingredients to make deep fried snacks, such as bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, oil and more. She also dreams of selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make deep fried snacks: bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken and oil, among others.

loans.name: Aguaclara Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 12 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario AGUACLARA, porque son personas transparentes y honradas con deseos de superación.

CATALINA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora cordial de 61 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como soldador. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, educación de sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende fritos, enchiladas, tacos, nacatamales. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes: filipitas, repollo, tomate, pollo aceite, cebolla, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construirle a su familia una vivienda de cemento  para que vivan de manera más segura.
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women and a man, all of whom are enterprising individuals. They have been organized for 12 months in order to gain access to funding to improve their small businesses by ramping up their merchandise. In doing so, they can improve their incomes, allowing them to cover their basic living needs, assure a good education for their children and extend their businesses. They decided to name their group AGUACLARA because they are transparent and honest people with the desire to succeed. 

Catalina is a member of the group. She is a warm-hearted woman, 61, and married with five adult children. Her spouse works informally as a welder. In order to contribute to the bills and education of her children, as well as have her own source of income, she sells deep fried snacks, enchiladas, tacos and nacatamales (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf). She is requesting funding to buy goods and ingredients, including bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken oil and more. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to build her family a cement home so they can live a safer life.

loans.use: to buy goods and ingredients, including bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken oil and onions, among others.

loans.name: Marcaribe Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario MARCARIBE, está conformado por 3 mujeres sonrientes, viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 12 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

JENNIFER MARIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven de 19 años de edad, luchadora, con deseos de superación, madre soltera de 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, elabora pan de manera artesanal, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de pan de coco, empanadas, queque de arroz, yuca, quequisque.  Ella sueña con vender ropa usada y tener un tramo donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
The outreach group "Marcaribe" [Caribbean Sea] consists of three smiling women. They live in the city of Bilwi. They got together 12 months ago with the purpose of working in solidarity in order to have access to loans in Pana Pana which allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, improve their income, and thus gradually improve the living conditions of their families.

Jennifer María is a member of the outreach group. She is a 19-year-old young woman, a fighter and eager to improve. She is a single mother of two young children. In order to bring up her children, she makes homemade bread, thus generating her own income and contributing to household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients for making coconut bread, meat pies, and rice cakes; also, to buy cassava and taro.

Jennifer María dreams of selling used clothes and have a section where she can showcase her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make coconut bread, meat pies, and rice cakes; also, to buy cassava and taro.

loans.name: Morena Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace año y medio, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios incrementando su inventario, sus ingresos, para mejorar sus condiciones de vidas. 

GRISELDA ISABEL: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora de 44 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 dos hijos: 1 mayor de edad y un adolescentes de 13 años que estudia su sexto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, vende ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: paca mixta para hombres y mujeres, una paca de bolsos y carteras.  Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of two women and one man, all of them very enterprising, who got together a year and a half ago for the purpose of obtaining funds to improve their small businesses, by increasing their stock, their income and improving their living conditions.  

Griselda Isabel is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a 44-year-old determined woman and a single mother to two sons: one of age and a 13-year-old teenager studying in the sixth grade. 

In order to provide for her children she sells used clothes in a section of the city market she rents. In this way she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and her children's studies. 

She is requesting funds to purchase mixed surplus stock of men and women's clothing, and surplus stock of handbags and wallets, in Managua. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase in bulk in Managua: mixed surplus stock of men and women's clothing, surplus stock of handbags and wallets

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a young and hard working woman. She was born in 1996. Nilufar is married and lives with her husband in North Tajikistan. Nilufar works in a café. She always wanted to get a higher education but she has not had the opportunity to apply to the university. Nilufar is a very hard working woman and she does her job well. Nilufar now needs financial support because she is ill and she must buy medicine. Nilufar awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 31 years old. She is married with two children who are in school. Jonabel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Jonabel has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Jonabel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Awaskira Group

texts.es:
AWASKIRA: Es un grupo solidario mixto, conformado por 2 mujeres y 2 hombres todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 12 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería, también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

JORGE LUIS: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es un señor jovial de 37 años, soltero. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos se dedica a la venta de fritos, frijoles cosidos, chiverías. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de frito: filipitas, repollo, tomate, pollo aceite, entre otros productos.Él sueña con tener suficiente capital para vender productos y artículos de plástico.
texts.en:
AWASKIRA is a mixed solidarity group made up of two women and two men, all very enterprising, who got together 12 months ago for the purpose of obtaining funds to improve their small businesses, by increasing their goods and their income, so that they can cover basic household needs, ensure their children's education and expand their businesses. 

Jorge Luis is a member of the solidarity group and a cheerful, single 37-year-old man. In order to have his own source of income he sells deep fried snacks, cooked beans and dairy products. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy the ingredients to make deep fried snacks: plantain, cabbage, tomato, chicken, oil, among other products. 

He dreams of having enough capital to sell plastic products and items.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making deep fried snacks: plantain, cabbage, tomato, chicken, oil, among other products

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer de 40 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de herramientas.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por su feria al aire libre donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un camión.
Susana es morena, de cabello negro largo y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su madre y sus hermanos que se dedican al comercio, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de herramientas como, destornilladores, llaves, martillos, cajas y otras, actividad que inició con ayuda de su madre hace una década, “los jueves y domingos vendo en la feria, los demás días busco áreas comerciales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que con la ayuda de sus familiares pudo obtener un pequeño capital de trabajo, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería y la demanda de algunas marcas. Su mayor reto es transportarse a diario con su mercadería porque pesa bastante y es de gran volumen. Su sueño es ser una vendedora mayorista, ella desea comprar herramientas para arreglar coches. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Susana solicita un préstamo para comprar herramientas especializadas para arreglar coches.
texts.en:
Susana is a 40-year-old woman, single, and childless. Her business is selling tools. She is independent, enterprising, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the July 16 area, characterized by its outdoor fair where you can find everything from a needle to a truck.

Susana is dark-skinned, long and black-haired, and of medium physique. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her mother and her siblings who work in trade. They live in a house, a family property, built of brick which has potable water, electricity, and sewerage.

Her business is the street selling of tools like screwdrivers, wrenches, hammers, boxes, and others, an occupation that she began with the help of her mother a decade ago. "On Thursdays and Sundays I sell at the fair; the other days I look for commercial areas...", she says. Her business's advantage is that with the help of her family, she could get a small working capital; the disadvantage is the lack of goods and the demand for some brands. Her biggest challenge is moving daily with her merchandise because it's quite heavy and bulky.

Susana's dream is to be a wholesale vendor. She wants to buy tools to fix cars. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in 10 years of carrying out this occupation. It's for those reasons that Susana is requesting a loan to buy tools specialized to fix cars.

loans.use: to buy tools specialized to fix cars.

loans.name: Agricula

texts.en: Agricula is a farmer from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is 51 years old and relies on raising hogs and farming rice for a living. To support her three children, she works hard on the farm and in keeping her animals healthy. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. Agricula will then be assured of a better business, with fattened hogs and an increased crop yield. With additional capital, Agricula is hopeful that she can sustain the school needs of her children, aged 9, 13 and 15 years. Her income will provide a healthy meal for her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 47-year-old married woman. 
She has been doing embroidery work on a machine at home to support her family. She has become an expert in embroidery with the machine but a few days ago her machine became out-of-order from continuously working. Now she wants to buy new embroidery machine to continue her business.
Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she can stitch more embroidery dresses to sell and can grow her income. 
She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide her family good clothes and education. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Rehana thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine to continue her stitching embroidery business.

loans.name: Noriko

texts.en:
Noriko is single and wants to help her parents with their living by financing their banana farm and is now selling variety of grocery goods in her retail store to earn more for a living. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for her banana farm.

To have more inventory goods for sale, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She had to sustain her business by making possible taking good relations to her costumers for she had many competitors in the village.

She had make her plans in investing business aside from their farm to make more income for a better future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Danilo Andrés

texts.es: Danilo es un microempresario que administra un taller de calzado familiar que inició hace ocho años cuando su padre un vendedor de materiales para elaborar calzado, tuvo un cliente que no pudo pagarle en efectivo por su situación de iliquidez y le canceló con varias máquinas para elaborar calzado para damas.  Comenzaron elaborando calzado femenino de muy mala calidad por el desconocimiento en este arte y como de las malas experiencias queda un aprendizaje, optaron por buscar asesoría y capacitación y posteriormente se dedicaron a fabricar exclusivamente calzado masculino.  En la actualidad tienen 13 empleados y distribuyen sus productos a almacenes de calzado en Barranquilla, Bucaramanga y Bogotá.  Danilo desea adquirir una máquina troqueladora de cueros con la que podrá duplicar su producción, responder más ágilmente a las solicitudes de sus clientes  y a los nuevos diseños de la moda, para ello aplicó una solicitud de credikiva, oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y realizar su proyecto. A futuro Danilo desea que su marca de calzado sea reconocida a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Danilo is a small business owner who runs a family shoe shop. He started eight years ago when his father, a seller of shoe making equipment, had a client who could not pay him due to a cash flow problem and he cancelled an order of several machines for producing ladies footwear.

They began manufacturing women's shoes but they were poor quality due to a lack of knowledge about the art. Through these bad experiences they learned a lesson and they chose to seek advice and training and subsequently they earned a living exclusively from manufacturing men's shoes. Currently they have 13 employees and distribute their products to shoe stores in Barranquilla, Bucaramanga and Bogota.

Danilo wants to buy a leather punch machine with which he will be able double production, respond faster to customer requests and new fashion designs. He applied for a Kiva loan which is an opportunity to get finance through Fundación Mario Santa Domingo and to complete his project. In the future Danilo wants his shoe brand to be known at a national level.

loans.use: to buy a leather punch machine.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is a 47 years old woman, mother of five children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession.

Azmat's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits right now.
Therefore Azmat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. That way she can help her husband to purchase the above items.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon is 59 years old now.

Corazon has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional monitor, mouse, etc., for her business.

Corazon has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional monitor and mouse for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 19 years old and lives with her parents and two younger brothers in their Beirut apartment. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother is unemployed which gives her time to focus on providing healthy living conditions at home.
Fatima started working last year right after she graduated from school. Her business is home-based and she sells all types of beauty products to her clients with the support of her mother. So far, her business has been doing well, as Fatima always tries to provide a wide selection of products to her clients in order to satisfy their needs.

Fatima's plan in to start increasing her sales and hopefully open her own store in the long term. That is why she needs to buy large quantities of beauty products in order to sell them. Increasing her supplies will allow her to boost her revenue from sales. She will therefore be able to start saving part of it for her future shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and sell them

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is 45 years old and is a responsible mother of three children living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband is a hawker by profession and sells all kinds of hair oils by bicycle. He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil etc. He calls in the streets loudly to the consumers to offer all these hair oils. He is famous for oil protecting hair from falling out. He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome the poverty. Therefore, Ruqia requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more hair oil. Ruqia is very impressed with this honorable support. Ruqia thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hair oils such as coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil and safflower oil for her husband's oil selling business.

loans.name: Parmi

texts.en:
Parmi is a 41-year-old with one son and daughter. She has been selling vegetables and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Parmi will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: New Jerusalem Mukalala Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Colleta; a group member of New Jerusalem Mukalala. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. She is fifty six years old, married with four children.

Colleta sells cereals in the nearby market and also does poultry farming in her farm. She has been in this business for the last twenty years. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chickens to boost poultry farming for an increased income. She intends to use the increased profits to expand her cereals business, provide here family with better food and pay school fees for her grandchildren.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and quality chicken feeds to boost her poultry farming income.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta successfully repaid her loan, having used it for the intended purpose. She is very grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Norberta currently has a farm and she grows banana and other crops in her farm in order to earn a living.

Norberta applied for a loan to buy organic fertilizer for her farm improvements. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in expanding her farm and improving it, to earn better income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her farm improvements

loans.name: Molika

texts.en:
Molika is a 19-year-old single freshman, and he is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. His father is a taxi driver and his mother a homemaker. Molika is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Business Management at the university in the city.

Currently, he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year, so he has decided to take a loan. With the loan, he will be able to graduate and earn skills for his future job. For his future dreams, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary and therefore he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: cover his university fees in Business Management from the first to the fourth year. His father is a taxi driver.

loans.name: Abrar

texts.en: Abrar is a single lady living in Irbid. She is a university student, majoring in Computer Technology. She chose this major because ‎she believe that it will be easy to find good work in this field. Her father is working with low income and her mother is housewife ‎and the financial situation for her family is not enough to cover her semester fees. Therefore she requested an educational ‎loan to help her pay for the university fees and complete her education.‎

loans.use: pay for her university fees in Computer Technology and complete her education.‎.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva borrower, Jonathan would like to thank the lenders for their support. Because of Kiva, Jonathan was able to raise capital and serve his customers who need to send and receive larger amounts of money. Today 37-year-old Jonathan is requesting his second Kiva loan in order to grow his business by opening a new mobile money transfer outlet and employing two people.

Since his last loan, Jonathan says his wife and two children are doing well. He is making a little more profit due to his ability to serve additional customers. Jonathan enjoys running his own business because he is able to give back to his community by creating employment opportunities. He also enjoys running a viable, trustworthy business in a country where a lot of people are unbanked. His business saves the community money by lowering their expenses as they do not need to travel long distances to access financial services.

With this loan, Jonathan will be able to purchase a trading kiosk and have the money needed to serve customers at the new location he intends to open. Jonathan’s dream is to keep growing his business so that providing for his young family can become easier.

loans.use: to open a new mobile money transfer outlet and employ two people.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is aged 42 and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to meet these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables.

Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Rubina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh vegetables for her husband's business so that he can offer additional inventories on a daily basis.

loans.name: Safiyanu

texts.en:
Safiyanu is a maize farmer from Baure A village. As a Babban Gona member, Safiyanu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Safiyanu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Safiyanu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Safiyanu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Safiyanu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo, 45, is a farmer in Prey Veng province. She is married and has five children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been running businesses of growing rice and working as a carpenter for years. This family's daily income is about USD 14 per day; she can save about USD 7 each day for future needs.

She decided to form a group that consists of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and fuels for a water pumping machine, and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to harvest abundant rice yields to buy school supplies and to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve crop yields.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Yurielka Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres sonrientes (Jhondra, Reyna y Maura Gloria) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 2 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos y cosméticos de belleza y pulpería, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

REYNA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre,  luchadora, tiene 30 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, vende de manera ambulante accesorios y prendas de acero. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: cadenas, aretes, dijes, brazaletes, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener suficiente capital para vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 smiling women (Jhondra, Reyna, and Maura Gloria) from the city of Bilwi, the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They joined together 2 months ago to access financing through a loan to continue growing their small business selling jewelry products and beauty products and a grocery store, to increase their income and be ale to cover the basic needs of their households, ensure their children's education and improve their houses.

REYNA: She is the coordinator of the solidarity group, a happy woman and determined. She is 30 years old, the single mother of 2 adolescents who are in primary school. With the goal of having her own source of income and get her children ahead, she sells accessories and steel items as a street vendor. She is asking for the loan to purchase, in Managua, necklace chains, earrings, pendants, bracelets, and other products. She dreams of having enough capital to sell used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase, in Managua, necklace chains, earrings, pendants, bracelets, and other products.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in the rural town of Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. She raises hogs to earn a living. She has been raising hogs for a long time, catering to locals in her town. She has ten children, two of them are already married and the other eight are single.

Carmelina needs the loan to buy feed for her pigs to make some profits. She faces one major challenge in her business - the liquidity of capital to expand her business for a period of time, until the livestock is ready to be sold. 

Then her income will augment and she could set aside half of the profit for expansion while the other half is to be kept for emergency use.
