She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now Carmelina continues to build her business to become more sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bombom Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas (Miriam Dalia, Alicia y Lobertina). Son mujeres emprendedoras que tienen núcleo familiar, que las motiva luchar para mejorar sus ingresos y hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de bastimento y frito. 

MIRIAM DALIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente y luchadora de 29 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, vende comida en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, recuerda con gran entusiasmo que inicio con sus ahorros con C$ 4,000. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaboración de comidas: pollo, carne de cerdo, de res, repollo, vinagre, aceite, arroz, tomate, limones, chiltoma, pepino, sal, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulperia.
texts.en:
It is made up of 3 happy women of Miskita ethnicity from Bilwi, the municipality of Puerto Cabezas (Miriam Dalia, Alicia and Lobertina). They are enterprising women who have nuclear families, which motivates them to struggle to improve their income and grow their small businesses selling supplies and fried foods.

MIRIAM DALIA: She is the coordinator of the solidarity group, a smiling and determined woman, 29 years old, the single mother of 3 adolescent children who are in primary school. With the goal of getting her family ahead, she sells food at a space she rents in one of the markets in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She remembers enthusiastically that she began with her savings of
C$ 4,000. She is asking for a loan to purchase supplies and ingredients to make food: chicken, pork, beef, cabbage, vinegar, oil, rice, tomatoes, lemons, bell peppers, cucumber, salt and other products. She dreams of establishing a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to make fried foods.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 43-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, and her husband is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Shehnaz's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable Shehnaz's husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy recyclable goods in bulk for her husband's recycling business.

loans.name: Isla Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por un varón y 2 mujeres luchadoras (José Roberto, Prudencia y Erika Roxana). Se organizaron hace 12 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa, calzado y frito, mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

ERIKA ROXANA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es un joven de 27 años de edad, luchadora, con deseos de superación, madre soltera de 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, elabora refrescos naturales en su vivienda de tambo y madera y vende de madera ambulante prendas y accesorios de acero. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de refrescos: azúcar, frutas, bolsas plásticas y en Managua aretes, brazaletes, cadenas, pulseras, dijes, para venderlos a precios accesibles a su cliente de Bilwi. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This is a mixed solidarity group, made up of one man and 2 determined women (José Roberto, Prudencia and Erika Roxana). They organized themselves 12 months ago, with the goal of accessing financing for their small businesses selling clothing, shoes and fried foods, to increase their incomes and improve their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic needs of their households, ensure their children's education and expand their businesses.

ERIKA ROXANA: This member of the solidarity group is a 27-year-old young woman, determined and with desire to improve herself. She is the single mother of 2 children who are minors. With the goal of getting her family ahead, she makes natural soft drinks in her wooden house on stilts and, as a street vendor, sells clothing and steel accessories. She is asking for financing to purchase ingredients to make her soft drinks: sugar, fruit, and plastic bags, and, in Managua, to purchase earrings, bracelets, necklace chains, and pendants, to sell at accessible prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of establishing a store selling new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, fruit, and plastic bags and, in Managua, earrings, bracelets, necklace chains, and pendants.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 36, is a married woman with five grown children, residing in Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been a Khmer traditional singer since 2011. Her husband is a 38-year-old construction worker who also fattens animals. Three of her children attend school. Samnang and her husband can earn approximately $14 a day.

Now Samnang would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle with a machine for selling sugar cane juice in the nearby neighborhoods. This loan will help her family have an additional business to improve the family’s finances.

In the future, she is going to buy lumber to renovate her house and support her children in finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with a machine for selling sugar cane juice in the nearby neighborhoods.

loans.name: Hout's Group

texts.en:
Hout works as a seller and also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. She is a member of a loan group from a rural village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. In Hout’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Hout is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of the women in this group loan safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov makes a living as a rice farmer and also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. She is a member of a loan group from a rural village in the Prey Ven province in Cambodia. In Pov’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Pov is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of the people in this group loan safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un hombre es casado tiene 67 años de edad. Cada mes recibe una pensión, aparte de esto es velador en unas bodegas cercanas a su hogar, su trabajo solo es supervisar esas bodegas por las noches. Padece de cataratas en su ojo derecho, por lo que no puede ver bien. Anteriormente también fue operado de su ojo izquierdo del mismo padecimiento.
Recibió apoyo por parte de su familia con la mitad de costo de la cirugía, sin embargo el resto le es difícil reunir ya que sus recursos son escasos. De no operarse corre el riesgo perder su trabajo.
texts.en:
He is 67 years old and married. He receives a pension every month. Aside from this, he is a watchman at some stores close to his home. His work is only watching over these stores at night.

He suffers from cataracts in his right eye. Therefore, he is not able to see well. He previously had an operation on the left eye for the same ailment. He received help for part of it from his family with half of the cost of the surgery. Nevertheless, the rest is difficult for him to get together because his resources are scarce. Not having the operation runs the risk of losing his job.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Marening

texts.en:
Marening is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Marening works hard to provide for her family.

Marening is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en:
Chrep makes a living as a rice farmer to support her family. She is a member of a loan group from a rural village in the Prey Ven province in Cambodia. In Chrep’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Chrep is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of the people in this loan group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Eoun's Group

texts.en:
Eoun makes a living as a rice farmer to support her family. She has one child and is a member of a loan group from a rural village in the Prey Ven province in Cambodia. In Eoun’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Eoun is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of the women in this loan group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en:
Savern’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.

Savern makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help her (and her other group members) to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn, 31, is a woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emelyn has a shellscraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Emelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies to use in her business. In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Earn's Group

texts.en:
Earn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.

Earn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one child in her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Earn and her other group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: York's Group

texts.en:
York’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. York makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help York and her other group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORITA QUE REQUIERE DE UNA ENDODONCIA URGENTE Y UNA APLICACIÓN DE FRENOS DENTALES, YA QUE DESDE PEQUEÑA SUS DIENTES ESTÁN EMPALMADOS Y SUS PADRES NUNCA LE DIERON ATENCIÓN, ACTUALMENTE SU DENTADURA LE PROVOCA VERGUENZA YA QUE SU TRABAJO ESTA RELACIONADO CON ATENCIÓN AL PÚBLICO.
texts.en: She is a lady who urgently needs endodontic treatment and braces.  Ever since she was little her teeth have overlapped.  Her parents never got her care.  Her teeth now cause her to be embarrassed because her work has to do with serving the public.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer, construction worker and teacher to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having water filters at home will help Sern and her other group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 51 years old now.

Myrna has a room rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her business, such as paints, etc.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her business, such as paints, etc.

loans.name: Saikal

texts.en:
Saikal is 18 years old and a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. She is from the Talas region of Kyrgyzstan and came to Bishkek to get higher education.

She lives with her big family in a small village. Her family members are her parents, her elder brother with his wife and two sons, her elder sister and herself.

Like many villagers, Saikal’s parents are farmers. They have a cow to milk and a horse for farming. It is evident that the village life is always hard and it gets harder when there are more members of family, especially little children, who need diapers, vitamins, etc. What the family grows, they eat, and if any is left, they try to sell it and earn money.

Saikal's elder sister is also a university student, but she studies in Talas, as it is hard even to support Saikal’s study in the capital. Her elder brother is unemployed due to his lack of higher education, so he lives with his family in his parents’ house.

The family understands the necessity of the education, so now they are trying to give it to Saikal and her elder sister. Saikal already got some financial aid from AUCA, but still her family faces financial difficulties to pay the rest of tuition. She believes that AUCA can not only build her a strong foundation but also show her ways to success, point out opportunities, and teach her how to set and obtain goals in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven  es soltero tiene 23 años de edad, actualmente realiza su servicio social en una empresa de ingeniería, por lo que ya esta por recibirse. Fue diagnosticado con ametropía desde los nueve años. Siempre ha estado en un tratamiento constante  para corregir su visión, el ya esta cansado de los lentes contactos y de continuas infecciones. El necesita que le realicen una cirugía para poder corregir su padecimiento, sin embargo de momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes.
texts.en:
He is 23 years old and single. He currently does social work at an engineering business, and he is about to graduate.

He was diagnosed with refractive error when he was nine years old. It has always been a constant treatment to correct his vision. He is now tired of contact lenses and the continual infections.

He needs to have surgery in order to be able to correct his condition. However, he does not now have enough resources.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Thorch's Group

texts.en:
Thorch’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Thorch works as factory laborer and he also does extra work as iron maker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Thorch and each of his group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, age 53, is married. Residing in Prey Veng province, she and her husband are farmers, growing rice and cucumber to make a living. Harvesting lower-than-expected outputs and a drop in rice prices are challenges to their farming business.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund for a loan cycle already and she has renovated her house and covered all expenses in her family.

Now she leads two members to request loans. She will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and fuel for the water pumping machine and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to renovate her house to be much better.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve her farmland.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en:
Samath’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having water filters at home will help Samath and each of her group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Nary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having water filters at home will help Nary and each of her group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Caramelo Group

texts.es:
Esta integrado por 4 mujeres (Luisa Amanda, Celsi, Erlinda y Lexia Marisela) que pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron desde hace 08 meses, con el objetivo de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria, para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de repostería, pulperia, venta de ropa y calzado, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

CELSI: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven de 25 años de edad, amable con deseos de superación, casada con un hijo de 8 años que cursa su tercer grado de educación primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como soldador. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hijo elabora de manera artesanal repostería en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes: Harina, levadura, coco, azúcar, canela, mantequilla, queso, huevo, soda, entre otros productos,  para elaborar pan de coco, empanadas, queque de yuca, de arroz, de quequisque que los vende manera ambulante. Ella sueña con tener un local con vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 4 women (Luisa Amanda, Celsi, Erlinda and Lexia Marisela) who are of Miskito ethnicity and from the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They formed 8 months ago, with the aim of accessing finance with mutual responsibility, in order to stock up their small businesses in baking, groceries, selling clothes and shoes and to improve their living conditions.

Celsi is a member of the solidarity group, 25 years old, friendly and has the desire to succeed. She is married and has an 8 year old son who is in third grade and her husband works informally as a welder. In order to contribute to household expenses and the education of her child she makes traditional pastries in her wooden stilt house.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients: flour, yeast, coconut, sugar, cinnamon, butter, cheese, eggs, soda and other products. This is to make coconut bread, empanadas as well as yuca, rice and taro cakes which she sells as a street vendor. She dreams of having a store with a display window where they can showcase her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients: flour, yeast, coconut, sugar, cinnamon, butter, cheese, eggs, soda and other products.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married. She has four children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anable

texts.en:
Anable is a single mother to a 16-year-old son from the town of Jagna, Bohol. To provide for him, she sell items like Pangyawan liniment and supplements in capsules. She also sells MX3 products, a food supplement from mangosteen fruit.

Anable earns customers from her business and would like to improve it. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of Pangyawan liniment and supplements in capsules. Through the loan, she can buy more stock and deliver more orders to her customers. Her profit will be used to sustain the needs of her son in school.

loans.use: to buy pangyawan liniment and supplements in capsules.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en:
Lang’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Lang makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Lydia has been in this business for 13 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to  purchase an additional bundle of fishng net.

loans.name: Tierra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Marjori Jomary, Alina y Esmeralda) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada y bastimento; se organizaron como grupo solidario recientemente para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

MARJORI JOMARY: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, de 31 años de edad, es casada. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como ayudante en un tramo del mercado. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: paca mixta para hombres y mujeres.  Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (Marjori Jomary, Alina, and Esmeralda) of the Meskito ethnicity in the city of Bilwi, the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who work daily with the determination to achieve the growth of their small businesses selling used clothing and supplies. They recently formed this solidarity group in order to receive a loan from Pana Pana.

Marjori Jomary, a kind woman of 31 years of age, is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is married. Her husband works informally, as an assistant in a market stall. She works selling used clothes in a stall that she rents in the municipal market. In this way, she generates her own income and contributes to home expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy a mixed surplus stock of men and women's clothing in Managua. She hopes to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy mixed surplus stock of men and women's clothing.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en:
Saly’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Saly makes a living cultivating rice, raising ducks and finding fishes.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en:
Im’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Im makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Sreypov’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sreypov makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessebel is 38 years old now.

Jessebel has a shells craft business in the Philippines. Jessebel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, etc., for her business.

Jessebel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jessebel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
In the frontier village Getahovit of Tavush region lives Marusya with her husband. For 25 years with her beloved husband, she is engaged in farming. She has cows, pigs and piglets. With her husband’s help she sells a lot of pork from her farm also milk and cheese which she makes herself. Marusya also has vegetable garden where she cultivates beans, greens and also potato. She sells all these at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Marusya has two sons and also a lot of grandchildren, who very often visit their grandparents and help about the farm, with cattle care and also in land cultivation.

Marusya mentions that she feels great happiness and admires when all her sons with their families come and help them with harvesting works ; as she likes to says in that case the harvest seems to her sweeter and nicer, which she divides to several parts and gives of it to all of them. Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Marusya asks as she must buy a lot of fodder for her cows and pigs so that it will be enough till the end of cold winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her cows and pigs so that it will be enough for winter.

loans.name: Sombra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 1 mujer y 2 hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos. 

NICOLAS: Es un joven sonriente de 26 años de edad, con deseos superación, originario de Puerto Cabezas, soltero. Con el propósito de apoyar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hermanos, solicita su primer financiamiento para incrementar el inventario de su pequeña pulpería, comprar: Granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construirle a su familia una vivienda de cemento  para que vivan de manera más segura.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 1 woman and 2 men, all very entrepreneurial, who recently organized, with the purpose of accessing financing to improve their small businesses, increasing their merchandize and in that way being able to increase their incomes as well which allows them to cover the basic needs of their home and secure the education of their children.

NICOLAS: Is a cheerful young man, 26 years old, with dreams of self-improvement, originally from Puerto Cabezas, single. With the purpose of supporting his mother with the household expenses and his siblings' expenses, he requests his first loan to increase the inventory of his small grocery store, to buy: basic grains, instant soups, bread, eggs, among other products. His dream is to have a prosperous business and to build his family a cement home so they can live in a safer manner.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Heing's Group

texts.en:
Heing’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Heing makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Vert's Group

texts.en:
Vert’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vert makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a farmer and electronics maker to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Muryanti

texts.en:
Muryanti is a 43-year-old with one son and two daughters. She is a housewife and her husband is an employee for thirty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Muryanti will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilret at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Satya

texts.en:
Satya, 18, a single student at a university in the city. He is from Takeo Province of Cambodia. His father is a teacher and his mother earns an income from selling vegetable.

Due to a lack of finances, Satya would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees in Accountancy for two year. This loan will help him graduate and achieve his dreams. In the future, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees in Accountancy for two years.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is married with five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and her youngest is 11. Cecil’s husband is a fisherman and she lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various commodities such as bread, coffee, sugar, condiments, powdered milk, soft drinks, toothpaste, candies, and toiletries. Cecil faces challenges in maintaining her livelihood and needs additional capital to expand her store and purchase a variety of stock. She used a previous loan to stock her shop.

Cecil is requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of assorted goods, condiments, and soft drinks. Her loan will help her cater to the needs of her family and slowly augment her daily income.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods, condiments, and soft drinks

loans.name: Sokum's Group

texts.en:
Sokum makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. She is a member of a loan group from a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. In Sokum’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Sokum is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of the women in this loan group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Nhaet's Group

texts.en:
Nhaet’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Nhaet does works as a fisherwoman to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Joan Lynn

texts.en:
Joan Lynn is 37 years old and married with two children. Joan Lynn works hard to provide for her family.

Joan Lynn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from food vending.

Joan Lynn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Joan Lynn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
The members of Ben’s Group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Ben makes a living cultivating rice, and he does extra work as a factory laborer and officer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 29-year-old lady who lives with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore city. Unfortunately, his rickshaw engine has become unusable and he needs to replace some important internal parts such as the ring and piston. These engine repairs are very costly. Saba’s husband wants to fix his engine as soon as possible but is still short financing for the repair cost. He is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without using rickshaw. 

Saba is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy needed internal parts for his rickshaw engine repair so it can again drive smoothly. She thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy parts for her husband's rickshaw engine so he can work and generate income for the family

loans.name: Marianetta

texts.en:
Marianetta is 55 years old and married with two children. Marianetta works very hard to provide for them.

Marianetta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marianetta has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as dry goods, etc.

In the future, Marianetta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokhorn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family. Mary Joy is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Tormenta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por cuatro mujeres (Rosa María, Sandra Deen, Martha y Sofia), todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, reposterías y pulpería; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

SOFIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, tiene 50  años de edad, es casada, tiene 5  hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos, venta de bastimentos y productos básicos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos: papas, plátanos, tomate, chiltoma, zanahoria, frijoles, mariscos, pescados, langosta, camarones, caracoles, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada, para mejorar su nivel de ingreso y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of four women (Rosa María, Sandra Deen, Martha and Sofia), all are part of the Miskito native american ethnic group in the city of Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who fight day by day to make their small businesses grow in sales of shellfish, pastries, and groceries; they formed as a solidarity group approximately 4 years ago, to process loans with the guarantee of solidarity from Pana Pana.

SOFIA: Is a member of the solidarity group, a friendly woman, 50 years old, married with 5 sons: 3 are adults and 2 are teenagers who are in high school. She makes a living selling shellfish, supplies and basic products, in this way she makes her own income and contributes to household expenses and her sons' studies. She is requesting a loan to buy more products: potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, sweet peppers, carrots, beans, shellfish, fish, lobster, shrimp, snails, among other products. She dreams of selling used clothing, to improve her income level and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products: potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, sweet peppers, carrots, beans, shellfish, fish, lobster, shrimp, snails, among other products.

loans.name: Saokorm's Group

texts.en:
Saokorm’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia.

Saokorm works as a factory labourer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save the time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yern's Group

texts.en:
Yern’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Yern works as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en:
Luneta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested a 70,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to make dried fish.

In the future, Luneta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Chak's Group

texts.en:
The members of Chak ’s Group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chak makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mein's Group

texts.en:
The members of Mein’s Group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mein makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec un enfant à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Abla vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Abla s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates en boîtes et le bidon d’huile, Abla sollicite ce crédit pour financer son achat et pouvoir bien revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir au mieux les besoins de son enfant.
texts.en: 51 years of age, Abla is a married woman and mother of one living in Baguida. To help support herself, Abla makes a living selling basic food goods. Abla purchases her supplies from a market three times a month. Abla is requesting a loan so that she can buy rice bags, cartons of canned tomatoes and a can of oil, which she will resell in order to make a profit and provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of rice, 5 cartons of canned tomatoes and one can of oil.

loans.name: Bunthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Bunthoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Earn's Group

texts.en:
Earn’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Earn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vanthol's Group

texts.en:
Vanthol’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Vanthol makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Muna is 45 years old and lives in Zarqa. She is a caring mother of four children, who she loves them with all her heart. Since ‎those children were born, she has done nothing but strive to offer them a decent life, so they will have everything they ‎need.‎

She is making and selling traditional embroidered clothing. She wants to request a loan to buy a new sewing machine to make more clothes and embroidered ‎table`s cover to sell and thus to increase her income and to improve their standards of living.‎

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her traditional embroidery production.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 28 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child, still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family to help them to live in good conditions. Today, given that her child will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register him at school. The parents’ only target is to provide him with a good educational path until graduation and help him become able to get good jobs that will give him a good income.

loans.use: to register her child at school

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
This is Gjyste, a villager in the northern rural Albania, who needs your financial help to buy a dairy cow, since the one she had was sold, due to being old and non productive. During these past ten years, she's been doing agriculture/livestock to earn a living, in addition to some $108 monthly pay of her husband, who works as a night guard. Her younger son who lives still with them works as a waiter for a monthly pay of $155.

Gjyste sells a homemade alcohol drink 'raki' and makes roughly $300 a year and also sells pears for $155 a year and also a calf a year at a price of $450.

In the 14 dynym agricultural land her family owns, she has pear orchards, olive groves and grapevines. She also has two pigs at the moment.

loans.use: to replace a dairy cow with a young and productive one.

loans.name: Fritang Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario FRITANG, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Aimojean, Sara y Miriam Esperanza), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace año y medio, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de venta de chiverias, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

SARA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer cordial, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 9 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad y 5 son adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Se dedica a la venta de manera ambulante de chiverias, gracias al crédito otorgado anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido crecer en su negocio, actualmente vende ropa usada, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: paca mixta para hombres y mujeres, ropa interior.  Sueña con tener su propio tramo y vender ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The FRITANGA solidarity group is made up of 3 female entrepreneurs (Aimojean, Sara y Miriam Esperanza) who live in the city of Bilwi. They united 1.5 years ago with the goal of working in solidarity to have access to Pana Pana loans, which would allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses which sell snacks, to improve their income and in that way improve little by little the life conditions of their families.

SARA: Is a member of the solidarity group, a polite woman, 49 years old, married with 9 children: 4 are adults and 5 are teenagers who study in primary and secondary school. She makes a living by traveling and selling snacks, thanks to the loan given earlier by PANA PANA and financed by KIVA, they permitted her to grow her business, currently selling used clothing, in this way she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and studies of her children. She is requesting financing to buy in Managua: a mixed package of clothing for men and women, undergarments. She dreams of having her own kiosk and selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy in Managua: a mixed package of clothing for men and women, undergarments.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 38 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Kossiwa est une marchande des céréales et des produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des sacs de maïs et des bols du haricot en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a  38 year old woman who lives in Baguida. She is married with two children, Kossiwa is a merchant who buys cereals and food products three times each month at the market and sells in front of her home. Kossiwa requests this loan to pay for her purchase of sacks of corn and bowls of beans so that she can make a profit and earn additional income to contribute more to paying the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of corn and 23 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Cuereil

texts.en:
Cuereil, a 41-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol, is into raising hogs. She keeps her pigs in a wooden barn. She also helps her husband in his business of being a paint contractor.

She is asking for a loan to supply her pigs with feed and to buy more piglets and cans of paint. Her income will get healthy meals for her children and pay for their school fees.

In the future, she hopes to build a concrete piggery and to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, chips, etc. She has been in this business for 19 years now.

Mercedes successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres sonrientes, de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 12 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

MARIA ESTER: Es una mujer alegre, luchadora, tiene 35 años, madre soltera de 5 hijos: 3 son adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria y 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ha establecido una pequeña pulperia en su vivienda de tambo y madera.  Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar más mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverias y otros productos. Sueña con vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 cheerful women, from the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They came together 12 months ago to access financing through loans to go about growing their small businesses, to increase their income and be able to cover the basic needs of their homes, secure the education of their children, and improve their homes.

MARIA ESTER: Is a happy woman, determined, 35 years old, single mother of 5 children: 3 are teenagers who study in primary and secondary school and 2 are younger. With the goal of having her own source of income and taking care of her children, she established a small grocery store in her home on wooden stilts. She is requesting her first loan to buy more merchandise: basic grains, snacks, and other products. She dreams of selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise: basic grains, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Famille Edigard Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 7 ans que je fais le transport terrestre à travers des motocyclettes et actuellement j'en gère deux. C'est une expérience acquise de mes amies que je trouve rentable car je réalise trois cent dollars après déduction des charges d'exploitation : Telles sont les déclarations de Noella. Ayant commencé cette activité avec des motos d'occasion, elle tient à s'acheter une troisième moto neuve. Noëlla a une autre activité secondaire qui est la vente des articles divers. Sur photo, elle est à gauche et porte une blouse blanche.
texts.en: I have been running a land transport business with motorbikes for seven years and at present I manage two. I acquired the experience for running the business with my friends and it is profitable, as I make $300 after deducting of the running expenses: this is what Noella says about her business. She started the business with secondhand motorbikes, and she would very much like to buy a third new motorbike. Noëlla has another secondary business selling various articles. In the photo, she is on the left wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transport.

loans.name: Samak's Group

texts.en:
Samak’s group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province of Cambodia. Samak makes a living by cultivating rice and doing extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In Samak's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Regulo

texts.es:
Regulo con 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus menores hijos, en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Regulo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Regulo se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo cafeto, de la variedad Catimor,sembrando 1 hectárea de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio Pucalá del Distrito Pimpingos de Cutervo, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 16 años y hace 4 años en el cultivo de cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Regulo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
47-year old Regulo lives with his partner and their young children in the district of Pimpingos, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Peru. Regular has very good references, both personal and work, from the inhabitants of the area., the majority of whom earn their living in agriculture, business, or raising livestock.

Regulo is a farmer and grows Catimor coffee. He plants one hectare of coffee on his land which is located in the village of Pucalá on the district of Pimpingos de Cutervo. He has been a farmer for 16 years, and for four years growing coffee. Regular also raises and sells young animals as well as growing other crops.

He plans to use the loan money to care for his fields. Then he will have good production and earnings so that he will be able to improve his own and his famiky's standard of living.

Regular has had several loans with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: take care of his coffee plants

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Pucalá,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Marilú cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzo en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 02 años. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su casa. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como arroz,azúcar,leche,etc, para implementar su bodega. De esta manera le facilitará obtener mayores ingresos a su unidad familiar.

Marilú cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Marilú is 40 years old. She is in a common law marriage. She lives with her spouse and their three children in the district of Pucalá, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru. Marilú has very good personal and professional references from the area residents. The residents of this community mainly work in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

She makes and sells lunches from her house. She has more than 2 years' experience in this trade. In addition, she has a small store in her home. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, milk, sugar, etc. to stock her store. This will help her obtain more income for her family unit.

Marilú has a credit history and she is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar milk, etc.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Veuve, Amah est une femme âgée de 36 ans résidant à Tokoin. Amah vit avec ses trois enfants à charge. Amah est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Amah demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des douzaines de chaussures et des sandalettes en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Amah is a widow. She is a 36 year old woman who lives in Tokoin.  Amah lives with her three dependent children. Amah sells shoes that she buys twice each month at the market and sells from home and on an itinerant basis is the neighbouring districts. Amah requests this loan to buy dozens of pairs of shoes and sandals hoping to make better sales to earn a profit so that she can help her children to pay for their school fees and to pay some daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two dozen pairs of shoes and four dozen pairs of sandals.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 30 years old, and married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leny has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

In the future, Leny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern’s Group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province of Cambodia. Sern makes a living by cultivating rice and doing extra work as a factory laborer and driver to support her family.

In Sern's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak’s Group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province of Cambodia. Sreyleak makes a living by cultivating rice and doing extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In Sreyleak's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Akouyo est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin. Agée de 57 ans, Akouyo vit avec trois enfants à charge. Akouyo est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akouyo nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Akouyo is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. She is 57 years old and lives with her three dependant children. She retails charcoal and gets her supplies twice a month at the market, reselling them from her home.

Akouyo needs this loan to finance the order of sacks of charcoal, so she can sell them on at a higher price and make more profit. This will enable her to help her husband with the family expenses and provide for a better education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tuli No Mulangaliro Group

texts.fr: Setefano déclare que le précédent crédit a facilité le paiement de la main d'œuvre, l'achat des produits phytosanitaires,...A part la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants, l'alimentation et les soins médicaux, les résultats atteints l'ont permis également de prendre en location trois nouveaux champs qu'il exploitera au cours de cette saison. Le faible montant de crédit reçu précédemment par Setefano constitue pour lui le seul obstacle, il souhaite avoir un montant plus élevé afin d'arriver à une bonne productivité.
texts.en: Setefano reports that his previous loan facilitated the payment of labor and purchase of phytosanitary products. Apart from being able to pay for his children's schooling, food and healthcare, the results he achieved have also enabled him to rent three new fields which he will farm during the course of this season. The only real obstacle for Setefano was the low amount of the loan he received, and he would like to borrow a more significant amount in order to achieve a good level of productivity.

loans.use: to pay for labor, the purchase of phytosanitary products and harrowing.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally’s Group members live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Phally makes a living by cultivating rice and doing extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family.

In Phally's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
