Seioun’s Group members live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Seioun does work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In Seloun's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Small Business Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy is 29 years old, and she is married with two children. She has had a retail business of selling metals for five years.

Thúy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a gas stove to resell.

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Small Business Group, which consists of three members.

Along with her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove to resell.

location.town: Phú hòa, Hưng lộc Hậu Lộc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 39 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Jocelyn has an egg vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Sreng's Group

texts.en:
Sreng’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreng makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Bopha does work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean vous remercie beaucoup de tout son cœur pour le crédit. Avec lequel, il a pu augmenter les quantités des marchandises et honorer les commandes. Grâce à vous, il est très motivé à continuer à lutter et à avancer. Il vient d'acheter de la rizière avec l'épargne qu'il a pu constituer. C'est pourquoi, il renouvelle sa demande de crédit pour continuer à développer l'activité. Et il espère que vous allez encore l'aider. L'activité est toujours pratiquée par le couple: Jean assure l'approvisionnement et la livraison en province et sa femme tient le point de vente. Il projette d'acheter un terrain et construire une maison un peu plus tard.
texts.en: Jean sends his heartfelt thanks for the loan. With this loan he has been able to increase the quantity of merchandise he buys and fulfill his orders. Thanks to you, he is very motivated to continue the struggle and move forward. He has just purchased a paddy field with the savings that he put together. That is why he requests a new loan to continue to develop his business. He hopes that you will help him once again. He and his wife continue to run the business together: Jean manages the stocks, supplies and deliveries in the countryside, and his wife runs the shop. Later, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jugs and barrels for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (María Teresa, Sthefannie Margiene y Amelia Beatriz) que se integraron hace aproximadamente año y medio, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de pulpería, bisutería y ropa usada respectivamente, y de esa manera poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

MARIA TERESA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial de 54 años de edad, con deseos de superación de superación y cualidades de líder, casada con 5 hijos: 4 mayores de edad y el menor de 15 años estudia su primer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, vende ropa nueva en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Recuerda con gran alegría que inicio vendiendo agua en bolsitas de manera ambulante y gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido crecer en su negocio y poco a poco mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua ropa nueva: camisa, pantalones, ropa interior para hombres y mujeres. Ella sueña en ser vendedora mayorista de ropa usada.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 determined women (María Teresa, Stefanie Margiene and Amelia Beatriz) who joined together approximately a year and a half ago to process financing through loans with the guarantee of solidarity, to buy merchandise for their small businesses which are a grocery store, a jewelry shop, and used clothing respectively, and in that way be able to sell more and increase their incomes. They all want to be able to improve their life conditions to be able to cover their basic needs, to secure the education of their children, and to improve their homes.

MARIA TERESA: The coordinator of the solidarity group, she is a happy 54-year-old woman with dreams of self-improvement and leadership qualities, married with 5 children: 4 adults and a 15-year-old who is in his first year of high school. With the goal of having her own source of income and contributing to the household expenses and education of her children, she sells new clothing in a kiosk that she has in one of the markets of the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She remembers with great happiness that she started traveling and selling water in little bags and thanks to the loans given by PANA PANA and financed by KIVA, she has been able to grow in her business little by little to improve the conditions of her family. She is requesting financing to buy new clothing in Managua: shirts, pants, undergarments for men and women. She dreams of being a wholesale vendor of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy new clothing in Managua: shirts, pants, undergarments for men and women.

loans.name: Samnag's Group

texts.en:
Samnag’s Group members live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Samnag sells clothes and cakes and also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In Samnag's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Al llegar a cierta comunidad de Veracruz sobre sus caminos de terracería se puede sentir el cambio de clima y respirar aire limpio; el ruido de los autos es remplazado por el canto de las aves y los colores pareces tener más vida.  Dicha comunidad  recibe el patrocinio de Word Vision con el objetivo de brindar mayores oportunidades a los niños.
   Allí se integró un grupo llamado Las Estrellas ya que, por las noches, el cielo estrellado le recuerda a los integrantes que a pesar de cualquier situación siempre deben recordar brillar intensamente. Ellos son: Eleazar quien invertirá en ropa y comida; Yolanda y Lorani, abarrotes; Teresa A., maíz y frijol; Laura, comida típica; Yadira, pollo; Teresa R., tamales y repostería; Juana, verduras; Aurelia, maíz y tortillas; Natividad, zapatos y Armando, tamales.
   Doña Teresa R., es una persona muy amigable y todos quienes la conocen la llaman Tere de forma amistosa. Su familia está integrada por su esposo Federico y sus tres hijos de los cuales, uno cuenta con el patrocinio de Word Vision y actualmente cursa la educación preparatoria. 
   Mientras su esposo se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol, yuca y camote, Tere se ha dedicado desde hace más de doce años a la elaboración y venta de tamales cuya preparación varía según el gusto de los clientes. Hoy en día vende un promedio de doscientos a doscientos cincuenta piezas cada fin de semana entre tamales rancheros, huecos o “chancletas”, éstas últimas son su especialidad. 
   “El estudio es la mejor herencia que les podemos dejar a nuestros hijos” expresó, por tal motivo las ganancias obtenidas están encaminadas a brindar sustento en la carrera profesional de su hijo. En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en la compra de carne, manteca, chile seco, bolsas para hielos, agua y leche, ya que para satisfacer a sus clientes siempre adquiere productos de primera calidad. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Tere quien viste blusa blanca y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Upon arriving at a certain Veracruz community on its dirt roads, you can feel the change in climate and breathe the clean air. The sound of cars is replaced by bird song, and colors look more alive. This community receives sponsorship from Word Vision so that they can offer better opportunities to the children.

A group was formed called Las Estrellas [The Stars]. It has that name because at night the starry sky reminds the members that despite any situation, they must always remember to shine intensely. They are: Eleazar, who will invest in clothes and food; Yolanda and Lorani, groceries; Teresa A.,corn and beans; Laura, traditional food; Yadira, chicken; Teresa R., tamales and pastries; Juana, vegetables; Aurelia, corn and tortillas; Natividad, shoes, and Armando, tamales.

Teresa R., is a very friendly person and everyone who knows her calls her Tere, in a friendly way. Her family is made up of her husband Federico and their three children. One of them is sponsored by Word Vision and is now in high school.

While her husband works growing sugar cane, corn, beans, yucca and sweet potatoes. For more than twelve years, Tere has worked making and selling tamales. The preparation varies according to the tastes of her customers. Today she sells an average of two hundred to two hundred and fifty units a weekend between tamales rancheros, huecos or “chancletas”. The latter are her specialty.

“An education is the best inheritance we can leave our children” she said. For that reason, the profits she obtains will be used to support her son's professional education. At this time, she will invest the loan in buying meat, lard, dried chiles, bags for ice, water and milk, because to satisfy her customers, she always gets top quality products.

*The photograph was taken in Tere's patio. She is wearing a white blouse and black pants.

loans.use: to buy meat, lard, dried chiles and bags.

loans.name: Seimorn's Group

texts.en: Seimorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seimorn does work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en: Sophorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophorn works as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Buthan

texts.en:
Buthan is a 24-year-old civil servant who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. He is also pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Economics, in his fourth year at university in the city. As a young civil servant, earning around USD 4 per day.

Now he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees for the fourth year, so he would like to take out a loan. With this is loan he will be able to graduate successfully and achieve his dreams. In the future, Buthan is going to find a better job, build a new proper house for his parents.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for the fourth year in Economics

loans.name: Las Chelas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Veracruz la famosa locomotora llamada “La bestia” recorre 3 veces al día trasportando generalmente azúcar o materiales especiales, todo dependiendo de la temporada del año. Los habitantes recuerdan que anteriormente dicho tren solía ser un medio de trasporte el cual eventualmente fue sustituido por el autobús.
   De esta comunidad es originario el grupo llamado Las Chelas, el nombre hace referencia al mote con el que es conocida la iniciadora del grupo. Actualmente está integrado por: Graciela quien vende postres; Catalina y Yessenia, comida; Inocencia, Teresa y Eva, zapatos; Aurelia, calzado y ropa; Jazmín, cosméticos; Emelia, costuras; Mirelia, ropa y cosméticos; Petra, refrescos; Gladys, calzado y batucada; Adalih, medicamento; Clemente, ropa y Milagros, comida típica.
   Gladys es la integrante más joven del grupo, decidió incorporarse para enriquecer su actividad actual y poder establecerse como distribuidor autorizado de calzado en un futuro. Inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo desde hace más de tres años para obtener ingresos con el propósito de pagar sus estudios universitarios. De igual forma junto con algunos de sus familiares integra una batucada, todas las tardes ensayan en su casa y cuando son contratados tocan dentro de su comunidad.
    Ella comenta, “soy feliz pues tengo lo que quiero y trabajo por lo que me hace falta" ya que invertirá en la compra de catálogos de una nueva temporada y adquirirá los pedidos solicitados por su clientela. 
   Otras palabras que quisieron hacer constar todos los integrantes fueron: "nuestras actividades nos han permitido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para las familias, es un orgullo recibir los frutos de nuestro esfuerzo, gracias por contribuir con los apoyos otorgados".
*La fotografía fue tomada en el espacio donde cada tarde ensayan los diferentes ritmos de la batucada, Gladys viste blusa blanca y está detrás de doña Aurelia quien viste falda café.
texts.en:
In a community in Veracruz a famous locomotive called "The Beast" ran three times a day, generally transporting sugar or special materials, depending on the season of the year. The inhabitants can still remember when that train was the only means of transport. Now it has been replaced by a bus.

In this community, originated the group called "The Nicknames." Its title refers to the nickname of the woman who initiated the group. At present, the group is composed of these vendors: Graciela, desserts; Catalina and Yessenia, meals; Inocencia, Teresa and Eva, shoes; Aurelia, shoes and clothing; Jazmin, cosmetics; Emelia, dresses; Mirelia, clothing and cosmetics; Petra, soft drinks; Gladys, shoes and the percussion band; Adelih, medicines; Clemente, clothing; and Milagros, typical meals.

Gladys, the youngest member of the group, decided to join in order to enrich her present activities and to become established in the future as an authorized distributor of shoes. She began selling shoes from a catalog more than three years ago to have an income, with the goal of paying for her university studies. She also joined, together with some members of her family, in order to create a percussion group. Each afternoon they practice in her house and, when they are contracted they perform in the community.

Gladys comments, "I am happy since I have what I want and I work for the things I lack, since I have invested in purchasing catalogs for a new season and acquired orders solicited from my clientele."

Other comments the members wishes to make include, "Our activities have permitted us to offer a better quality of life for our families, and we are proud to receive the fruits of our efforts. Thanks for contributing with the help offered."

*This photograph was taken in the space where each afternoon, they practice the different rhythms of their percussion group. Gladys is wearing a white blouse and is behind Aurelia who is wearing a brown skirt.

loans.use: purchase sales catalogs and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 38 years old from Jagna, Bohol. She is married and her three children are still attending school. To provide for them she works hard in her Sari-sari (general)store business.
As a way of keeping her store profitable, she make sure that her inventory is replenished on-time.

Arsenia is asking a loan to buy vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachet, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef.

In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachet, powdered detergent, coffee, matches and shampoo.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao is a 35 years old man who lives with his wife and two children who are attending school. He engages in purified bottled water selling in his community. He has provided this service to nearby villages and on the street. He has been running this business for 3 years.

He had stored many barrels of water, for which he needed a means of transport. For this reason he requested a loan of CNY20000 from Microcred to buy a minibus. This is his first loan.

With the loan, Chao would delivery more barreled water to far away streets, since he earns his daily living this way for his family. He must keep going like this, for his need to earn enough money to support his two children's education fees.

Chao hopes that his children will be professionals and he hopes to send them to university with income earned from his business. He also hopes to able to buy a house for them in the future.

loans.use: to buy a minibus for local water delivery

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 85 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, chips, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like softdrinks, biscuits, chips, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
Un grupo veracruzano lleva el nombre de Las Lomas y sus raíces provienen de la cultura prehispánica mazateca. Los adultos hablan al cien por ciento su lengua originaria mientras que los jóvenes hablan alguna de las 5 variantes que se han desarrollado. La mayor parte de la población mantiene conversaciones con dicha lengua y si aprendieron español fue para poder transmitir su cultura y trabajo.
   El nombre del grupo se debe a la inclinación que la mayoría de las calles tiene, las cuales forman erupciones parecidas a las lomas. Cabe mencionar que la adrenalina de las pendientes crean demasiada adrenalina y sólo muy pocos se atreven a recorrerlas con algún vehículo rápido. Los integrantes son: Ángel, Eugenia y Cenobia quienes invertirán en pescado; Guadalupe, en bordados; Claudia, en abarrotes; Magdalena, Irma y Lucia, en cosméticos; Evelia, en postres y comida típica; Jeny y Ana, en comida y Marcelino, en un taller mecánico. 
   Evelia es madre de dos hijos los cuales continúan estudiando y dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo. Su única motivación es ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente ya que es una oportunidad que no tuvo cuando era pequeña.  "Uno quiere progresar y salir adelante" comenta Eve, como le llaman de cariño, quien desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de comida y postres. Tras especializarse con cursos impartidos en su localidad, ahora es una especialista en dichos alimentos. "Se tiene que trabajar, pues el dinero no va caer del cielo" agrega y por ello se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano para tener todo listo para el momento en que llega el primer cliente. 
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de leche, huevo, gelatina, yogurt, harina, levadura, mantequilla,  aceite, carne y tortillas. Su objetivo principal es ser una empresaria exitosa, tener mayor estabilidad con su negocio y "ya no depender de ninguna persona" expresa.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo Las Lomas, la fotografía fue tomada en casa de Eve quien sobre una mesa exhibió sus gelatinas y algunos de los ingredientes empleados en la elaboración de sus postres. Ella viste blusa a rayas color azul con blanco.
texts.en:
This group from Veracruz is called Las Lomas. The members' roots date back to perhispanic Aztec times. All the adults speak 100% their original native language, while younger people speak one of the five varieties that have arisen. The majority of the local people hold conversations in their native tongue, and if they learn Spanish, it is to pass on their couture and for work.

The name of the group was chosen because the majority of the streets are steep (loma means hill). It should be mentioned that adrenalin results from climbing the steep slopes, and very few people dare to drive their vehicles fast on the streets.

The group members are Ángel, Eugenia, and Cenobia who earn their living from fishing; Guadalupe embroidery; Claudia selling groceries; Magdalena, Irma and Lucia selling cosmetics; Evelia pastries and traditional food; Jeny and Ana selling meals; and Marcelino is a mechanic.

Evelia has two children who are still at school and are dependent financially on her and her husband. Her sole motivation in life is to see her children get good jobs since they have opportunities that she didn't have when she was young.

Eve (her nickname) says that she wants to progress and get ahead. For ten years she earned her living making and selling food and pastries. Later she took courses given in her locality and became a specialist in these foods. She notes that everyone has to work; money doesn't just come from the sky. So every morning she gets up early so she is completely organized by the time her first customers arrive.

Evelina plans to use the loan money to buy milk, eggs, gelatine, yoghurt, flour, yeast, butter, oil, meat, and tortillas. Her main goals are to be a successful businesswoman, to have a more financially stable business, and not to be dependent on anyone.

This photograph of the members of Las Lomas was taken in Eve's house. On the table can be seen the jellies she makes along with some of the ingredients. Eve is wearing a blue and white striped top.

loans.use: buy milk, eggs, gelatine, yoghurt, flour, yeast, butter, oil, meat, and tortillas.

loans.name: Lunita

texts.en:
Lunita lives with her life partner and no daughter. She sells eggs, coffee and other groceries items that very useful in our daily needs . She has has her business for 2 years. The advantage is that she already has an established customer base with which she can earn daily income for her family. She learned the business with her mother's support.

Lunita is requesting a loan from GDMPC amount of 7,000.00, to purchased items for her general store. What she's looking for is to be able to increase her profits since she would have more products to be able to offer her customers and the general public. Also, it helps her to be able to give a better stability to her family.

Lunita seeks to achieve her dream, which is being able to have a larger and more stable business in order to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items of her general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old, married and has twelve children. 

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Virginia has been pig fattening for 18 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support three children. She is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Francisca requested a PHP 5400 loan through NWTF to buy a sanitary toilet.

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to make her surroundings clean away from any sickness or infectious diseases that may risk her family health.

Francisca is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health problem.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, cement, galvanized iron, nails, etc for her sanitary toilet construction.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 36 years old and has six children.  Leah is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Leah has been raising pig for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Leones

texts.en:
Leones is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by  in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her her pigpens.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Leones dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her her pigpens.

loans.name: Lelianita

texts.en:
Lelianita is 47 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Lelianita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma works hard to support her family. Selma is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Selma has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Selma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 23 años de edad, una persona luchadora, soñadora, que se proyecta como un gran empresario.
Gracias a un amigo aprendió todo lo relacionado con la confección, peor no se conformó con solo ser un trabajador, busco los medios para comprar una máquina e inicio con su propia línea de ropa, confeccionando camisas.
Inicio su negocio en el año 2014 y ahora que cuenta con un recorrido, piensa que este fin de año es el momento ideal para catapultarse hacia el progreso, con una apuesta agresiva de prendas para distribuir en almacenes y posiblemente en pueblos y veredas.
Brayan para lograr sus objetivos necesita de tu apoyo, por ello con mucho entusiasmo y expectativa quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir la totalidad del dinero en tela, con la cual confeccionara sus camisas lo más pronto posible para salir a venderlas, esperando recaudar buen capital y lograr adquirir clientela.
texts.en:
Brayan is a young man of 23, a hard-working, visionary person who presents himself as a great businessman.

Thanks to a friend, he learned everything related to sewing, but he wasn't content with only being a worker. He sought the means to buy a machine and begin his own line of clothing, making shirts.

He began his business in the year 2014, and now that he has a track record, he thinks that this year-end is the ideal time to launch himself forward, with an aggressive bet on clothing items to be sold in stores and possibly door-to-door or along the street.

Brayan, in order to achieve his objectives, needs your support. For that, with much enthusiasm and hope, he wants to apply for a loan to invest entirely in fabric, with which he will make his shirts as soon as possible in order to go out to sell them, hoping to take in a good amount of capital and acquire a clientele.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make his own line of clothing.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Phen is 33 years old and widowed. She is blessed with a school-age son. This breadwinner makes a living through growing rice and working for her neighbors for a fee. She earns about USD9 per day and can save about USD3 each day. Drought and insect pests, which destroy her rice crop, are challenges to her. 
She is now leading a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to improve rice yields. She hopes to increase more income to support a living and send her son to school until he finishes school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to improve rice yields to keep her son in school. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Vichhet's Group

texts.en: Vichhet’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vichhet makes a living cultivating rice. He also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns a living which comes mainly from fishing. She sells fresh fish, crabs, and clams. Aside from fishing, she also engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed to locals in her place.

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Her husband's catch is used for consumption and as a source of income.

She is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to invest in seaweed seedlings, a fishing net and laborer fees. In this way she will be able to cope with demand. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well.

For the future, she is hopeful that she will continue to improve both her sources of income to become sustainable. Elizabeth is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in seaweed seedlings, a fishing net and laborer's fees.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
Nurali is 18 years old. He is a freshman in the Environmental Management and Sustainable Development concentration of Liberal Arts and Science Division at AUCA. To be an environmentalist is his childhood dream. When he studied at school, Nurali promised himself that he will try to do something great which will help not only his village, but also will support his country, and the whole world.

He says that maybe the said is too big for him now, but will be achievable while he will graduate from the university and work. He is confident in himself that everything is possible by making little steps and going step-by-step in the future.

Nurali wants to be an educated person, because he believes that a bright future is reachable just with the help of quality education. He has two elder brothers and a little sister. For his parents it is difficult to pay for three students’ university tuition fees at the same time. His father often repeats to his sons that they have to study very well because they cannot do manual work always. They have to find money with their heads/brains instead of their hands.

Nurali thanks all Kiva lenders for their attention and hopes to be heard.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and married with five children who are in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Grace has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María con 59 años de edad, de estado civil casad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Rosa María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de corral, para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa mejorar productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los habitantes de la zona.

Rosa María es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 59 years old, and she is married. She lives with her husband and son in a rural zone in the district of Oyotún, which is in the province of Chiclayo and the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The residents of this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.

Rosa María raises and sells animals, and she has more than ten years' experience in this occupation. Her business is located at her home.

She is requesting a loan in order to repair the infrastructure of her livestock pen and to purchase more animals. Such an investment will help her to have a wider variety of animals, and will have a great influence on the business. In this way, she plans to improve the productivity of the animals, in order to meet the diverse needs and tastes of the residents of the zone.

Rosa María is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair the infrastructure of her livestock pen and to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ruth is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ruth has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more root crops to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell.

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl es un tendero por tradición, él es oriundo del municipio de Teorama Norte de Santander y llegó hace siete años al municipio de Barranquilla para aperturar su negocio de tienda de víveres, actividad a la que se ha dedicado durante toda su vida laboral.  Saúl es padre soltero de una niña de tres años de edad a quien ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo y su principal meta es velar por su buena educación académica que le garantice un futuro promisorio, por ello es muy comprometido con su negocio y en el trabaja todos los días de la semana en un horario bastante extenso; apertura a las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 11 p.m.  Sus principales clientes son residentes del barrio donde vive al sur de Barranquilla y realizan sus compras de los principales productos de la canasta familiar.  En la actualidad desea realizar una inversión de activos fijos que le garantizarán una mejor conservación de productos lácteos, bebidas, carnes, embutidos, frutas y verduras, es por ello que aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en su proyectos y comprar una nevera vitrina y un enfriador.  Esta inversión permitirá una mejor exhibición de alimentos y la conservación de los mismos.  A futuro Saúl se proyecta como propietario de un local en el que ahorre el actual gasto en canon de arrendamiento.
texts.en:
Saúl is a storekeeper by tradition. He is a native of the municipality of Teorama Norte de Santander and seven years ago came to Barranquilla to open his grocery store. He has worked in this activity all his working life.

Saúl is a single father of a three year old child for whom he provides well being with the fruits of his labor. His main goal is to watch over her education which would guarantee her a promising future. So he is very committed to his business. He works every day of the week with a fairly extensive timetable. He opens at 6 am and closes at 11 pm. His main clients are residents of the neighborhood he lives in the south of Barranquilla and where he makes his purchases of his main products of basic food items.

At this time he wants to make an investment in fixed assets which will guarantee the preservation of his dairy products, drinks, meats, cold cuts, fruits and vegetables. So he has applied for a loan, his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in his projects and buy a cooler display case and a fridge. This investment will allow him to display his foods and preserve them better. In the future Saúl sees himself as the owner of a shop which will save him the expense that he now has leasing his store.

loans.use: to buy cooler displaycase and a fridge.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. Six years ago she decided to start her own business to support her husband in providing for their family. She specializes in selling religious veils.

Her shop is located in a commercial zone, where she is working hard to develop it as much as she can to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Iman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a collection of newly-released winter clothes. She wants to diversify her products so women can shop for all of their needs in one place.

At the beginning Iman had financial obstacles which limited her business development, but she decided to continue and slightly increase her capital to better serve her clients. She is experiencing an increase in sales, and she invests her profits in business development. Iman is planing to open a larger shop that includes products for the whole family.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a newly-released winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Nails Group

texts.es:
En el centro de ciudad conocida como “La novia del sol” están establecidos la mayor parte de los comerciantes por lo que es común ver llenas sus calles tanto de visitantes como de lugareños. Allí se integró el grupo llamado Nails cuyos integrantes tienen en común el amor por su familia y la pasión que sienten por las ventas y el trato con los clientes. Ellos son: Roberto R., quien invertiría en un club de nutrición; Estefanía, en calzado; Verónica, en ropa; Roberto A. y Armando, en comida; Patricia, en una estética y Elisa, en ropa, calzado y accesorios.
   Elisa es mejor conocida como Eli por todos sus familiares y amigos, de igual forma es conocida por su dedicación y entusiasmo hacia su trabajo. Es madre de un menor quien estudia por las mañanas mientras que por las tardes ayuda con las labores del hogar. 
   Desde hace 4 años decidió incrementar sus ingresos con el propósito de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, fue así como abrió un local de ropa en el centro de la localidad. Gradualmente la actividad ha incrementado, en parte gracias al servicio inigualable que brinda a sus clientes, los precios que están por debajo de los de su competencia y la amplia variedad de mercancía que ofrece. Hoy en día gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo mudarse a un nuevo local además de haber integrado la venta de calzado, bolsas de mano, carteras, cinturones, entre otros artículos de moda. Por tal motivo, ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones, faldas, playeras, shorts para no detener el crecimiento de su negocio.  
   Los planes que tiene a futuro son incrementar las ventas y abrir un nuevo establecimiento para forjar un patrimonio familiar; "me encuentro muy feliz con mi familia, con el éxito de mi negocio y voy por más" comenta entusiasmada.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el local de Eli quien abre de lunes a domingo de 9:00am a 6:00 pm; ella es quien viste una blusa roja.
texts.en:
Most traders are established in the city centre known as “the bride of the sun”. That´s why it´s normal to see its streets crowded with both visitors and locals. The group called Nails was integrated there. Its members have in common the love for their families and the passion of selling and treating clients. They are: Roberto R.who is going to invest in a nutrition club; Estefania, in shoes; Verónica, in clothing; Roberto A. and Armando, in food; Patricia, in a beauty salon and Elisa, in clothing, shoes and accessories.
Elisa is better known as Eli to all her family and friends. Likewise, she is known for her commitment and enthusiasm towards her work.
She is the mother of a minor child who is going to school in the morning while in the evening he is helping with the domestic work.
4 years ago she decided to increase her income with the purpose of offering a better quality of life for her son. That´s why she opened a clothing store in the centre of the town. Gradually the activity increased, partly thanks to the incomparable service she offers for her customers, the prices which are below those of her competitors and the great variety of merchandise she provides.
Thanks to the earnings she obtained, currently she was able to move to a new location, besides of having integrated the selling of shoes, handbags, purses, belts, among other fashion articles.
That´s why she requested a loan to buy blouses, trousers, skirts, shirts, shorts in order to not inhibit the growth of her business.
Her plans for the future are to expand her sales and to open a new establishment to forge a family heritage. "I´m feeling very happy with my family, with the success of my business and I´m reaching for more" she commented excitedly.
*The foto was taken in Eli´s shop which is open from monday till sunday from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. She is the one wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, skirts, shirts,  shorts

loans.name: Nore

texts.en:
Nore is 58 years old, married with six children. One of her children is in school and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nore has a general store business in the Philippines. Nore requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of items like canned good, school supplies and other personal care products to sell.

Nore has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Nore would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items like canned good, school supplies and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Godfrey. He is married and has three children, two teenagers and a toddler. His two older children go to school. Godfrey says he struggles to take care of his wife and children.

He recently completed training with Zoona to start running his own mobile money transfer business so that he can have an income and realize his dream of running his own business. Godfrey is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a Zoona branded booth where he can operate his business.

The loan will also provide the essential funds needed for Godfrey to serve his customers. The business will enable people in his community to send and receive money in a safe environment. He says the banks are very far from his location and as such people have to go long distances to access financial services.

Godfrey is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will be able to earn an income that will make providing for his family much easier. He explains that, with his children in school, he needs to be able to pay their school fees.

loans.use: purchase a Zoona branded booth where he can operate his business.

loans.name: Segundo Francisco

texts.es:
Segundo Francisco con 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y su hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico,con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 35 años, cuenta con puesto propio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería y otros gastos diversos.

Segundo Francisco cuenta con experiencia crediticia, en Edpyme Alternativa es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Segundo Francisco is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, departament of Lambayeque in Perú. He has good personal and work references from the neighbours of the area. The residents of the area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
He's had his own business selling plastic products for more than 35 years. He's requesting the loan to buy merchandise and cover other expenses.
Segundo Francisco has a credit history with Edpyme Alternativa; this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and cover other expenses.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, 41, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Fe has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: La Guacamaya Group

texts.es:
Dentro del estado de Veracruz, la presa Miguel Alemán sirve como una de las principales actividades económicas debido a la pesca. De igual forma la fertilidad de la tierra propicia la siembra de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol, limón, naranja, plátano, canela, níspero, entre otros. En una de las comunidades cercanas a dicha presa se consolidó el grupo llamado La Guacamaya pues sus integrantes admiran a esta ave por ser exótica y originaria de la región. Ellos son: Adolfo quien vende tortillas y maíz; Marco, refresco; Yesenia, mariscos y Angélica, Alondra, Lilia y Ángela, comida típica.
   Yesenia es una de las nuevas integrantes dentro del grupo, en su comunidad todos la conocen como Yesi pues es una persona agradable y alegre.  Tiene dos hijos quienes continúan estudiando, por tal motivo se convirtió en comerciante y ahora cuenta con 11 años de experiencia en la venta de mariscos dentro de la localidad. Su esposo viaja hasta otro estado del país para poder comprar la mercancía más fresca y así poder ofrecer la mejor calidad a sus clientes locales.  Actualmente se estableció en un pequeño espacio afuera del mercado donde coloca una gran nevera con hielo, una mesa, la báscula y una silla en donde descansa mientras no tenga clientes. "Mi sueño es poder establecerme en un local fijo e incluir la venta de cocteles para incrementar mis ganancias” comentó contenta.  
   Este es el primer apoyo que solicita y lo invertirá en la compra de camarón, jaiba, robalo y pulpa de camarón para continuar con el significativo crecimiento de su actividad. Yesi expresó en una de las variantes de la lengua mazateca el amplio agradecimiento que tiene para con la gente  que hace posible dichas ayudas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en un antiguo pozo, Yesi es quien viste blusa a rayas.
texts.en:
In the state of Veracruz, the Miguel Alemán Dam contributes to fishing, one of the principal economic activities. In the same manner, the fertility of the land contributes to the sowing of sugarcane, corn, beans, limes, oranges, bananas, cinnamon, and loquats, among others. The group called La Guacamaya [The Macaw] is based out of one of the communities near the dam. The group’s members admire the bird that their group is named after because it is exotic and native to the region. The members are: Adolfo, who sells tortillas and corn; Marco, soft drinks; Yesenia, fish; and Angélica, Alondra, Lilia, and Ángela, who sell traditional food.

Yesenia is one of the new members of the group. In her community everyone knows her as Yesi because she is a sweet and happy person. She has two children who are pursuing an education, and for this reason she became a merchant and now has 11 years of experience selling seafood in the town. Her husband travels to another state in the country in order to purchase the freshest goods and be able to offer the best quality to their customers. Recently, she has set up in a small space outside of the market where she has a refrigerator with ice, a table, a scale, and a chair for her to rest in when she doesn’t have customers. “My dream is to have a permanent business premise and to include the sale of cocktails in order to increase my profits,” she said happily.

This is the first time she’s asked for financial support, and she’ll use it to buy shrimp, crab, snook, and shrimp pulp in order to continue with the meaningful growth of her business. In one of the variants of the Mazatec language, Yesi expressed the huge thanks that she has for the people who have helped her with this support.

*The photo was taken in front of an old well. Yesi is wearing blue stripes.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crab, snook, and shrimp pulp.

loans.name: Herilalao Thierry

texts.fr:
41 ans, marié, Thierry est un père de famille très attentionné, consciencieux et responsable. Sa femme est institutrice dans une école privée. Le couple a trois enfants et ils sont tous scolarisés.
Il exerce une activité génératrice de revenu de vente de friperie. Il y était depuis 2000. Avant, il était employé salarié dans une entreprise privée. La raison de son arrêt était d'ordre santé.
En tant que père de famille, il doit s'efforcer d'entretenir et supporter sa famille selon ses dires, c'est pourquoi, il cherche toujours les moyens pour améliorer son activité. En plus, la famille habite encore dans la maison de ses parents et il envisage d'en construire une dès que ses épargnes lui permettront.
texts.en:
A 41-year-old married man, Thierry is a very attentive, conscientious and responsible father. His wife is a primary school teacher at a private establishment. The couple has three children who all attend school. 

He makes a living selling second-hand clothes, which he has done since 2000. Before this, he was salaried employee within a private company. He stopped this due to health reasons.

According to Thierry, as a father, he must strive to support and provide for his family. This is why he is always looking for ways to improve his business. Additionally, the family still lives in his parents' house and he aims to build one as soon as his savings will allow him to.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing: jeans, t-shirts, polo shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Yesneris Paola

texts.es: Yesneris es una mujer de 20 años muy trabajadora y amable, que emprendió su propio negocio de ventas de mercancías, bebidas y comidas típicas en el año 2014. Desde la comodidad de su vivienda elabora y comercializa picadas, receta que aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó a prepararlas, las cuales son comida rápida muy consumida en la costa caribe.  Así mismo aprovechó el espacio de su refrigerador para conservar cervezas y en el congelador cubetas de hielo, productos de alto consumo, también esta emprendedora aprovecha sus habilidades sociales para promocionar mercancías varias a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares.  Yesneris está comprometida y con el fruto de su trabajo aporta a los gastos en el hogar y desea que su negocio cada día sea más próspero para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder acceder a la compra de su vivienda.  En la actualidad solicitó un credikiva, que es una oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  para contar con el capital necesario e invertir en canastas de cerveza al por mayor que le garanticen una disminución en los costos.  Esta inversión será de éxito y la ayudará a cumplir con sus anhelos.
texts.en: Yesneris is a hardworking and friendly 20-year-old woman who started her own business selling merchandise, beverages, and food in 2014. From the comfort of her home, she makes and sells snacks with recipes she learned from her mother who would teach her to prepare foods that are widely consumed in the Caribbean. She also took advantage of the space in her refrigerator and freezer to keep beer and ice which are objects that are often consumed. She sells using her social and entrepreneurial skills to promote various products among friends, neighbors, and family. Yesneris is committed and the fruits of her labor contribute to the costs of her household. She wants her business to be more prosperous every day to improve her quality of life and purchase her own house. This is her first Kiva loan, an opportunity through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to have the capital she needs to invest in cases of beer she will purchase wholesale to reduce costs. This investment will be successful and help her meet her goals.

loans.use: to purchase cases of wholesale beer

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 39 años es una comerciante residente en un barrio al sur del municipio de Barranquilla que inició su negocio de venta de mercancías varias en el año 2005, ella encontró en esta actividad una oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales a los que su cónyuge aportaba para el beneficio de su grupo familiar. Ella se incorporó a una empresa multinivel motivada por una promotora que llegó hasta su vivienda para invitarla a una charla, en la que informaban acerca de los beneficios que podían acceder aquellos que emprendiera esta actividad; Luz Marina muy optimista se inscribió y al poco tiempo logró realizar su primer pedido con mucho éxito y acogida de parte de vecinos, amigos y familiares.  A partir de ese momento continuo con muy buenos resultados y siguió vinculándose con otras empresas de multinivel para ampliar su oferta.  En la actualidad está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar las ventas que genera a crédito y encargos de sus clientes; prendas de vestir, calzado, perfumes y productos de belleza, productos de gran demanda en la temporada navideña. A futuro Luz Marina le gustaría incursionar con un restaurante pues tiene amplios conocimientos de culinaria y su meta familiar es costear los estudios académicos y profesionales de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 39 years old, is a merchant and a resident of a neighborhood to the south of the Barranquilla municipality, who began her business selling a variety of merchandise in the year 2005. She found in this activity an opportunity to generate an additional income to those that her spouse provided for the benefit of her family.

She joined a multilevel business, motivated by a promoter who came to her home to chat, during which she informed her of the benefits that those who launch this activity could access. Luz Marina very optimistically signed up and in a short time was able to carry out her first order with much success and welcomed by her neighbors, friends, and family members. From that moment, she has continued with very good results and continued by linking to other multilevel businesses to expand her offerings.

Currently, she is applying herself to requesting a loan, her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to fund the sales that she generates on credit and her customers’ orders: items of clothing, footwear, perfumes and beauty products, high-demand products in the Christmas season.

In the future, Luz Marina would like to make an incursion into the restaurant business since she has plenty of culinary knowledge, and her goal for her family is to pay for her daughters’ academic and professional studies.

loans.use: to fill her customers' orders: items of clothing, footwear, perfumes and beauty products, high-demand products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam de 51 años es una microempresaria que desde joven estuvo influenciada por el comercio de diversos productos puesto que siempre ha sido la principal actividad y fuente de ingreso de su familia.  Ella es propietaria de un almacén donde comercializa prendas de vestir y calzado para toda la familia, así como accesorios de temporadas, productos que oferta a su clientela de contado o les brinda facilidad de pago a sus clientes fieles, para no afectarles abruptamente su flujo de efectivo y lograr obtener una mayor utilidad. Miryam está dispuesta a promover su mercancía cualquier día de la semana, sin descuidar sus obligaciones de madre y cónyuge, puesto que planifica muy bien sus actividades para que no repercutan con su día a día. Como la temporada decembrina está cerca, Myriam realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios que propondrá a sus clientes para que cuenten con el ajuar apropiado para fin de año. A futuro Myriam desea tener otro almacén y brindar a su única hija una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Myriam is a 51 year old micro-entrepreneur who has been influenced from a young age by commerce and business since it has been the main activity and source of income for her family. She owns a warehouse where she sells clothes and shoes for all ages, as well as seasonal accessories. She sells her products cash but also allows her loyal customers to pay in instalments as to not affect their finances if they have a major purchase.
Myriam promotes her business any day of the week without it affecting her responsibilities as a mother and a wife because she plans her activities very well.
Since the Holiday season is approaching, Myriam is requesting a loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in buying clothes, shoes, and accessories to offer her clients for having the appropriate clothes for the end of year celebrations.
In the future, Myriam wishes to have another warehouse and offer her only daughter an excellent education.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Dziwika Group

texts.en:
Ayana is 39 and married. Her husband works as a transporter. She has five children and nine orphans who depend on her.

Ayana owns a restuarant. She is going to buy maize flour, meat, fish, etc. for the restuarant. Profits generated from this business will be used to pay school fees and medical bills for the children. A family member helps with the day-to-day activities of the business. She started this business to become self-dependent and to support her husband in paying for household expenses.

Ayana hopes to own a building where she will run her business. She also hopes to employ two or three people in her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, meat, fish etc. to stock up the restaurant.

loans.name: Wilson Rafael

texts.es: Wilson de 57 años es un creativo microempresario que se dedica a la reparación de calzado y elaboración de artesanías en madera, actividades en las que cuenta con 40 años de experiencia.  Es padre de dos hijos mayores de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge una confeccionista de ropa, han logrado aportar a su hogar bienestar.  Wilson labora de lunes a sábado en el horario de 7 a.m. a 7 p.m. ofreciendo el servicio de remontadora de calzado y elaborando cuadros en madera, lámparas, floreros, percheros y demás artículos que se puedan realizar en este material.  Sus principales clientes son habitantes del barrio donde reside al sur de Barranquilla y familiares, y para continuar sus labores sin contratiempos  realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar pegamento, suelas de zapatos, tachuelas y madera para elaborar artesanías.  Esta inversión le permitirá realizar nuevas colecciones de artesanía y dinamizar las ventas. Su meta es ampliar su oferta de productos y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilson is 57 years old and a creative micro-entrepreneur who works repairing shoes and making wood handicrafts. He has more than 40 years of experience. He has 2 adult children and together with his wife, who works making clothes, they've been able to have a good home environment.
Wilson works Monday through Saturday from 7AM to 7PM repairing shoes and making wood frames, lamps, vases, hangers, and other items that can be made of this material.
His main clients are the residents of the neighborhood where he lives, to the south of Barranquilla, and family members. To continue with his work without delay he's requesting a loan, his first loan through Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy glue, shoe soles, studs, and wood to make his handicrafts.
This investment will allow him to make new collections of handicrafts and energize his sales. His goal is to grow his product offering and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy glue, shoe soles, studs, and wood to make his handicrafts.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a hardworking woman who grows maize, rice and beans as her major crops. She used the previous loan to plow and weed her garden.

She started rearing animals to get additional income. She was forced to start this business so as to sustain her family and educate her children; she has a dream of educating her children to university.

She complains of unpredictable weather changes.

Margret will use the loan to pay for labor to weed her garden.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed her garden.

loans.name: Chanthrea

texts.en:
Chanthrea, 27, is a married woman with two children in her care. She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns some income from runing a beauty salon. Her husband is a 29-year-old and he is a hairdresser. Chanthrea and her husband can earn approximately USD 19 per day.

For additional family's income Chanthrea and her husband want to open a motorcycle washing shop, so she would like to request a loan to buy materials for this. This loan will help her live in better conditions and improve her family’s finance.

In the future, she is going to expand her business and build a new house for a better living standard and to support her two young children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy materials for a motorcycle washing service.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and six children. Some of her children are still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family; he works as a farmer and also in parallel as a taxi driver.

Today, Fatmeh is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to be able to pay her children's educational fees. This is her second loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida con 49 años de edad,de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, productos naturistas, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 5 años,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de vivienda donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y confort a su negocio, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa incrementar su stock de productos para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Adelaida es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido un crédito de S/. 4000,00 el cuál a sido cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son in the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, departament of Lambayeque in Perú in a rural area. She has very good personal and work references from the nieghbors in the area. The residents of the zone mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
She has been selling cosmetics and natural products from her house for 5 years. She's requesting a loan to make improvements to her home, where her business is located. This investment will allow her to have a greater variety of products and a more comfortable space. She plans to increase her stock to attend to the diverse preferences and needs of the neighbors of the area.
Adelaida is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. She had a loan of S/. 4000,00 which was paid back on time.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home, where her business is located.
